description:
Can't believe I haven't left a review of The Chieftain.  Let's just say my wife and I love this place.  It's a relaxed atmosphere sports type bar and Irish Pub.  I hear it also used to be the Chronicle reporter's hangout way back in the day when newspapers meant something.  It's a cool place.

I watched Jonathan Sanchez pitch his no hitter here for the Giants.  I watched Kaep and the 49ers kick the Green Bay Packers ass here on opening day NFL a few years ago before he turned, uh, bad.  And I'm talking about his play not his politics.

We live in Sac and when we drive to SF for the weekend my wife and I try to hit this place along with Original Joe's.  You all should go.  Good beer, drinks, food, and fun.
author: David S.

description:
This will be pretty short because I only had an Irish coffee with some friends.  It was a one and done deal.  That said I really would have liked to have at least had lunch.  People all around us were eating and it looked so good.  The atmosphere is pretty cool kinda dark but with very cool carved wood.

The drinks were delicious.  We all got something different and all agreed that they were good.  I can give it more then three star considering one drink does not make for a very complete experience.
author: Melody K.

description:
Nothing fancy about this Irish pub other than it is a great place to go anytime of day.  For this visit I had the Irish breakfast for lunch.  Outstanding comfort food.  

They also have a good selection of single malts and Irish whiskey, and beer. Sadly, I had to return to the office.  Hope to return again soon.
author: P.Y. H.

description:
Food: Great Irish bar with full liquor menu and decent, albeit small, selection of wines. Good sides, but the real reason I prefer this place to every other Irish bar in town: they have a vegan impossible burger on the menu (get it without the bun for a complete vegan option). YUM! So delicious. They top it with sautéed veggies. So tasty! My husband is a not-vegan, wing eating slob and he loves the wings here. 

Service: Perfection. The bartenders are polite and chatty, and make mean mixed drinks. None of that trendy too-cool-for-you nonsense you'll find in hipster bars. The service at Chieftain make me with I lived close enough for this to be *my* neighborhood bar. 

Ambience: plenty of wood, comfortable seating, dim lighting. Traditional Irish-American bar aesthetic complete with awkward 70s disco hits soundtrack.

Overall, definitely worth a try. I intend to come back.
author: Shannon H.

description: They have an affordable happy hour with a lot of options. When We stopped in, close to HH being over we were promptly greeted, seated and ordered. Our server was friendly and attentive. The food did not blow me away, but it did the trick, especially for the price. I would pop in if I was in the neighborhood again.
author: Jacky J.

description: We just happened into this pug and discovered the Best Burger we've ever had! The Chieftain Burger was FULL OF FLAVOR with thick bacon, grilled onions and a fried egg on top. It was beautiful presentation as well. Friendly staff, good service, amazing Burger...we will definitely recommend!
author: Traci M.

description:
Came here for dinner earlier this week.  We had a few questions about the menu but the bartender kept interrupting us with "I don't even usually work nights".  Obviously, he didn't want us asking any questions.  His shift was ending soon and he started to push us to close our tab sooner rather than close it with the next bartender.  By that time, he was much more polite.  It's funny to me that when asking questions, he didn't want to give us service, but when it's time to pay and "TIP", he magically becomes polite.  

+1 star for the bangers and mash.  They were pretty good.
author: Richard T.

description:
Had dinner here with a group. I had a burger. It was cooked perfectly and was tasty. 

Spilt a potato ball appetizer. That was a deep fried piece of potato heaven. 

Waitress was extremely attentive. Had a few at the bar and the bartender was on point.
author: Brendan H.

description:
This restaurant/bar has impeccable staff, impeccable customers, and impeccable service 
It's a place you should definitely visit.

Oh and Ofcourse the food is great. Impeccable
author: Naeem C.

description:
This one I have mixed reviews on. My lamb burger was wonderful. Seriously, it made me so happy and was exactly what I was excited about in San Fran... the food. It was right by my hotel so I went out of convenience, and I'm always down for an Irish pub. They had decent beer selections, and the bartender was quick to make suggestions and let me try different ones. 

Food was authentic, beer was fresh,  mixed drink was pretty strong, and the crowd was low key. 

Here's the other side... when I got there, I sat at the bar as I usually do when I'm by myself and the bartender was so friendly, made a point to call me specifically by name, and overall just great service. then it was like a switch flipped and I couldn't get his attention to order another drink, even though he had been bringing me samples. It was night and day. But I still say go get some food. I will be back, but maybe at a table instead.
author: Allie W.

description:
At the Cheiftain to meet a friend for brunch. Was not expecting much as it is a pub. 

I was blown away. Every meal was prepared to perfection, cooked at the proper temperature and delightful! 

I typically stay away from eggs benny because I have a hard time with eggs when they are not prepared well.

See for yourself! Perfect!
author: Jean T.

description:
Best Fish 'n Chips. Ever.

Excellent, friendly service.

Seriously, the fish 'n chips are amazing. You really need to try them.
author: Rich F.

description:
Absolutely one of the best lunch places to visit. Mark the owner greated us talked a little about their 17th anniversary. I had their steak Irish nachos. Absolutely delicious. My friend had the buffalo chicken wrap and she obsessed with it that she comes back every Wednesday.

I will be coming back soon to eventually try their steak sandwich.
author: Alex A.

description: Awesome time during World Cup.  Great service from an enthusiastic crew.  The pricing is solid and the location perfect.  We showed up and were quickly served.  Probably the best place to meet friends to watch a football match or soccer if you aren't familiar with European terminology.  I highly recommend this place for having a great time with friends.
author: Sean D.

description:
Got kicked out because I didn't have a name tag -- no sign, no way to know it was a Salesforce takeover. Used to be our local watering hole, but an unfortunate way to end that relationship. 
Let customers know before they wait for a drink or food they won't get.
author: David M.

description:
Great place to hang out like a dive bar.
As for private party then the service level went down... either they are to tired or just don't like the job?

Over all is a great place to hang out
author: Kalani S.

description: I'd like to think of myself as somewhat of a connoisseur of buffalo wings so I was delighted to see "World Famous Buffalo Wings" on their menu. The sauce was fine, classic. But the wings were small and boney, not meaty enough. And the blue cheese was rubbish. Gotta ace main sauce, chickie, and side sauce for a 5/5! Also service was meh had to get up and get my server at her request... but it won't stop me from coming back. Who doesn't love an Irish pub? This one is quintessential. Maybe their burgers are better...
author: Erika F.

description:
Waitress was really nice and friendly. She was pretty attentive especially considering every seat was full. I liked the whole vibe of the place. An Irish person I was with, was actually surprised with how authentic of a pub vibe the place had.  

I got the special of the day which was a chicken pot pit. It was more of a soup with a pie breading on top but the waitress told me this before ordering. It was quite good and I was looking for something light so this worked really well for me.
author: Rose P.

description: Brunch was great.  Loved the atmosphere.  The beverage selection was very robust.  Location is perfect for those at the Intercontinental
author: Jared H.

description:
Popped in for a birthday brunch on a Sunday.  Surprisingly busy and packed for the area.  I would assume lunch/HH on a week day would be bangin', but even on a Sunday it was busy.

Anyhow, I ordered the Spicy Irish Potato Bites since I wasn't too hungry.  They're basically potato stuffed with cheese and some jalapeno remnants.  It wasn't spicy at all.  They have a sauce that comes with it and that IS spicy and that made it a good time.  They were slightly awkward to eat because of their size.  They were rather big and I couldn't eat them with a fork, so I just used my hands (not a big deal).  I think the plate had 7 or 8 of them.  I wish they were smaller in size like their name suggests.  They hit the spot and I was satisfied.

The waitresses: The one with the dyed red hair was nice.  The short blonde not so much.  They were both hungover and struggling.  There was no warm "hello" or any kind of welcoming introduction.  A lady was asking questions about sauces on a plate and the short blonde flippantly responded with "What sauce do you want?"  I didn't say anything, but internally, I was like "WOW!"  I definitely took notice of her attitude and made sure I said "please" and "thank you" during every interaction so I wouldn't be on the receiving end of all that.

I used to work across the street and have been here before - mainly HH.  The place was clean and looked the part.

My star rating:

4 for the business - food is ok.  Not bad, but not worth traveling across town for.

2 for the staff.  If you are the opening staff, it's best not to party and stay out late the night before.  C'mon ladies!  It's time for adulting!
author: Shaun W.

description: My husband picked this place out by googling it on the web.  It's a nice bar. The bartender was very nice!  The bathroom was clean. The surrounding people were social.  They have daily specials including happy hour. I had a spinach salad with strawberries and watermelon with poppyseed dressing.  It was fresh and tasty!
author: Patricia A.

description: Rude server with British accent! Asked me to leave because I was waiting for a friend at the bar and looked for a couple waiting there to replace! Such a greedy person! Couldn't wait for 10min so my friend arrives! Would never go back there and not recommended it to friends either!
author: S N.

description: Great little spot to enjoy delicious food and drink. Portions are large and flavorful. Servers are friendly and accommodating. Prices are beyond reasonable for the City.
author: Susan E.

description: Bartender Rob and crew are hilarious, kind and welcoming. Wonderful service, great Scotch selection and The Reuben was AMAZING!!! looking forward to coming back on our next trip
author: Meg R.

description:
We had a great time here last night. Walked in, Saturday night about 7pm and there was a table right inside the door. And it seemed to be steady like that, no one ever waited for a table. 

They had a limited menu because of st pattys day but that was fine. 
We had "Irish nachos" to start which was thick cut fried instead of corn chips. They were really nice, and just nice to have proper steak fries again. 
We had a shepherds pie and an Irish stew, both really nice, the shepherds pie was actually made with lamb!! 

The live music was great entertainment too! All round, a really great place.
author: Rowena B.

description:
Dayam! This place is literally across the street from where I work and I cannot believe how long it took me to come here for lunch. I seriously am mentally kicking myself for not coming here sooner. I think the reason why is because it's more a bar than a restaurant so alcohol is off-limits for daytime use--but I digress.

My cousin and I come here to celebrate her birthday for lunch and we order a bunch of apps along with a shared entree of fish and chips. Our server suggested we split the hot wings and the fish and chips since we wanted to try a lot of things on the app menu- which was nice because then we would have ended up with a lot of leftovers. Among those we also ordered the calamari and the potato balls (fried mashed up potatoes with jalepenos and cheese-- YUP-- ain't no carb snob here!)  

When our apps arrived, we were super excited and each app was a bite of heaven. I literally wanted to cry when I bit into the potato balls-- they were super sinful and delicious--it was that yummy! Perfect crispy balls of potato with cheese and jalepenos--but no fret for those who are fearing the spice because it's more the flavor than the spice in my opinion. The calamari was just as perfect with their aioli sauce (which I totally judge calamari on) and the hot wings were just as yummy then again-- it's really hard to screw up chicken wings. Every flavorful bite was a gift from God. :-)

Coming back?? FO SHIZ.
author: Sharon B.

description:
Great vibe inside, good service and good food!

The Guinness Draft is pretty darn close to the stuff I got in the UK. 

The Irish nachos is basically loaded fries with tomatoes, peppers, sour cream and some guacamole. Would have been slammin' with some ground lamb or sausage bits... the shepherd's pie was sensational with layers of flavor and great soda bread and butter. The Reuben Sandwich had pastrami that was less salty than most deli versions, yet had a deep beefy flavor. Awesome--it was served with crisp kraut that was probably brined then fermented. The lamb burger was juicy, and rich with crumbled blue. The fries were hot, fluffy and well seasoned. Heck, even the raw red onions were a bit sweet! The Corned Beef with Cabbage looked very plain... but the corned beef was really quite yummy!

Throw in the $100 for $75 deal and this place is even more awesome!

Everyone present was thrilled with the meal and eager to return.
author: Lu-Shien T.

description: I got the fish and chips and besides it being very oily from being fried, it tasted delicious. The service was great and the wait time for a table was very doable. I would come back here again for some quality food!
author: Carly S.

description: Good basic pub food with a bit of an SF twist. It can get a bit crowded and it is frustrating that half the time you go in,  the larger tables are "reserved" but no one shows up during your entire meal.  However the staff is friendly and the food is good.
author: Jerry M.

description: I had not been here in sometime so we decided to pop in for a nightcap and a snack.  I love that they have Kilkenny on tap, it's so good, like a creme soda beer.  We had the tortilla soup, wings and cheese/bacon fries.  Everything was great including the live music.  It such a special little place.  Glad to know nothing has changed!
author: La C.

description: Popped in for a little something to hold us over till dinner after arriving in SF. Conveniently located right across from our hotel. We only had 1 item off menu but it was really good. We had the Calamari. I know, who orders this at an Irish Pub, but so glad we did. It was delicious. Batter was light and great seasoning. Calamari was cooked perfectly. The Guinness was perfect as well. Will definitely stop in for full meal next time. I'm sure it can only get better. Plus atmosphere was fun and lots of people arriving for fun night out.
author: Cathy L.

description:
We visited SF for two nights.  Stayed at Hotel Zetta so this Pub was simply well located at first.  We enjoyed it so much the first time we came back a second time on the following night. 

Both days we toured all of SF, ate many places and tried many beers at many pubs.  This was the only one we visited twice

The food was excellent, the beer even better on both nights.  The gentlemen behind the bar was very efficient and honestly that's all I look for in a pub but he was pleasant also.

Next time I'm in SF, no matter where I'm staying, I'll be making my way here.

P.S.  Irish stew was on point
author: Sandra G.

description: So in the last few weeks I've been here about 6 times with my co works. Great place for lunch, with a tons of choices for food and drinks. Good music, three TVs and clean bar. This will be one of our new hot spots for lunch and dinner for sure.
author: Arian J.

description: Nothing super special about this place, yet I keep coming back. Just a friendly neighborhood bar full of locals. Food is meh. Drinks are good, but not cheap. At least they fill up my Bullitt + Ice though.
author: Cyrus A.

description:
Excellent Food, Spirits, & Service. The Guinness Stout was fresh, and tasty poured in a correct glass and a proper temperature and head. 
The food was great and authentic tasting. I had the burger with bacon and a egg and the beef was cooked through and was moist. The egg fried and was fresh NOT greasy. Bun was fresh and soft. Excellent steak fries as well.
Maria had the Irish Stew.... thank god she doesn't eat much because I thoroughly enjoyed several bites. This is what Irish Stew is supposed to taste like! Hearty with carrots, potatoes, and parsnip. And lamb and beef! Seasoned perfect. Served with soda bread! I'd recommend and I plan on visiting again when I'm in the Mosconni/ Financial district. Show them some love
author: John S.

description: Loved it! Great atmosphere, great service, great food! Had nachos and wings that were yummy. Fantastic selection of beers!
author: Lori K.

description: Don't bring in half-drank iced coffee from outside or they'll take it away from you because they "sell coffee", but they do have good food.
author: Mark R.

description: Great food, good selection of beers, and attentive and friendly staff. Highly recommend.
author: Kedrick D.

description:
They are pour happy here holy cow!

I came here with my friend to play some catch up one on one after dinner. 

Dylan was such a nice gentleman. He gave me a run through of what they had on stock. Suggested a few things (because I normally don't drink dark) and still had patience for me. 

I ended up ordering a Crown vanilla on the rocks, and honestly, I might have to say it might be my new favorite thing to drink. I eventually had to ask for some kind of soda as a chaser as it hit me hard after 30 min or so. The kitchen was closed by the time I got there, so I didn't any food. The bar got kind of busy, so we parted ways.  But I will definitely be back cause I had a lot of fun. Also there's the irish bartender with a pony tail, it was fun just listening to him talk. 

They have tv to watch some sports. They have a pretty good area to sit and chat or at the bar. They aren't cheap on their drinks either. Great bang for your buck. great atmosphere. go alone or go with friends you wont regret it.
author: Leme K.

description: Holy mother of baby Jesus. Not to be dramatic or anything, but this was literally top five meals of my existence. I had the salmon plate and the fish was seasoned PERFECTLY, cooked PERFECTLY, and the portion size was hefty. The meal was about $15, but the value (especially in this area) should've been around $25+. The service was great. I sat at the bar and my server had an Irish accent which was super cool. Seriously going to try to come here every week now. The coffee was too cute as well! Thanks for the great food! (The pastry was purchased elsewhere)
author: Tilly D.

description: Every once in a while, if you stick your head in enough bars, you find the kind of place that welcomes visitors and locals alike. The Chieftain is just such a place.  Entering on a recent Sunday morning, I had my choice between a Real Madrid soccer match, complete with a group of loyal fans, and several football games.  I started with a mimosa, then opened the special Yelp discount triggered by my check in.  The two attractive servers provided the right amount of attention and table check ins. The Guinness on tap was expertly poured, the shot of Jamison's flowed down my throat, and the wings were just what I wanted to tide me over as I hung out. Nice funky decor, a comfortable vibe, cool servers and clientele -- I will make sure to stop by my next visit to San Francisco!
author: Tim S.

description:
This is a pretty touristy pub in the middle of SoMa (walking distance from Moscone) so it's always busy.. and I do mean BUSY. If you want to stop in when there's *any* kind of conference in town, you'd be wise to call ahead and make a reservation. This place regularly turns people away.

The actual food and drinks are what you'd expect from an Americanized Irish Pub (decent, hearty stuff).. but my main complaint is it's always super packed + loud + it's not the type of pub you can easily drop into on a busy night.
author: Melissa T.

description:
Nice pub in the heart of the hustle and bustle of the city. Pretty lasses serving pints and good fare. This culchie and his wife were happy enough to go twice on our trip. Had pints, soup and salad the first visit. Soup was bland, but being Irish, we are used to the salt shaker. Second visit, we had a proper Irish breakfast. Pretty decent, but not my gran's...sigh. Only complaint really is that the tea is from a gun....make proper tea.

Good service, beautiful atmosphere that reminded me of home a wee bit.
author: Captain C. Branagain G.

description:
Its an authentic irish pub in the sf downtown... Its a chill spot to catch a game - it has several tvs....i tried their Irish Nachos... Wait, what!? For those who dont know, irish nachos are french fries with guacamole and sour cream ...the above are a little beyond my scope but the concept is cool... service is indifferent but what do you expect from a cool, acting like a tough guy ,dude ...

Hey, 
Its me again and i would like to update my previous review... This time i sat a table and ordered the Irish Nachos again(i guess i missed  it since my last visit), Harp beer (Delicious Irish pilsner beer)...in  my opinion, seating at a table is a better option due to a great, seamless, friendly service. Our server's name was Luke and he was awesome, fast, and efficient.  ...in addition , my sister, who is a regular, mentioned that their Shepard pie is to die for.
 To conclude, this place has great food,ambience,location and great service. I'll be back 100%
author: George B.

description:
They have some pretty good happy hour deals- $6 cocktails (the Moscow mule was really decent which surprised me for a pub), and the fried zucchini was yummy. The staff was also really attentive which was nice.

The beef sliders were meh, so you can probably skip those, I am curious about the corned beef sliders though, so I'll probably have to go back to give those a try.
author: Elena K.

description:
I come here to watch the Warriors play and have a drink or two. It gets pretty busy around that time but we always manage to find a seat.

I have tried the garlic fries and the calamari. They were a bit small on the portions, about 2 servings but we're definitely really tasty.
author: Lynn C.

description: This place had a great atmosphere and decent food for a decent price. The portions were fairly large and there was also live music being played.
author: Jarrett L.

description:
Love this place. I lived down the street from this place and this was my go to for when I needed a good meal. My favorite is the Chieftain Irish Stew with a Caesar Salad with anchovies. The fish and chips are amazing and the wings yummmmmm. The drinks are well poured and the service is DOPE. The manager Kelly there is a great dude and always nice to chat with when he's not running around doing his thing. Only one thing I would change is bartenders be a little more friendly, but then again they make it up in the good drinks. They also have amazing live music. 

If you're here visiting and are staying downtown this is a staple to visit!
author: Roberto M.

description:
Great comfortable and mid-level noise place to hang out with your friends! They serve food (never got it) but located centrally to pretty much everything, the Chieftain has a real pub-y vibe. The bartender is friendly and the people at the bar are  usually the older crowd who want to ask about your hometown and talk sports.
Their drink selection is pretty limited, but they have the popular and common beers at good prices for SF.
Gotta come back for some breakfast!
author: Grace P.

description: Myself and two colleagues had dinner at this Irish restaurant. The hostess was very friendly. The atmosphere was pleasant, although the piped in music could have been turned down. Not a major issue though. I had the corned beef and cabbage dinner. The beef was seasoned very well. The vegetables were a bit bland, but paired well with the meat. My colleagues had the Shepherds Pie and Irish stew.  I had the opportunity to sample both. I rank them as follows: the Irish stew, Shepherds Pie then the corned beef.
author: Bill S.

description: Excellent Irish pub!  We had appetizers and drinks tonight and everything was Excellent!  The bar tender (the guy with the pony tail, handsome) made excellent drinks!  The appetizers were great too!!! Our server was so friendly and worked hard to keep up with bringing our food and drinks!  When I come back to San Francisco, I will definitely go back to The Chieftain!  I'm really surprised at anyone who gives this place less than 5 stars! It's clean, yummy and a friendly place!  What more can you ask for??!! YUMMMMMMMY!!!!
author: Toni F.

description: This is one of my favorite places to catch a beer and some dinner when I am in San Francisco on business. It used to be the spot for the San Francisco Chronicle reporters to hang out and exchange notes after work. This is a true neighborhood bar in SOMA that attracts primarily locals but an occasional tourist or two will discover it. The atmosphere is lively and it can get very noisy because many of the locals know each other and work the crowds. Seating can be hard to find on weekend evenings. This place serves traditional Irish pub food and the dishes I have had have been excellent. I especially like the shepherd's pie but the fish and chips and beef and Guinness pie are excellent as well. I always enjoy coming back here.
author: Jim B.

description:
I have really liked this place for their breakfasts on weekend mornings - and the number of places offering a full Irish/English/Scottish/etc. breafast have really diminished in the city these days - but after coming here for years now I really was unhappy with my recent experience this past Sunday, hence my diminutive, two star rating.  The concerns I had were:

LACK/ABSENCE OF SERVICE - I had to get up and ask for soda bread (of course if I'm going for a full grill on a Sunday morning it's because carbs are going to be included).  This has been an issue the last couple of times when our non-primary server has delivered the food (our waitress this time made that point herself).

More so I had to either get up from my table to find a server or wave to get refills/addtional items/the check when there were maybe three parties to serve in the entire place while a bartender and two servers were on duty (this is not at all a big restaurant).

Also, a party entered, asked to sit at a "reserved" table (which for years I can't remember ever being occupied by its "intended party") who were seated elsewhere and soon decided to leave for another restaurant without ordering anything.

ATMOSPHERE - This has never come up before, but for some reason the red-headed bartender decided it was a good idea to engage an out of town couple in political talk.  It's Sunday morning, I'm at a bar, for breakfast, which doesn't feature anything but sports on the TV screens, but somehow this seems like the best forum to force other customers to have to listen to Joe Shmoe from Nowheresville's political views?  Even if they were preaching to or against the choir it was totally not the time or place for that (or at least keep your voices down so the other customers can enjoy their meals).

At the end, I would have rather stayed to buy more, but just ended up leaving as quickly as possible to spend my money elsewhere.
author: William C.

description: The Chieftain is our supporters club's go-to place for a majority of our Real Madrid watch parties. The owners and staff members are super friendly and treat us like one of the family. The food is delicious (fish & chips, chicken Caesar, quesadillas, etc.) and their liquor (they have my favorite Scotch, Aberlour) and beer selection is fantastic. It's a great place to check out sports on your lunch break. Thank you Chieftain for everything!
author: Kenneth J.

description: Great Caesar salad, as always. Tried the corned beef sliders (did sauerkraut and horse radish instead of cheese).   Really good! Ordered 2 more. Also tried pint and a shot of whisky. Happy hour $7. Great waitress. Always good place to go get good food and drink and hang out a bit.
author: Julie D.

description: I come here all the time with my best buds.  This week we came twice.  We actually had a deal a few years ago to try every pub in the Bay Area.  We learned that may not happen.   Once we find a spot we prefer to be regulars so our goal is shot.  This is one of those places we really enjoy since the vibe is friendly and the food is pretty good.  Live music sometimes.  The owner seems cool.   Who knew there were Irish Nachos?  The quirky menu items are a blast.  I'll be back soon.
author: Christian S.

description: I stopped by the Chieftain last night on my walk home from the movies (I saw Ready Player One, which was awesome), and I was not disappointed. The fish and chips was incredible. Ideally cooked and not over battered like some pubs tend to do. My beer was ice cold and poured to perfection. The wait staff was quick, attentive, and personable. The prices were fair and reasonable. The design of the bar had a relaxed and comfortable feeling that was conducive to eating dinner, or drinking all night.
author: Alexandra F.

description: We came here a few times while we stayed at the Intercontinental next door. The service and food were so good! Will defiantly find this place next time we go back to San Francisco.
author: Nicole B.

description: The Chieftain is a great place to meet friends & have a delicious meal. Great selection & great pub atmosphere! Staff are friendly & very attentive!! Great selection of beers & drinks.
author: Joni D.

description: I am in the city every 2-3 months and Cheiftain is an absolutely integral part of every trip. Mark runs an amazing, authentic Irish pub. Major plus,  the only where I know of in northern California to get Kilkenny!!
author: Robert C.

description: Bar tender rocks! Great recommendation for whiskey. Super pub atmosphere and great selection of tap beer.
author: Joel D.

description: Stumbled on this place and I'm so happy we did. We spent 5 days in the city and we had the best time here! Great food and drinks that were inexpensive. There was a band of like 20 people that showed up to practice and it was awesome! It's a snug fit but would it be a true Irish pub if it wasn't? We sat there for close to 4 hours listening to music, having great conversation with the locals, and just really enjoying ourselves. Top notch!!
author: Jae V.

description: I came here because this place was close to the hotel I attended a meeting at. I ordered a lamb burger and it was great. Beer was fresh. Service was friendly and the whole atmosphere feels authentic for the Irish pub.
author: James L.

description: Looked for a nice neighborhood bar with good food a couple of blocks away from all the tourists and came across the Chieftain Irish Pub.  Can't beat Irish bangers and mash in a great atmosphere.  Of course having a Guinness to go along with the food didn't hurt either.
author: Joseph C.

description: Great spot to go for a pint, a lovely bartender and some very quality fish and chips.
author: Connor O.

description: I went here twice during the business trip. it was amazing both the times. Guinness was perfect during the sunday brunch (friend egg dishes/sausages and so on). The next night, I ordered a Sheppard's pie (lamb): it was fantastic!! especially during the cold-rainy weather, it was a perfect combination with a nice cold beer and hot pie. Wait-staff was good and patient. I would go here again if I happen to be in the area.
author: Achal P.

description: This place is so great! Love the ambiance. Food was tasty.  We had two hardworking waitresses who took such great care of us, it was like they were in a competition with each other to meet our needs. Thanks Laura and team mate!
author: A. G. N.

description: I end up here almost every tine I am in San Francisco.  Great food, great drinks and a super friendly wait staff.  Our waitress last night was amazing, friendly and attentive.  Great atmosphere.
author: Peter R.

description:
I've driven by this place hundreds and hundreds of time but never stepped inside because of parking issues. But this time me and my 2 coworker mamas wanted to have happy hour dinner. I decided to yelp something that started happy hour at 3.... 

We found this place and also has a deal, $50 for $75. We split the $50 between us girls. 5 drinks, fried calamari, popcorn chicken, shepherds pie, stew, and salmon was around 94.00 which wasn't too bad... 

Basically with dessert and tip came out to be $30 per person... not bad! 

We were there around 3:45 and it was pretty empty so we were seated right away. It was nice to have tvs around playing baseball and  whatever sports and they do have a lot of seating. Towards the evening around 5ish, it started to get packed and it got really loud to the point where i couldn't hear my friends talk. But eventually it got better. 

We parked in the parking lot across the street, it's pretty pricey. If you know the area, try to find parking on the streets!!!!!
author: Eugenia W.

description:
BOY OH BOY HAS THIS NEIGHBORHOOD CHANGED. I remember this place as the old M&M bar where all the untrendy blue collar down in the dumps bike messenger construction workers day into nighttime drinkers lived hours a day. 

This pub is a good transition without being so urban elite. They've done a great job on the interior. Cozy with lots of wood and low lighting. The menu is typical pub grub and with a good dose of Irish. Decent prices and tasty. Perfect for famillies if you don't mind the hustle and bustle. Great beer choice and again not overpriced. And clean bathrooms!!!! Which  old M&M didn't have (always smelled like stale piss).

Definitely a revisit next time in town. Hey, if my menfolk were happy and content with fish n chips and burgs and this momma can have some beer while relaxing... it's a winner!
author: Helen K.

description: Was in town for a conference and wanted a place to watch the final game of the World Series.  I got there early, which was great cause it was Happy Hour!  There was hardly anywhere there, but as the night went on, it was packed.  A real happening place. The food was FANTASTIC!  The cider is just what I needed... and the best part, the staff. Just really awesome nice people.   It had a great vibe, lots of TVs to watch the game... all in all.. by far, the best part of San Fran.. was coming here!
author: Anna P.

description:
Great Irish vibe in here.  It's cozy inside with all the warm wooden atmosphere.  Plenty of room to chill, although it can fill up fast.  Several big screen tvs for your sports intake.

They're all friendly here and pretty attentive at making sure you're drinking when you want a drink.

I usually come here for the Clam Chowder soup on Fridays for lunch.  It's tough to find a place with consistent and tasty offerings of my favorite soup for life. 

Their Fish and Chips is another frequent plate of mine.  3 pieces of juicy and crispy cod!  Yes, it's crispy, greasy goodness. 

The buffalo wings are tasty and fall off the bone.  I would order it every time I come here but the price is just a little higher than its value in my opinion.

I've tried their burgers and I do not think it's their strong point.  I believe it's missing something that could make it awesome; maybe a special homemade spread or change the meat quality/seasoning.  I can't quite recommend how I would make it better.

If you have to eat a burger however, I'd recommend the Chieftain Burger.  The egg and bacon and all the fixings really tie together well.  Eat the egg separately if you want.

I had the NY Steak dinner and replaced the mashed potatoes with fries instead.  The steak quality left me wondering whether I should order it again...probably not.  

Their daily lunch specials are sometimes awesome.  I had steak cubes and fries one time and it was delicious. 

Calimari is always good.

Overall, a solid, fun place to hang out for eats and to get drinks on!
author: John M.

description:
Super pub.  If you want a no fuss, down to earth bar with pleasant, friendly, good service, and a general happy atmosphere,  you couldn't pick a better spot.

Despite being extremely busy last night (every table full with diners), every bar seat occupied and a traditional music session going on in one corner, the bar service was probably the best I've experienced in San Francisco.

As an Irishman living in San Francisco, I'm not  a huge fan of Irish pubs abroad but this place is definitely an exception and I would even suggest, a genuine, authentic Irish bar.
author: Stephen M.

description: Great little corner pub if you're looking for an escape from the ritz and commercialization of San Fran. The fish and chips was pretty darn good, but the Irish coffee was better. A little splash of coffee and cream with the Jameson. Perfect. We came Sunday evening and got to listen to live traditional Irish music. It was a great atmosphere.
author: Traci L.

description:
I was here with my friends the other night. Girls enjoyed. Love that Irish vibe it possess. 

Food is descent, service polite, in general great place for hanging out!
author: Haley M.

description:
Awesome friendly service! No kids!!! Great atmosphere! Real people great music and Zoe our waitress all have made this pub stop a wonderful respite on our anniversary drive.
We ordered fish and chips which we split and honestly it was just great.
Good fish properly coated and fried. Hit the spot. 
Please stop in for a pint or two you'll be glad you did. Say hello to Zoe if she's there.
Cheers! And have a great day!
author: David S.

description: Came here to watch the advertised ppv ufc match and they didn't even have it on. Waste of time
author: Natalie M.

description: It's a nice place, but the shepherd's pie was very very bland. The soda bread wasn't too tasteful either. I had to force myself to eat both. I love shepherd's pie and soda bread, but not from here. This place has my number one place for the worst shepherd's pie and soda bread. I will not be coming back here.
author: D C.

description: Amazing! Met two friends for lunch there yesterday.  We shared the spicy potato bites and wings - both were excellent.  The potato bites had a kick to them but weren't too spicy - they were unique as they were crunchy on the outside and hot creamy mashed potato goodness on the inside.  We had the lamb burgers - they come with blue cheese and sauteed onions and they are DELICIOUS!   My Martini was perfectly made and generous.  Service great.  Luckily we arrived just before the lunch crowd on a Friday because the place got packed.
author: Lisa B.

description: Fish and chips were extremely delicious! Great pub environment. Staff was very nice, and the service was quick. Went on a Sunday afternoon.
author: Gabriel S.

description: An oasis of common man civility for a boston soul on the left coast. Friendly bar keeper and lively crowd for a monday night.
author: Robert B.

description:
You want Irish pub? You got Irish pub. Chieftain is great to stop in for some beers with friends, though it gets crowded very fast during Happy Hour. The bartenders are super friendly and attentive. Crown Royal was also there that day and passed out samples of their new Apple Whisky. Bonus points! My friends and I ordered some appetizers, but they were unimpressive. Just your average bland bar food.

This is a great place to watch the game. I also heard they have trivia night, so I'd come back for that. Otherwise, this is not my choice of place to hangout. Meh.
author: Stefanie C.

description: The service was really quite wonderful! She was quick to great and offered a menu promptly. Drinks were prompt and with a friendly service. That where the positives end...the food tasted like frozen food heated up and was mushy. The "homemade" Bloody Mary mix tasted bland.
author: Angela B.

description: Had early lunch - they opened at 11:30 am on Friday,  Good beer selection and the St Archer's was great. Shepard's pie was terrific.  Got busy around noon. Service was super.
author: Graham H.

description: Pretty casual in a good way. At lunch they often have a little crowd watching soccer. I go there pretty much exclusively for their excellent buffalo chicken wrap.
author: Josh S.

description: Awesome service excellent choice of beer! I truly enjoyed the burger here and as I said the ladies that served me never let my beer get empty! I will return when I have more time to enjoy a more Irish type of meal!
author: Paul D.

description:
Where do you go on a chilly SF Monday night to catch some MNF, drinks and decent eats? The Chieftain, that's where. Especially if you're shacked up at one of the many hotels lining 5th. It's super convenient, very cozy, and sports a few TV's that can be seen from just about any seat in the bar. 

The setting is dark wood, very Irish pub style. The vibe is masculine, somewhere between benign and rowdy, and the menu is what you'd expect from a proper Irish pub. This includes a few Guinness pairings, plenty of Irish whiskey, a few cocktails, and a menu boasting salads, burgers, and mains that include corned beef & cabbage, shepherd's pie, and Irish stew. Hearty fare to soak up all that Powers you'll be downing. 

The service was plenty good and the food was tasty. The drink pours were measured (not hefty) and the prices were what you'd expect for this part of town. Overall this is an easy recommendation for a sports-focused meetup.
author: Don B.

description:
This is a hustling, bustling Irish pub on the corner- great for some bites, drinks and a game.  The place is pretty cozy, divy and loud.

The bf and I came here after the Folsom Street Fair.  They were packed to the brim, but our waitress was holding it down with her excellent, attentive, friendly service.  I enjoyed a Dark and Stormy (Meyer's dark rum, ginger ale and lime).  We both indulged in Shepard's pie and corned beef and cabbage.  The fries hit the spot.  My corned beef and cabbage was very tasty although dry.  The Shepard's pie was pretty good, but it could have used more meaty substance.  It was more like glorified mashed potatoes- with little else.  There is much better in the vicinity.

Either way, we'd totally come back to this lively venue for some casual drinks and bites- hopefully catching come live music too!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Great place to grab a bite, or drop in and grab a pint or two with some friends. Ive had the bangers and mash and Shepard pie in the past, and both were so good that I have decided to make this pub my go-to for an casual bite. Friendly staff, welcoming atmosphere... easy 5 stars from me.

Also, the Irish Nachos are amazing
author: Stuart B.

description: We had a great night with something for everyone. The shepherd's pie is fantastic and the Guinness is the proper stuff. Our server was even from Dublin. Good music too. We will be back!
author: Lee L.

description:
I used to think the best Shepherd's Pie is served on Valencia St, however the reality proved to be better than I thought: The Chieftain rises to be an absolute Shepherd's Pie champion!

Juicy flavored ground lamb is mixed with perfectly cooked peas, carrots, and onions, topped with lightly burned mashed potatoes crust. This dish is accompanied by home baked soda bread and brown gravy.

Now, the gravy deserves a word by itself. The tale has it, brown gravy is homemade on the basis of Guiness beer with spices and a secret ingredient. As a result, it gives the perfect balance to the Shepherd's Pie sweetness and brings your food experience to the whole new level. This is a truly great dish, you have to try it!

Chieftain's environment is cozy and homy. Barman Dany takes care of your comfort and makes sure you have everything you need. This is a good place to watch a game, stop by for the cup of beer, or lunch.

Great experience, I definitely will be back!
author: Julia G.

description: First time yelping but i had to sign up and leave a review. Staff is always super friendly . Especially love coming in when laura,melissa , robin and dylan are working . Come in for a good eggs benedict, football games and beatle songs in the background . Great live music on friday and saturday nights. Best pint of guinness in the city!
author: Daniel T.

description: Best Irish breakfast in the city! And they pour an excellent pint of Guinness. This is my go-to place for Irish food and drinks.
author: Sam B.

description: I've been here a couple of times.  It's nice but service can be a little slow.  The last time I was there it had an odd smell like really strong Clorox.  Still, the beer is good and the experience was fun.
author: Greta R.

description:
Pretty small place, but it's a good place to come for drinks or a filling meal. Get here early for lunch/dinner if you want to grab a table. The bar fills up pretty quickly. I can only speak about the fish and chips, which I've gotten twice over the course of two years. Average fish and chips. It wasn't the best I've ever had, but surely not the worst. I'm sure it's a great place for beers, but I can't give a review for that. 

Bonus: Very close to the moscone centers!
author: Jessica W.

description:
Calamari = good appetizer. $8.95.

Special of the night: oxtail with mashed potatoes and grilled brussel sprouts. Tender oxtail, buttery potatoes and addicting crispy, basalmic drizzled sprouts.  $15.95. 

My sister tried their cheeseburger, and it hit the spot, along with steak cut fries.  Once again, another good burger!  $10.95.

Service = friendly, albeit very busy. 

Prices = moderate. But I did get to take home leftover oxtail and potatoes.
author: Fannie S.

description: One of my favorite places to grab a beer, burger and some fries. The service here is amazing friendly attentive. They also serve a delicious crispy Fish and Chips.
author: Bedilia V.

description: Locals vibe, tourist crowd, friendly staff, good draft selection, great pours and really good traditional Irish Pub grub. Born and raised in the Bay Area, I know SF well and this is my go to go to bar whenever I am in this part of town.  Close to Moscone Center, Yerba Buena Gardens, SFMOMA and other SoMa Museums, and the huge 3 story Burlington Coat Factory!  Well worth the 15 minute walk away from more touristy expensive bars and digs of Union Square.   Try the corn beef and cabbage, the huge fish and chips or the burger, all excellent.  I also saw a lot of chocolate cake coming out...must be good!  I stuck to my usual Big Daddy IPA and didn't try the famed Moscow Mule, saw quite a few being happily downed by others. Also a great place to watch sports with large screen TV's from all angles and friendly social crowd.  I'm bringing my mother next time, for real! Cheers
author: Jeremy M.

description: Cheeseburger was delicious - fresh ingredients and hamburger was cooked perfectly!  Looked like a band was setting up when I was leaving.   Will definitely be back!
author: Katie H.

description:
Now this was a thoroughly unsettling experience...

Food: Was actually okay relative to the price.

Service: So I was seated at a dining table (not at the bar), and as I hadn't seen my server in about 30 minutes, I asked one of the bartenders if it was possible for him to close out my tab (they already had my credit card).  Instead of respectfully informing me that I would have to ask my server for the check as she was the one who took my order, the bartender actually screamed at me over the already loud music in the background and said he can't do anything as he wasn't my server.  

Had he actually been cordial to me, as would be expected from any business in the customer service industry, I would've totally understood.  However, screaming at a patron for asking a relatively harmless question seems like an extreme response and also completely unnecessary.  

I was able to get the attention of the server after about 10 minutes and finally settled the bill.
author: Kevin K.

description: Danny the bartender was excellent 2 days in a row!! Great service with a smile!! Great drinks and food!! Made me feel welcomed to San Francisco!!
author: Takiyah H.

description: Chieftains has the best lamb chili!  I circled 15 minutes before I found parking just so I could enjoy a bowl of chili. Diane served me right away and thanked me for coming in. One of the best Irish pubs in SF hands down.
author: Jen K.

description:
Stumbled in here after an intense workout with my gym buddies and the waitress here was super attentive and made sure we were hydrated with pitchers of water. Thank you!

We ordered the Chieftan burgers here. Pretty darn good burger and has everything I would love and expect in it: tomato, lettuce, caramelized onions, melty gooey cheese, two slices of bacon, FRIED EGG, and a really good toasty fluffy bun. However the meat was a bit smelly (low quality?) which is prob why I didn't finish the last third of it. 

Very cool pub feel and great potential to watch some games here. I'd probably come back for the drinks next time.
author: Sally C.

description:
Four words: Spicy Irish Potato Bites.

I should just end the review right here because I've got to get back to planning my next visit to SF to return to these beer battered deep fried mashed potato bites from heaven. 

It's your standard Irish pub, no bells or whistles with the Chieftain 

but you ask:



Rachel,
Is this really deserving of 4 stars if it's so ordinary?

and I would reply:



Dear Reader,

Yes, maybe more. Because you see, Chieftain is serving up stellar bar food that is only to be chased down with some very well maintained taps and served with a smile from the barmaid who's infectious sunny disposition will melt your heart.

So, please, take a seat and try and soak up a little luck of the Irish.

Yours truly,
The thristy Irish traveler

P.S. Potato Bites.... seriously.
author: Rachel B.

description: We had a larger group and all tried something different. We all enjoyed our choices and I had fun taking a little nibble from everyone's plate! On our list tonight was corned beef, 2 different burgers, Rueben sandwich, Shepard pie and Irish nachos for an appetizer. Seriously, it was all great and we will certainly return. I also appreciated the great service from the two waitresses.
author: Monica T.

description: Solid irish pub with a good selection of irish pub beers and some local ones. They let my organization rent the place out for a private event and they were great. We stuck around after, once the bar reopened to the public and everyone there remained great.
author: Misha T.

description: 'Twas okay. The lamb burger was awesome. The drinks and service were okay. They could be a bit slow at times, but it was fine. My friends enjoyed their food. It was cool. The space was a bit tight but overall flowed well. It was easy to have a conversation.
author: Ursula T.

description:
On football nights, Chieftain Pub is filled with people with a thirst for booze and a hunger for action. The pub satisfies both cravings with its wide variety of beer and a large projector showing the NFL game in action.

I'm not a big football fan nor am I an avid drinker, so I just settled at Chieftain with their Chieftain Burger and a pint of light beer. The burger was substantial for sure. It was juicy, it had bacon, and it was topped off with a fried egg. For a hungry soul like me, the burger really hit the spot. But because of the juice and the yolk, the buns got really soggy towards the end and that's kinda no bueno.

If they play NBA games here during November, I could see myself ordering some snacks and drinks. They have an interactive crowd here at Chieftain, so bottom's up when Steph drains a trey!
author: Ringo M.

description: Updating review as the manager responded which so few do, so added a star, and will give it another try next time I'm in SF......
author: Marcella D.

description: I had a great time at this bar. Really great drinks, good service and music selection. Dylan was a very knowledgeable bartender and recommended Irish whiskey I've never had before. It was the best. Highly recommend this pub to anyone who enjoys Irish pubs.
author: Sophia B.

description: Came here twice during my stay in San Fransisco, the bartender was very knowledgeable about the menu and very attentive even though it was a busy dinner rush. The first night I ate there I got the Turkey burger, and it was so good that it was the reason I came back a second time in the same week.
author: Shannon F.

description:
I have been in this place before and they served me drinks, but what happened this weekend baffled me.

I have a Belgian passport, just like one of my male coworkers. 

When he tried to order drinks on Friday night after a fun night out, he got service refused AND we had to leave the bar immediately. Because of his Belgian passport and their idea it was "fake". 

Really?
author: Judith S.

description:
Racist bartender. Oh wait, is this the way how you irish people are granted to discriminate other people?

I brought my own ID. The bartender refused to serve my friend and me. The reason: "I CAN'T TELL THEIR AGE". Oh yeah fuck you! You just served a white lady before me without asking any shit!

So yeah. I called you ASS HOLE. And I'll call you again one more time, shitty bartender, ASS HOLE YOU MOTHER FUCKER
author: Mike B.

description: Great chill place! Awesome bartender. Dylan is the man! Great selection of booze too!
author: Gardel E.

description: Just arrived in SF after an amazing drive up the coast. Hungry and in search of somewhere with no tourists and no kids and we found this place. Amazing fish and chips. Great atmosphere and service. Everything a pub should be.
author: Aimee S.

description: Went in for lunch and beer. Had a great time!!Diane was awesome. Food was tasty and came our quick.
author: Paola E.

description:
Fish and chips.

Lamb burger.

And the best fucking staff in the area. Lunch or dinner.

Cheers!
author: James S.

description:
Hey San Friends,
As a neighbor for two years, I've been to the Chief at all times of day during all times of the week, and I will confidently say that the level of attentiveness, quality, and legit fam vibes are consistent across the board. BERNIE SANDERS ATE HERE ONE TIME! That man knows quality! Ask for Melissa and Robby if you're looking to put a cherry on top of your already solid experience, and meet me at the bar for a BOMB and affordably priced cocktail. Yas!
author: Bianca S.

description:
Fail: I will be honest, on Saturday night I was fuming mad with the service here (in the beginning). The Frenchman and I came to have a pint while we waited for our 9:45pm movie. The Giants game was over, it was 9:00pm, so I figured we had plenty of time. No! By 9:15pm we were still waiting to place our order. Finally I asked the Frenchman to order from the bar. I was too hot to even attempt to speak with bar staff - some one would have lost their head. The bar man said, no problem I'll send your server over to you.. "oh wow that'll be just great, let's wait some more!" 

Finally our drinks were brought out, I had to ask for a glass twice. By now it was 9:25pm and we were still waiting on our hot wings and fries. At this point we asked to have our food wrapped to go, explaining we had a movie to catch. 

Recovery: There was a second server who apologized for everything. She came to our table and apologized for the late and slow service. She offered us a shot and said everything is on the house. After our shot our food was brought to us. We assumed when she said everything was on the house, she meant the shot. nope she meant EVERYTHING! Shots, meal and pints. We were shocked and very impressed. We did at least leave a tip for the server. 

I have been to the Chieftain many times, this was an unusual experience. So instead of ripping them a 1 star, I am happy to leave 4. The food isn't 5 starts but it's close to the theater, there's usually seating available with multiple T.V. screens  playing your sport.
author: Jaylena P.

description:
Neat little Irish pub. It's got a timeless vibe, I'm pretty sure if I could travel back in time it'd look like it does inside, the wood might be a little newer looking but that would be it. It's a pub, and you'll find the standard pub fare here and it's good eats, if you like burgers and fries and chicken wings. You know, the food you think of when you want to sit down with your pals and watch sports and drink. Even though it can get packed, it never feels so loud that you can't hear the folks your kicking it with talk about the game or whatever's going on with them in their life. The drinks are prepared well, and prices are decent for SF.

Bottom Line: A pub that has booze and food, a solid spot to come by to watch a game and catch up with friends.
author: Liz P.

description: Cool little place to have a drink and a bite to eat. We had Fish n Chips & the Ruben Sandwich, food was great and beers were cold. Staff was nice. No complaints!
author: Jasmine V.

description:
Best Burger I had at a non-Burger-place ever!!!
Delish!!!
The beef patty itself was so yummie... I usually ALWAYS put salt and pepper on whatever I order. Here: I had it as it was! 
We were downtown Frisco and didn't know where to go so we stumbled in here and that was the best decision!

Check this place out. It's worth it!!!
author: Kathrin H.

description:
Great location by the marscone center and @intersolar trade show location 
If your at a trade show and need a pint of good beer and some tasty Irish food give it a try 
Cheers
author: Joe O.

description:
This is not a late night place. They close their kitchen at 9:30/10pm on week nights (strike 1).

Once getting to Chieftain my friend and I were hankering some bar food. We sat down, our waitress greeted us and told us the kitchen was close and she was off duty so if we wanted a drink to order at the bar. Fortunately, we were the last table she tended. After asking her to make us an infamous postman shot, she said they didn't have all of the ingredients (strike 2). She regained our faith by bringing us a chocolate birthday cake shot instead! YUM!

The waitress gave us a few suggestions of places to check out for grub options and even told us we could bring food back to the Chieftain, which was a really nice suggestion. As we were on the hunt for food, we cashed out and left.

Bottomline- don't come here if you are looking for a late night bite. If you like divey bars with chatty workers, this is your place. Everyone was beyond friendly and appolgetic about the kitchen being closed.
author: Kendal Ann M.

description:
We came around lunch time. Strong smell of beer as soon as you walk in. Got seated right away. It looks more like a bar/pub than a restaurant. Small & intimate. Very irish feel throughout the pub. My hubby ordered the shepherd's pie. I ordered the fish and chips. 

I must say, I love the fish and chips at Foley's better than here. The batter is not crispy and it's too soggy. This place need to fry the batter "fish" longer. The batter was gooey & a mess. I think I got the wrong batch of fish. I gotta admit, the fish itself is juicy & moist. And the portion is great for the price paid. You get 4 pieces of fish. Hence, the 4 stars. Most places give you 2 or 3 fish only. My hubby love his shepherd's pie. No complaints from him. I would definitely come back and give the fish & chips another try. And try something else on the menu.
author: Amy H.

description: I was in the mood for a Cobb salad for lunch, and they delivered a tasty (and fresh) meal.  Make sure to ask for a different dressing if you're not a honey mustard fan, as that comes by default.  Looking forward to getting a beer here in the future!
author: Josh B.

description:
Tonight we are in the city on an international treck..
After driving into the city Togo to an English grocer for Shepards pie gravy we decided on an Irish pub for dinner.

Starting with the yelpers check-in special Dos Equies and Sliders / nice medium grill on the two sliders.

Next we have bangers and mash and fish and chips (substitute salad). Both very good.

Now 5:37pm starting to fill Up as people come in for the music which starts at 6:00pm
author: Susan K.

description: Sorry this place is a dump and the food is really average. Service was great nice people but never again
author: TK F.

description: Stout nowhere, I mean nowhere close to the real stuff.. nowhere close to a perfect pour.. poured it the American way. Good interiors and live music though! Consider it yet another American bar
author: Kunal G.

description: Ehhhh.. went here for Irish Breakfast after night in the city.. probably a good place for drinks, but the breakfast was not good.  The rashers (bacon) were not good.. tasted and smelled bad.. made my wife sick to her stomach.  Not sure where else you can get the traditional Irish fry in the area, though.
author: Dave R.

description:
It'd been a long day. I was sore and tired and -very- hungry.  We played Yelp roulette again and chose The Chieftain as it was only two blocks from where we were currently at.

I'm glad we went there too.. Their menu wasn't large, but their specialty of Fish and chips was phenomenal. The husband ordered a hamburger and he really enjoyed it too!  I have to say, the service was quick and friendly.  It's a place that I'd come back to in a heart beat.  

I bet it gets REALLY crowded because it's SO small.
author: Dianna B.

description: I've been here twice now, on annual work trips to the area. It's good food, good drinks, and good service.
author: Katherine K.

description:
My mister and I tend to like going to pubs. There's always good beer, nice ambiance, and food options we both like. This place was no exception. There was a live band in the corner, the decor is pleasant, and the menu is full of stuff I'd like to try.

We came here before a show at the Mezzanine a few blocks away. We got here around 6:30, and we were able to have two drinks each and out meals in less than an hour, which is a huge plus before a general admission show. 

We got the fish & chips and bangers & mash. We were pretty happy with both meals. The fish was lightly battered and well fried, and the tarter sauce was very good. The bangers and mash was also well done. We also had one beer each and Irish coffees. The Irish coffee was pretty good; not the best we've had but up there. 

If we are in the area again we'll certainly be back.
author: Emma M.

description:
A group of 8 of us stopped in before we saw "Once" the musical.  Since the musical is set in Dublin, we went with an Irish theme for drinks and an early dinner at The Chieftain.  

First of all, the atmosphere is just perfect and lovely for an Irish Pub.  However, I sadly knocked a few points off due to the lackluster food and drink.  

To their credit, the ordering system was down the day we visited.  Everything had to be done by hand.

We ordered the Chieftain nachos and a dozen wings.  Now, I'll admit that ordering nachos in an Irish pub is generally a poor idea, so I'll go easy on these.  They were completely underwhelming, the cheese was melted but not hot.  The serving size was smaller than expected.  The wings were ok-- nothing to notable here.  

The fish and chips were average, and got the job done.  Again, nothing to notable.  ***The star of the menu appears to be the shepherd's pie** Our table ordered two plates of this dish and tasted very satisfying.  The housemade bread added extra pizzazz.    The Chieftain Irish stew receives honorable mention.  Home-cooked goodness with tender chunks of beef and veggies was topped off with excellent housemade soda bread.  

Word of caution:  there is a Yelp deal for a "specialty" drink when you check in here.  Go ahead and pass on that-- It's a bitter-sweet pink martini-like concoction that tastes something like cough syrup.  Go for a traditional whiskey drink or Irish beer instead!!!!
author: Andrea H.

description:
The steak fries with curry sauce is good. The curry sauce tastes like actual curry. The shepherd's pie is a staple item in any Irish pub. The Irish potato bites though were probably the best and most fattening aspect of this carb-filled meal.

I like the calming and relaxing atmosphere that is expected at any Irish Pub. The round tables are fun spot to have a group dinner at.
author: Ee Vonn Y.

description:
No service received to get our table even we waited at entrance. Managed to get seats at the bar table on our own.

Bartender served us with drinks and orders taken. Buffalo Wings served in less than 2 mins after we ordered and doubted if it was pre made or leftover? Cobb Salad is good and fresh, the NY Steak we ordered medium rare served overcooked, its at least medium well.

While finishing our wings our plates were taken but havent been replaced until we asked.
author: Chi Ho L.

description: A group of us at here on a Wednesday night around 7pm.  The pub had a nice atmosphere, it was loud, packed, and dark.  Between us we ordered the 1/2 lb Angus burger, the Chicken burger and an Irish stew.  The food tasted fine, nothing memorable.  Service was slow.  Beer was fine and the Irish Coffee was meh.  The Pub is located next door to the Intercontinental Hotel, which made it convenient for us.  Good place for a quick bite, nothing that I would go out of my way for.  A meal and a drink was about $20-$25 after tipping.
author: Robert H.

description:
I was enjoying my time here until the bar staff changed and the new bartender decided the NBA playoff game we were watching need to be changed because the he wanted to watch something else. Not a paying customer, the bartender. When we pointed to a TV the other program was on, he said he couldn't see that one.  We were told to move somewhere else. 

The food was poor and the service is obviously hit and miss. I won't be back and certainly not if I want to watch a ballgame.
author: Stephen G.

description: Drinks good, atmosphere good, bartenders good, girls hot.  What more is there to say?  Great Irish bar especially for Colin McGregor fights.
author: Michael R.

description:
I can't wait to go back tonight. I rarely make it out to this part of S.F. because I dislike clubbing. But when I do, I always stop by this bar. I originally ran into sometime around 2010 when I was waiting for people to meet me up at Bucca di Beppo. I do wish there was more space at this place but oh well.

1) I love the old-style wooden atmosphere. And the dark lightning.
2) They have just enough TVs to keep it interesting but not so much that I feel like I'm at Hooter's or any other chain sports bar.
3) Service is solid for how busy it gets. Don't be ass to the waiters/bartenders and they won't be an ass to you.
4) Food is good Irish pub grub food. Prices for drinks are normal (actually they're good prices considering they're located in downtown S.F.)

Don't you come here and complain about the food or cleanliness. It's an Irish pub. It's supposed to be like that.
author: Dylan L.

description:
Solid Irish pub. It's in a tough location so I'd be hard pressed to stop here and try again, but my experience was good.

It's what you should expect of an Irish bar randomly skirting Market and SoMa. Pretty empty on my visit and just one waitress, so the service was attentive, but the food, drinks, and ambiance were all just meh.

Standard, solid pub with all your regular needs. If you're in the area check it out, it was good.

Cheers!
author: Joseph L.

description:
Wanting to grab dinner and a drink, my friends and I headed over to The Chieftain Irish Pub. The place was packed around 7pm, so we were lucky to grab a table. It is REALLY dark, so if you didn't bring a flashlight, you're SOL. Just kidding, thank you iPhones! ;)

Our server was this cute girl that was helpful with all of our questions. She took our beer orders and then gave us some time to look over the food menu. We ended up deciding to split the calamari, fish and chips, and another entree. It was a lot of food - we only finished the calamari. (To be honest, I really liked my Porter, so I was busy drinking instead of eating so I ended up only eating the calamari.) Now that I read that the fish and chips are one of the best... I kind of regret not getting a bite! What can I say - the thirst was real.

If you check into Yelp, you get a $3 for a shot of Mint Fernet deal. We were curious as to what this Mint Fernet is and asked our server. She said, "It tastes DISGUSTING. But it's an SF thing. It's one of those when in SF... things, so if you guys are up to it..." SOLD! Beware, these shots come out warm (yuck). My friends, who like mint, said the shot was not bad. On the other hand, I truly believe that the only things that should be mint flavored is toothpaste or gum. (Yes, I do not eat mint chocolate anything.) Granted, the shot wasn't horrible, but the mint flavor traveling down my throat was not pleasant at all. Again, it's a personal preference, so definitely do the shot for a good time!

My Yelp friend Kaje told me about the $75 for $100 deal, and I wish I looked more into it last night. Regret #2! Between four people, our bill came out to be almost $100, so we definitely could've saved $25. At least I know about this deal now so I can go back next time! ;)

They have a few TVs so if you wanted to catch the game, this would be a cool place to chill.
author: Christine S.

description:
Bushmills and a Bass for $10. They'll sub a Jamie if you smile pretty. A Celtic Matchmaker? Go 'head girl, go 'head, get down.

Our appetizers, entrees and desserts were of the liquid variety, so a vouch for what's chewable won't be found here.

Pony up to the bar or take a table, either will be met with a shrug and a quick wipe down of the last party's spillover. It's a pub in every since of the word, and we approached The Chieftain as one, ducking in when the rains came and emerging when they ceased, smiling a little wider, pockets a little lighter.

Staff reads you well, and will poke when prodded. Love that.

High end? Hardly. Inventive? Nah. But a decent bar, plain and tall.
author: Damien S.

description: Standard pub food. Good beer selection and reasonable price. Noisy and crowded but good service and clean bathrooms.
author: Mathurin K.

description:
Found this place through yelp while we were at the Westfield SF Centre. It's just a couple blocks down 5th on the corner across from Burlington Coat Factory.

First thing you notice walking in, is how small the place is. There's one booth, several low tables with chairs, a few high tables with chairs, a community bar table in the middle and the bar seating itself. It looks like when this place is packed it's very "intimate". Lighting was very dim. Typical bar lighting. Also, try to look up at the walls & columns, they've done a pretty good job making the walls & columns look like rock and the torch lighting on the columns.

We sat at a table and the waitress came up to us and asked us if we wanted menus. She took our beer orders right away and gave us time to look over their menu. We immediately went to the Traditional section of the menu. By great yelp reviews we had to try the Potato Bites. From there we ordered the Fish & Chips and the Shepherd's Pie, especially since it said it was made with ground lamb, NOT ground turkey or ground beef like many other places.

On to the food...
Spicy Potato Bites - Mashed potato balls with chopped jalapeños, deep fried and served with a spicy dipping sauce. You get 5 servings. You bite into one and the outside is light & crunchy, while the inside is what you expect, creamy mashed potato with bits of jalapeno. Just a little heat, but dip them in the sauce & you'll get a little more spice. Not too overpowering, just right.

Photo - Potato Bites: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-chieftain-irish-pub-and-restaurant-san-francisco?select=zIvLr0z2RVniJ7RxdEmT3g#hhoe4Wv2ee7gk6Br6YrsEw

Fish & Chips - Some here have said their fish was soggy, I guess my first experience was better? My fish came out hot & crispy, very light crisp. The fish was flaky, cooked just right. And I consider myself lucky this time because I got 4 pieces instead of 3, like it says on the menu. The chips were your basic steak fries, I didn't find anything really wow about them.

Photo - Fish & Chips: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-chieftain-irish-pub-and-restaurant-san-francisco?select=zIvLr0z2RVniJ7RxdEmT3g#zVMBCqjlmctWfRitrxze5A

Shepherd's Pie - You can definitely taste the difference with this one. Came to us really hot. So hot we had to let it cool down a bit. You can actually taste the lamb, it had that light gamey taste that only lamb has. It wasn't ground turkey or ground beef. The spices were nothing we've tasted in any other Shepherd's Pie. Very flavorful.

Photo - Shepherd's Pie: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-chieftain-irish-pub-and-restaurant-san-francisco?select=zIvLr0z2RVniJ7RxdEmT3g#7A77tHtv-UF27D10eJX2xA

They have daily special's too. We'll be back at least for these 3 items when we crave it. Probably need to try the Banger's & Mash.
author: Joel R.

description: Came here for dinner with my daughter after doing some shopping up at Union Square, and at Burlington Coat Factory across the street.  Love the atmosphere, just like a traditional Irish pub.  Sports were on the TVs.  It was a bit small, and I can see it getting quite crowded, but we were there at 7PM on a Wednesday, and it cleared out quite a bit by 7:45PM.  It was pretty loud when we first got there. Food selection was what you would expect from an Irish pub. I had the bangers & mash; my daughter had a salad with chicken.  Both were tasty.  I enjoyed a pint of IPA, and then for 'dessert' my daughter and I shared a really tasty Irish coffee.  I recommend.
author: Mike O.

description: Good food. Very hearty, warming and tasty and pretty healthy portion sizes. We sat at the bar, which I think I'd do again - not sure how fast the service was for the table guests. There's not a lot of space in here, so arrive early if you want to be able to get a seat or a table. They do have live music which I am sure is why they are so busy. It's just a solid "Irish" American bar.
author: Emma H.

description:
This review is for the drinks only! Went here on a Thursday night with some friends. Not crowded and the bartender was awesome! Drinks were strong and atmosphere was relaxed. We were able to visit and enjoy our time at the Chieftain.

Very chill place to hang with friends.
author: Darcy R.

description: So delicious, their lamb burger is on point! Very friendly service and relaxed atmosphere, I would definitely come again the next time I am in town!
author: Jenny M.

description:
I've been here quite a few times, each time for a watching a major sports event. I've tried the other bars around the area (Rumors: pretty good but service is slow, and Ted's Sports Bar: DON'T GO; very old crowd and the one overwhelmed bartender tries to avoid eye contact at all costs). Service here is great and it's somehow large enough that my husband and I have always managed to end up with seats, even for the Superbowl or the NBA Finals. 

I really like the relaxed "vibe" of Chieftain. They give you a large, pretty varied menu at your table and the waitresses are friendly. The spacing of the tables is also pretty nice - you're not knocking into each other. It's probably my favorite place to watch a game and get a nice draft beer; they have quite a large selection including cocktails and wine for the beer-nonenthusiasts out there (confession: sometimes I get wine or cocktails instead; cocktails are okay but they use smaller ice which sometimes melts too quickly for my liking - I want to sip and enjoy the game...). People are generally around the late 20s and early 30s crowd and typically pretty into the game, but it's never rowdy enough that you can't hold a conversation. Just occasional extremely loud cheers. 

Onto the food:
* Turkey burger: Tastes relatively light but delicious. There's jalapeno salsa and melted cheese. Comes with a small side of thick fries. 
* Buffalo wings: Not overly buffalo-ed, which I love. Comes with a side of carrots and celery, so that you feel mildly healthy.
* Spicy irish potato bites: Hell yes. Balls of spicy mashed potatoes and jalapeno that are fried. Genius.
author: Sylvia L.

description: The Chieftain is a great neighborhood pub. It was a rainy Saturday afternoon. We stopped in for lunch and a beer. Beer selection was great, had an Irish Cream ale, very tasty. I ordered a Turkey BLT! Which was prompt and tasty, with crisp,tasty fries. My wife had an Irish coffee, and Shepard's pie,she enjoyed too. I'd definitely check back.
author: Dave C.

description: Good drinks. Great service. Quick heads up - smells strongly of vagina. Not in bad way, in an obvious way
author: Ben L.

description:
Very good food.  A nice beer list, including several Irish imports.  Love the look and feel... it "feels" like an Irish bar (at least as best as I can tell, since I have never been to Ireland).

The service was friendly and helpful.  They were busy and I took up the table for about 20 minutes before my friends got there and the server was very gracious about my just kicking and watching the game (without ordering a drink) until my friends got there.

They have a nice, wide-screen TV, which you can see from anywhere in the area... and two (or maybe three) additional screens.

I was there during a World Series game and it was loud but not unbearably so.

If I lived closer, I would go back often.  Since I do not, it has become "one of my spots" in San Francisco.
author: Gary A.

description: love this place.. this is my favorite irish bar in SOMA....  food is great too.. the specials tend to be great priced and perfect portion size... bartenders are very attentive and tend be quick.  Definitely get there for happy hour as it get busy.
author: Jagger C.

description:
The Chieftain is a great place to watch the SF Giants play and enjoy the Irish atmosphere. Came to watch a game with 8 others on a Saturday night and enjoy a small birthday party...Giants attire acourse. The placed was packed with locals, outsiders (us) and businessmen. 

Since two nights I was drinking Guiness I went another route and requested the Pilsner Urquell. Unfortunately they were having problems with the pump so I switched to Stella Artois. The waitress handled all of our drinking needs and kept us from being thirsty.  Those Irish car bombs were perfect when the U2 songs were being played over the speakers.
