The Chieftain offers Irish treats such as Shepards pie, Corned beef & Cabbage plus other bar food. I ordered the corned beef & cabbage and it was tasty. The nachos were better then average.

I have to visit this Pub next St Patty's day...
author: Jim D.

description: Watched the Super Bowl here. I got here before kickoff, and easily found a seat at the bar. Great vibe, good time.
author: Alysha R.

description: Two nights in a row and everything we ordered was excellent!   Cozy.  Fun.  Great food.  Cold beer
author: Mike M.

description: Came in late on a Sunday night, seems to actually be a locals hang, trying to visit as many Irish pubs for my soon to be released book detailing the pub life and what really makes it Irish beyond the name.
author: Mike S.

description: I went to Chieftan's for lunch in my visit to San Francisco. I disliked my experience so much that I am hastening to provide specific comments with regard to my displeasure. The waiter/Bartender was very rude. She started off with telling us what is not available and what she can't do. "Sorry, I have to add ice to your Diet Coke because it's a little warm", when I specifically asked for it without ice. I ordered an omelette but it took forever to get it. I had to ask twice to get my questions about ingredients and the menu answered.  People who came in later got their food earlier. The omelette was average at best. I've had much better omelettes at restaurants in Maine that are more sophisticated and taste better at comparable prices. No refills on the water, soda. She said she can't give separate  checks because we didn't ask before hand (can't see why not- is it that much work?). Very unwelcoming, poor service and average food. I'll never go here again, and I'll encourage visitors around this area and locals to explore other options if they want simple and good Irish food.
author: Abhiram A.

description:
I came here for happy hour with some friends of mine and was pleasantly surprised. We talked about how the ambiance feels like bars in fantasy video games or medieval bars or Game of Thrones (we're clearly a nerdy bunch).

We were drawn to the $3 Guinness which we thoroughly enjoyed (I ordered a glass of Sauvignon blanc like the lady I am) and stuffed our faces with good ol' fish and chips and chicken quesadillas. I overheard some people say as they were leaving, "Reminds me of 'How I Met Your Mother'"...McClaren's, maybe?

Our waitress was prompt and friendly and there was live music, just a guitarist/vocalist in the corner. Fun place!
author: Peggy C.

description:
Cool little Irish pub.  Live music was loud, but typical Irish tunes.  4 stars bc it did have a bit of a stale bar smell to it. 
Whiskey selection was pretty good.
Service was helpful even though the place was packed.
Can't wait to go back.
author: C. C.

description: A very solid pub. Their lunch special prices were great where you can get a pint of draft beer for only $4! The tri tip sandwich I had there was also very good and left me satisfied. I really enjoyed the televisions showing sports all around the restaurant and can see how it can turn into a very fun place whenever a big game is playing. be wary when going during popular bar times as this place does get full and you could end up waiting a while for a table. My only complaint, which is a small one is that the waitress we had seemed to be a little careless and would sometimes spill a little of the beer and soup while she was bringing it to us, and didn't split the checks correctly. But I would still go to again as it was fun, good, and regularly priced bar food.
author: Itzak H.

description: Awesome Irish pub with great whiskey and scotch selections and Magners on draft! Bartenders, Dylan and Tuesday were fucking awesome dudes keeping it real. Try the lamb burger, it's the bomb diggity.
author: Alissa C.

description:
Great service, great ambiance - can get a little cramped, though.
Fabulous Irish pub food - reminds me of my young adult years in Ireland.
Delicious lamb burger, potato balls, bangers and mash
The fish and chips and shepherd's pie (made with lamb!!!) looked great, though we didn't try any.
Hubby and I don't go to restaurants on date nights anymore before a show in the city, preferring the Irish pub scene instead. Awesome before a show @Orpheum
author: Shilpi D.

description:
These are my favorite types of places to get food and drink. I think I've decided that Irish/Scottish brews are my favorite. I'm not sure if it will ever replace Belgium as the best beer-producing country in my opinion, but breweries like Murphy's or Kilkenny are too good to me. Please order one or both of these beers. It will be easy to appreciate how it goes down your esophagus. The food here is good also so don't be shy to order a burger or an appetizer.
I consumed these items:
1) Spicy Irish Potato Bites
2) The 'Original' Chieftain Burger (comes with fries)

You'll probably be satisfied with these 2 items in terms of taste and amount. You should get some curry sauce on the side for the fries. I thought the fries dipped in curry was alright--I wanted to try it since I haven't before. I guess french fries and curry is a thing in Ireland. I'd definitely come back for the beer and food. Don't hesitate checking this joint out. Lastly, if you're looking for a place to watch a sports game, this place has a decent amount of flat screens.
author: Marlon T.

description: Cool spot, pretty small. The turkey blt and fries were pretty damn good. Also got a shirt with the check-in discount.
author: Sam R.

description: This pub was great!  Nachos and wings were great!  But really, the service put it over the top!  Melissa and Laura were an AMAZING tag team!  Granted....they did not realize I was a Cubs fan til after Baez's homerun but....they were still amazing after!  First time in San Fran - but will def come back!!
author: Kelly D.

description: Great atmosphere with wood and walls filled with various objects. Food is great. Service is excellent. Can see it getting loud but isn't that the point at a pub?
author: David T.

description: This place is great in so many ways. The food is really well prepared, great flavor and really fresh. The value here is perfect, fairly cheap for the level of food you get. Good sized portions! The environment is excellent, and the staff always keep me coming back with all the smiles and super friendly service. Only thing is I wish they would place some more traditional Irish music instead of the 80's type that they play here commonly. But it's a great day for Soccer in here today, four big screens and lots of action!
author: Leo L.

description:
The Chieftain is a nice Irish pub a stone's throw from Yerba Buena Gardens that offered me a place to sit out a rain shower.  Since I was already wet and needed to dry off, why not order a beer and a snack?  Once I looked at the menu the snack idea turned into an early dinner, and the beer turned into 2 pints.  Strange how that happens.

The Great:
+  The young man finishing up his day shift was cheerful and friendly.  I was amused by his conversation with another Irish woman sitting at the end of the bar.  It went something like this:

Bartender: "What part of Ireland are you from?"
Lady: "County ____, and you?"
Bartender: "County ____. I've only been in the USA for a few months."
Lady: "I came over for 6 months and have been here 20 years"
Bartender:  "That seems to happen."

It was funny, and little things like that make a pub endearing.  

+  The Bangers & Mash were fantastic.  Large plump sausages, an oniony gravy, and delicious mashed potatoes that weren't over salted.  Hooray!
author: Andreas H.

description: This place is a no frills, typical neighborhood pub with FANTASTIC food and good prices considering it's just a block away from the Marcone in downtown San Francisco. Small pub with all wood interior...just like it should be! Beautiful bar with a good variety of choices for beer and spirits. The fish and chips were delicious and hit the spot. Fish was battered lightly and fried crisp but not greasy. The chips/fries were just as good. Burger is made to order with your choice of accoutrements. We would definitely return.
author: Carie W.

description:
I am such a jerk.

How can I give my fav bar only 4 stars??

The owners are great, the manager is great, the waitresses are great and the food is great.

And...come soccer season, they let me take up a chair and table for 1.5 hours every week.

What's not to love??

Ya feel me?
author: Johnny L.

description:
Being here for a conference and it was just in front of my hotel so I wondered: lets take a peek and see how it is ;) what a lucky strike!

Pros:
- very good location 
- cozy but amazing
- sociable waiters/waitresses
- outstanding hamburgers and vegan burger
- good selection of beers

Cons:
- a bit expensive
author: Paco V.

description:
We came in here on a Monday night for dinner. I came with 2 friends and we've visited the Chieftan every time we've been to San Francisco, now about 4 times together. We love this place for the atmosphere (pub with the games on TVs, which my friends like, good music, and cool ppl - both the crowd and servers, who are always fun and good). Also, there are often a few cute girls, which is ALWAYS good
Food: 
-Calamari: good, crispy, well cooked, tasty sauce 
-Fish and chips:Cod, well fried but still didn't seem too heavy, really good 
-Fries, thick cut, crisp, quite good
-Wefeveisen pitcher: Sierra Nevada, slightly citrus-y. Good
-Cole slaw: really good, not too creamy, flavorful
author: Corey L.

description:
Cute little Irish Pub! Came here to escape the craziness after the Tree Lighting Ceremony in Union Square, and was not disappointed. It wasn't very busy that night which was perfect since we had been trapped in a crowd all evening. 

I got their fish and chips and the BF got the buffalo chicken wrap. Both were excellent! I loved my little crispy perfectly fried fish sticks. I was confused that it came with blue cheese instead of tartar sauce but the combination was surprisingly tasty. The chips were pretty standard but good. I tried my boyfriend's buffalo chicken wrap as well and it was really good, I actually couldn't decide what one I liked more! Being from Upstate NY originally I can sometimes be fussy about my buffalo sauce and was glad to have found a place that could fulfill that quota.

I also ordered a Fresh Squeezed IPA by Deschutes Brewery and it was a solid IPA. My boyfriends whiskey sour was perfectly made. I think it was one of his favorites he has had so far!
author: Ashley R.

description:
TL;DR:  Small space, but big on atmosphere and fun.

Came here for dinner and a few warm up drinks prior to a concert at Warfield.  Was not disappointed.

This place is about a 15 minute walk for me from work, and I will likely find myself venturing down here again.

Well appointed, the pub is meant to be reminiscent of Ireland (duh) and achieves that without being hamfistedly corny.  Nice wood work, faux iron braziers, and interesting artwork and posters on the wall.

Food selection: I had the corned beef dinnner, and the lady had Irish stew.  Both were great!  The meat on mine was a little dry in some places, but overall very tender and flavorful.  Also the portion size for the price was fantastic.  About 13 bucks for each plate, and we left completely satisfied.  I even had extra's for the lady to munch on.

They also had a good selection of beer, a few European drafts on tap, as well as a respectable amount of craft domestics, and a good wall of whiskey.

Service was respectable.  They were pretty busy when we first got there, but the sole bar tender was still as attentive as he could reasonable be.  Beers were refilled quickly, plates were cleared and counters cleaned for us.  Great job all around.
author: Christopher G.

description: Cold Guinness and ham and cabbage is what to get. Pure Irish meal for me at this place. Watched someone get booted out at happy hour they keep the place orderly and safe. The beers on tap ice cold, food very good as well
author: Pat A.

description: Just visiting SF for the weekend like we do 6-8x a year & 1st time here. Bartender was johnny on the spot. Lots of spirits on the bar & good selection of beers on tap. Live music when we visited too.
author: Anjanette S.

description:
I went here for dinner on a Sunday.  Thankfully, the kitchen is open late - until about 10pm.

I had the Angus cheeseburger, with bacon.  It's actually priced reasonably, considering general trends in food in SF these days.  For $12 ($10.50 burger + $1.50 for bacon), I got a good bacon burger with fries - something that would cost about $17 at the pub two blocks from my home.  The burger was fine - better than diner-quality, but also not a fine-dining burger.  Basically, it's good casual restaurant fare.  The fries were steak fries.  They tasted like they were probably frozen, but I'm not complaining because they were included with the burger even though they weren't mentioned on the menu.  I ate at the bar, and the condiment caddy included yellow mustard, ketchup, HP sauce, malt vinegar, some sort of hot sauce, salt, and pepper.

The bar showcases an impressive collection of liquors, with most of the diversity appearing to be in whiskeys.  It appeared that they had more Scotch than Irish whiskeys, but the selection of both was impressive.  However, I had a beer, and it was one I'm very familiar with.  It tasted like they really needed to clean their lines.  The beer came out tasting sour and stale.  I probably should have mentioned it to the bar tender, but he was busy with a number of other customers, and I wasn't trying to score a free beer.  Anyhow, if any staff are reading this, please clean your tap lines!

There were two live musicians.  One of them sounded like she knew what she was doing. The other had a pint of Guinness in front of him, and sounded like he had never practiced with the other one prior to playing together that evening.  I don't know if he was actually drunk, or merely unpracticed, but regardless, he was taking Irish folklore out into the back alley, and beating it unconscious with his penny whistle.  I don't think I'm alone in this assessment, because despite being a free show, I never saw any of the other patrons tip the musicians in the time I was there.

In summary:  The burger was 4-stars, ambiance was 3-stars, beer was 2-stars, and music was 2-stars.  Rounding up to 3-stars overall for this review.
author: Miles B.

description:
Stopped at the Chieftain for a beer after the Giants game on a Thursday afternoon around 4:00pm. Was mostly empty so we grabbed seats at the bar where we could admire their whisky selection. The bartender was friendly and gave a good pour on our Jamesons

+1 for a decent beer selection. There are maybe 12+ beers on tap - standard Guinness & Harp, along with some 1/2 dozen microbrews  including my favorite "Fresh Squeezed IPA"
author: Bumble B.

description:
Love this neighborhood pub!

The Chieftain is great spot to unwind after work or check out on the weekends. They have a great beer selection and rotating guest beers for every season and month. 
ps check out their wide-ranging whiskey menu and drink specials!

The pub itself is pretty awesome, its decor and atmosphere really catches the true irish pub feeling, which not a lot of other irish pubs have nailed here in the city. 

try their spicy irish potato bites to start and lamb burger or fish and chips for your main. DELICIOUS!! You cant go wrong with any of their classics too! =huge portions for great prices. 

the staff here are AWESOME! 
waitresses are super friendly and attentive and the bartenders know their drinks!

see you guys this sunday for next 49ers WIN!! bottomless mimosas (for ME) and coors light pints (for him)

TIP****
they are serving $3 coors light pints/$10 coors light pitchers for ALL football games plus a $6 appetizer special of wings, sliders or potato skins =go 49ers!
author: Laura W.

description:
Authentic Irish Pub - Guinness was perfectly presented & the Shepherds Pie delicious!
Great energy and customer mix.
author: Keith F.

description:
Kilkenny on tap! Kilkenny on tap! Kilkenny on tap!

OK, I'm way too excited about that.  For the uninitiated: Kilkenny is an Irish cream ale - kind of the same texture as Guinness, but in an ale, not a stout.  The closest thing you can usually get in the US is Old Speckled Hen - but Kilkenny is a little sweeter and a lot smoother.

Anyway, I've tried to find Kilkenny in the states ever since I discovered it on a trip to Japan seven years ago.  I've seen it tons of places in Canada but never in the US.   Anyway, I finally gave up about  six months ago and I just happen to say at a party "it's a shame you can't get Kilkenny anywhere in the States - I know because I've been searching for years" and my buddy is like "you know they have that at the Chieftain in San Francisco, right?"

I do now.

Oh right, about the rest of the bar.  Small, old school Irish place with lots of wood panels etc. A group of us came around 11 on a Thursday night and it was pretty loud and packed, despite the kitchen having closed an hour before.  Worth it for the Kilkenny.
author: Aaron M.

description: One of the best Cobb Salads in San Francisco. The burger is also good, and the potatoes selection great. Good for dinner of just a drop in for drinks. It does turn into a european sports bar at time, rowdy and loud, but fun. Good people, highly recommended.
author: Pani P.

description: Your regular Irish bar with a good selection of beers. Nice place to unwind after a busy day. The burgers are half a pound so bring your appetite. Checked in after a busy conference and turned out there was a custom sandwich in my company's name which was kinda warm. Walked out satiated and mildly tipsy.
author: Harish D.

description:
Oh the food... the Shepard's Pie is just like Móraí would make. We came back two more times on our visit. The fish and chips were spot on as well.  The Guinness was just the right temp. 
We'll be back here next time for sure!!
author: D.J. B.

description: Great Irish Pub not to big not too small .. Nice sized crowd.  Very cozy inside, and the Guinness and Jameson is great !
author: Michael D.

description:
Let me start by saying, "I love Irish pubs." But they better be real-deal, know how to draw a pint of Guinness, Irish pubs!
This is the real freaking deal. Dylan at night and the slightly surly authentic Irishman during the day are EXPERT drawers of the draught. 
And the food? Oh, the food!!!! Get the Irish Lambs Chili and a pint and forget about the rest of San Francisco. Consider it a cheap side-trip to Ireland.
author: Wes M.

description: Always a good time at the Chieftain. Historically it is a bring your own party kind of place just off the beaten path. The bartenders are sociable. There are frequently some overflow from the convention center, so it is not necessarily a bad place to network and just hang. I don't mind just having a place to chill a little later after many of the other places nearby close down.
author: Doug B.

description:
Great calamari, good beer. A little annoyed that all the booths were "reserved" for the three hours we were there, yet no one ever came to sit in them. 

All in all this was a fun place to come when the rain was too heavy to do anything else.
author: Matt D.

description: This place is the best Irish Pub I've been to in a while, the menu is purely Irish, even with black and white pudding!! Great selection of drafts and of course Irish Whiskeys.  If you're looking for a great place to eat and have a few brews, this is the place!
author: Stephen T.

description:
Drove to San Francisco this was our first stop.  Sadly for our first stop and our start of our long weekend vacay the bartender wasn't so friendly...quite cold in fact. So we just ordered 2 beers and left. 

The 2 stars is for the beer only. Not that they were bad beers....just saying the beer was the best part of this visit. 

And I'm not usually picky or offended by people.
author: Crystle W.

description: Great burger and beer! Reminded me of NY dive bars. Nice place to hang out with friends without too many fancy extras.
author: Shifali G.

description:
Our first night of the long weekend in San Francisco, and all my boyfriend and I had established was that we needed to find somewhere with amazing Fish & Chips (thanks, Lent!) After perusing Yelp reviews for a while, I settled on The Chieftain- an Irish pub with great reviews that was walking distance from our hotel.

Our bartender, Dylan, was phenomenally friendly and attentive. He took our drink order and suggested an appetizer- his favorite, the Spicy Irish Potato Bites (beer-battered mashed potatoes with jalepeno and cheese.) The boyfriend said they were his favorite dish, and I might have to agree. For the entree, we ordered clam chowder and the Fish & Chips to share.. Both were fantastic. The best part though, in my opinion, was Dylan asking the kitchen to split our meal for us before it was served. Absolutely unexpected and obviously not necessary, but so thoughtful! Men tend not to be very proficient when it comes to "sharing" food, so this ensured I actually got to eat too :)

Instead of a juke box or radio, there was an incredibly talented guy singing, while playing the guitar AND harmonica. I don't think it's an exaggeration to say that he knew every single song on the planet and played them all perfectly- so impressive. We loved it, and could have stayed all night to listen.

Next time we are in town, this is definitely a go-to stop!
author: Leigh F.

description:
LOVE this bar!
Amazing bartenders!
Stop by every Saturday afternoon before my radio show! 
Hope all is well.
xoxo
The Clarences
author: The Clarences T.

description:
Excellent Poob!  Great Dive/Irish vibe. Lots of wood. Warm. Cozy even.
Torpedo on Tap works for me being the IPA guy I am.  The GF had the fish and chips..tasty, good size portion, lots of chips. Good balance on the batter not too light not too overbearing (Murphy's in Sonoma beats anybody and everybody)
I had the Lamb Burger. VERY TASTEEEEEEEEE.  With caramelized onions and feta or goat cheese of some sort. Fantastic for ..$12 or so.
author: Mark S.

description: Great service! Dylan was and is always amazing. We always come in after a day of work and are ready for some drinks to wind down. He is personable and is always able to give recommendations for drinks that hit the spot. The neighborhood here is a little sketchy, but it always feels comfortable here. This is the spot for sure!
author: Ariel V.

description:
One of my new favorite restaurants in SF! I first found this place while at the hotel next door looking for a close place for lunch. I had the fish and chips and loved it. I have been back twice since that first visit and brought a bunch of people with me. 

This place has a nice, cozy pub ambience. Service was friendly and efficient during weekday lunchtime. For a late lunch on the weekend, the service was a bit slow, but friendly, which was fine. 

The drinks are good and both the lamb burger and fish and chips are as good as all the reviews say! I have not tried the burgers myself, but those with me said the burgers and the Reuben sandwich are both great. I'd say the prices are average for SF.

This place is close to Moscone North / South，so I plan to stop by whenever I am in the area!
author: Kecia B.

description:
Went here last night for the first time to grab a couple beers and a bite to eat after watching a movie at the Metreon. When our waiter came up to take our order, he looked a bit scruffy and disheveled, it looked as if he had a rough night the night before and could use a nap. It did make me question the cleanliness of the place seeing how we are about to have dinner there. Seeing how we wanted to hang out at a brewery type sports bar and didn't know where else to go and our time was limited, we stayed. Boy what a mistake. 

I had the nachos with lamb chili and when they came out they didn't look very appetizing. The little bit of cheese on them was burnt on the chips, sour cream and guac was good and the lamb chili seemed decent enough. After we left, I felt a bit of indigestion, I had only had two beers and most of the nachos, so hadn't really overdone it by no means. Long story short, I woke up at 2 AM and again at 3 AM with the squirts! I also felt like I needed to eat about half a dozen tums because it felt like it wanted to come up the other direction also. I had a horrible night sleep due to it all and as I'm laying here writing this I still don't feel great. I have a pretty strong stomach, some have even said I have an iron stomach. But you serve me some Fowl meet and my stomach, every time, will reject it! All in all, I would give this place another chance because I like the vibe there and I am Irish  but I definitely wouldn't eat the lamb Chili.
author: Dave H.

description: Fun, super food for a bar.  Warm place for windy days and nights.  Don't let the fools change ya!!
author: Pete S.

description: Love this place. I've tried bangers and mash all over the country but, for my tastes, nobody does it as well as The Chieftain. Great place to watch a champions league game during lunch. Close to the Moscone center for conference goers like me. Can get crazy at lunch time, go early if you can.
author: Thad B.

description: I came in here with my wife and we were strolling by to another place to grab a bite and a mimosa for Sunday brunch since we were staying down the street at the Intercontinental Hotel.  We were out the night before hitting lounges and had a bit too much to drink.  This place provided the necessary and essential cure for our post party drinking.  We walked in and were greeted by Rhia the hostess and she was very quick to get us seated.  We initially were going to look at the menu and go on our way but the Sunday brunch menu looked appetizing. We had our food and some drinks as we watched Sunday footfall.  It worked out well. I have ti say, as much as I've been to SF, this place was awesome based on service alone from Rhia. My wife thought she was a doll due to her kindness and good spirit.  I love the place because they had great drinks and the happy hour menu which we stayed for.  The lamb chili fries are awesome.  We would definitely come back for drinks and apps.
author: Nilesh D.

description:
Their Lamb burger is probably one of the greatest things ever! 

Overall, It's just a great place to grab a beer with friends.Their beer selection is great! The bartenders are friendly, and the people are really laid back.

It's also different from many of the other places in SOMA.
author: Sas P.

description: Great times happen here!  I was alone traveling in San Fransisco for a convention. I always look for an Irish pub for a beer, food, and conversation. This place was no exception. I had all three. Bartender, Dylan, was great. Super friendly and personable. Would definitely recommend this place again!
author: Susan B.

description: The wife and I were looking for a cool bar to watch the Notre Dame game this weekend and stumbled upon this place. Best fish and chips I've had since being in Ireland last year. Excellent 1/2 Guinness combos available. Most of all, great service and atmosphere! Can't wait to come back next time we're in town!
author: Bryan S.

description:
When you decide to blow off the Zunis and Ryes of the world for eats and drinks at any Irish bar on the planet, you sort of have to check your epicurean ego at the door and manage your expectations accordingly. What you'll lack in $50 roasted chicken delicacies and hand stirred libations, you'll flow over with standard pub grub fare and pints of beer out the wahzoo. 

With that being said, my expectations were adequately aligned with what I'd anticipate from an Irish bar after hitting The Chieftain this Sunday, and like most bars of similar ilk, it does just fine for what it is: a comfy bar with simple drinks, sports on TV, and recognizable grub. Nothing that'll earn a Beard award anytime soon, but hey -- sometimes utilitarian nourishment at a fair price is just what the doctor ordered.

The service was pretty slow and spotty, and if I were in more of a hurry, I probably would have been slightly irritated. Fortunately, I was having quite a lovely time watching the 49ers beat the Detroit Lions, so the slightly befuddled servers didn't rub me too raw.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I was staying i the city recently on business and love to walk around the city at night to scope out new places to try.  It looked promising when I saw it, did a quick Yelp check, and gave it a try.  

To be honest, I wasn't thrilled by the Corned Beef and Cabbage.  The plate seemed a bit under done all the way around.  It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't spectacular either.  

They do know how to pour a Guinness, and the service was friendly and good.

All in all, I'd be happy to give this place another try the next time I'm in town, but I'll probably order something different.
author: Chris A.

description:
I love this place.  Cider on tap.  Good food.  Good wings.  Great bartenders and waitresses.  Huge TVs for sports.  Daily specials.  Awesome lamb burger.  

*insert funny story here and get ROTD*
author: Theron L.

description:
Are you kidding me? Four-star average rating and two dollar signs? Far from it.

We walked a good half-hour to this place since it was one of a few well-rated restaurants/pubs that was open on a Sunday night that could likely accommodate our group of seven.

We got there and found that there were many empty tables. We sat down at one and waited about 10 minutes before we were finally served. The waitress did not seem to be in the best of moods and did not seem very interested in any small talk. When it came time to order food, she took one order and nearly walked off before I even had a chance to give her mine. After another of our friends joined, he ordered a burger and waited 20-30 minutes before getting it -- how does it take that long to make a burger, not to mention when the place isn't even buzzing?

Service aside, I wasn't very impressed by the fish and chips either. Definitely not the best in the US, and definitely not the best in North America, despite some reviews stating the contrary. The fish was not very crispy; I'd put it somewhere between soggy and a slight crisp, as were the chips/fries (nor were they seasoned very well). Not worth the $12.95, in my opinion.

And the beer? We ordered three pitchers and were shocked when we received the bill. They ranged from $22-$30 EACH. How is that anywhere near two dollar signs? There are plenty of other bars in SoMa with better beer and lower prices.

All in all, I won't be coming here again.
author: Michael S.

description:
Located at the corner of 5th and Howard streets, across from the Intercontinental Hotel. The two sides of the pub each has chalk boards that advertise the specials of the day. Pricing is not that special but considering the location and convenience, it made sense. 

So, it is a good location if you're a tourist or non-local; easy to spot; less than a block from the Moscone Center; near 6th Street which can take you to 280S. Plus, it's only a couple of blocks from the Metreon/Market Street. Plenty of options for things to do. If don't feel like walking around, it's not that crowded on Wednesdays and Thursdays.
author: Peter L.

description: In town for the weekend for a Giants game and decided to go to a few bars the night before the game. I've been to the Chieftain in the past when I've come to "the city" but it had been a few years. Our entire party absolutely LOVED this bar. Kilkenny on draft and redbreast on the rocks...what's not to love? We waited over 50 minutes at another bar (the Smugglers Cove) just to get in and get drinks...by the time we got to the Chieftain we were ready for a fun bar with a good atmosphere and we were thirsty! The bartender (I can't remember his name which makes me an asshole! He worked 9/16/16 pm) was so fun and personable. The drinks were delicious and service was fast. I've worked in bars all over the Sacramento area for 12 years so I honestly appreciate good service. This place exceeded my expectations. We planned on going to one or two other bars after the Chieftain but loved it so much we finished our night here. I will definitely stop here every time I come to San Fran.
author: Sarah M.

description: It's been a while since I visited The Chieftain, but I thought I would stop by after doing some shopping downtown. I enjoyed the live music by a local artist and the waitresses were very attentive and friendly. My friend asked watch the UCLA football game on TV and our waitress Allie was very accommodating to our request. It was a very chill environment to unwind and throw back a couple of ciders after our after-Christmas shopping spree! Looking forward to my next visit at The Chief!
author: Gisel F.

description: This is my first time to ever leave a Yelp review and I'm only doing it because my bartenders were the best I've ever had. Dylan and "Tuesday" were very professional as well as entertaining and accommodating. I love The Chieftain and visit it every time I'm in town. I tried the shepherd's pie last night, and it was delicious!
author: Kadiana S.

description: I've been here a couple times in the past few weeks. Both nights it was fairly crowded for Warriors games. They have a good selection of beers, but not so much in terms of ciders or alternative alcoholic drinks. The waitstaff was fine and we didn't have an issue getting seats as we went earlier in the night on both occasions. However, after two issues with charging our credit cards incorrectly - one time putting an extra $30 on my boyfriend's tab (which to their credit they did fix a few days later), and the other time doubling the tip I signed off on without my permission - I'm not planning on returning. In addition on my second visit I had their zucchini fries and a cider, and a couple hours later became physically ill. I would be careful eating here if you have anything less than a strong stomach.
author: Claire R.

description: Hung out here after an IT conference this past week, Pretty nice place, Small, Cozy, great hang out spot or to unwind after the day. Open till 2 AM.
author: Gabriel D.

description: The food was very good and the service was fast, friendly, and very attentive. All in the party were pleased with their meals. Best thing for me was Murphy's Irish Stout on tap and poured to perfection - delicious. Other than one drunk and loud party of 5, the atmosphere was relaxed and friendly - what you would expect from an Irish Pub.
author: Bret S.

description:
I just went there today and I'm not sure what happened with my fish & chips.  I'll be honest, I really like fish & chips, but I think my order came out bad or something.  The chips were good, as expected, but the fish itself was strange.  It was soggy.  Most of the places I've gone to, the batter/breading is crunchy and will stand up to some lemon juice and vinegar.  Unfortunately for me, my dish was very oily and soggy.

I feel that this review may be a bit unfair since I didn't participate in drinking any beverages or anything else, all I had was the fish & chips which were supposedly the best in the city.   I don't know if it's the hype or just my order.
author: Charlie L.

description: Exactly what an Irish Pub should be. 'Happy to come up to the old wooden bar and drink a Guinness. Just perfect.
author: Charlie E.

description: One of the better burgers I've had. Even though it was a burger it felt healthyish. Not grease. Plus I love eggs on my burger. Mmmmmm
author: John K.

description:
I love their Irishman coffee. I have yet to try their food but I will definitely update this review when I get a chance to eat there.
Other than that, the atmosphere is nice and I like the theme of the bar.
author: Katarina F.

description: Stayed at the Intercontinental across the street, but drank ourselves silly at the Chieftain. Everyone was super friendly and fun. Didn't eat, but the food we saw looked great...oxtail stew was the special that night. When we finally decided to put something in our bellies, the kitchen was closed, but the bartender and waitperson were so great about telling us the "walkable" options close by...not that we could walk very well. lol
author: Heath P.

description: First time in San Francisco last week and this pub was the highlight of my trip! Somehow i ended up at this pub Thursday night and I'm so glad i did! Waitresses are friendly and the bartenders (Robin & Dylan) are awesome! They make you feel like you've been a regular for years and I just can't wait to go back! I've never been to any other pub quite like this gem! I'm having withdrawals from not being able to head over for a drink after work! I wish i lived in Frisco!!! Do yourself a favor and stroll on in for a great time!!!
author: Jess M.

description:
The Chieftain is a cool place to grab a quick drink when you are in the area.   I was there last month to meet with some friends before going to whiskyfest.   So we had a couple beers and a hearty lunch.   This place served some really good pub grub.   I had the bangers and mash which was really good.   They had a good selection of beers that I thoroughly enjoyed.   

It's a divey pub that just feels comfortable.   It's not too divey.

Will I be back?   Sure, next time I'm in the area I will enjoy another visit.
author: Bill C.

description:
Every time I come Here, I really enjoy myself...  This place has a very nice Ambiance... I almost feel like I'm at a good friends house...
I Like their Large Selection of Beer on Draft...  and the LAMB BURGERS are to Die For! So Delicious!!! 

I also recommend the Fish and Chips! and the Calamari...

They have 2 tv's for Soccer and other sports...

The Waitresses are Very Nice and Pleasant! 

Enjoy your visit and Cheers!
author: Alfonso C.

description:
Pretty great pub. Bangers and Mash were banging -- among the best I've had, but the bar is low. Great pour of Guinness. Yum.

Reasonable pricing (well, expensive for what it was in most parts of the world, but for San Francisco, totally reasonable). Our waitress was awesome. It took a little longer to get our food than I expected (was hoping to get in and out quickly for lunch), but ultimately worth the wait.
author: Greg K.

description: Classic Irish Pub, although the special of the day was definitely not Irish (Jambalaya?). I ended up getting the Shepherd's pie, which both my sisters loved, but wasn't my taste. I wished I could have gotten a burger cause those looked amazing. The space is smaller and can get pretty loud when full of people. Overall it was a good experience.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Before I do my one-man step-dance production in my sequin-infested headband and my emerald-green polyester shirt unbuttoned to my magic spot, I like to come here because I can hoist a few with my laddies. Then we all perform "Riverdance" for all the bedazzled tavern onlookers. Yes, it's true. OK, no, it's not. But I have actually passed by the Chieftain many, many times walking to the Yerba Buena Gardens. It just looked like a typical Irish-style bar. To my utter lack of surprise, I went in there last weekend with Jamie W...and guess what? It's a typical Irish-style bar. With food. 

Yes, we ate there. They actually have quite a menu there that stretches beyond the standard definition of pub grub. But I have to say the quality doesn't rise much above pub grub either. Jamie W. had the $11.25 Battered Fish & Chips. They use Harp Irish lager for the batter and serve three generous fillets of cod. Good stuff...wish I ordered it. I went for the ambitious, everything-but-the-kitchen-sink $11.95 Chieftain Irish Grill - a 4-ounce grilled steak, a banger (sausage), a lamb patty, baked beans, sauteed mushrooms, grilled tomatoes, fries, and country gravy. Whew. 

Well, I was ready to be embarrassed by what came out, but it turned out to be a major glop-fest on a plate. Everything was covered with the gravy - so I couldn't tell what was what. I pointed out to the waitress that I didn't see my lamb "slider" since I was fully expecting a mini-burger on a bun. Well, she came back with a patty - and I later realized I already had a patty on the plate. Now I see on their online menu, they say "lamb patty". Did I cause that change? You can thank me later. 

None of it was bad, but the combo of meat and gravy and whatever came across like a meal you'd see in the mess hall of a military base. I don't know if I'd come back to the Chieftain for their food, but I do need a place to practice my step-dancing now. Excuse me. 

FOOD - 3 stars...mess hall-level 
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...like a visit to Killarney...if you're drunk out of your mind, laddie 
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...bar-level, I'd say 
TOTAL - 3 stars...pub grub for pot-bellied leprechauns
author: Ed U.

description: This place had a fun, pubby feel. The servers were really great. We went there as we had a hankering for an authentic Irish breakfast. While it was complete with all the things I'd expect, it just wasn't quite up to par with other Irish breakfasts I've had in SF. The spicy bloody Mary was delicious, but I think our experience was also marred by the woman at the bar having the loudest phone conversation I've ever experienced in a restaurant. It went on for 15 minutes and was the only thing I could hear. For some reason, no wanted to ask her to take it outside or quiet it down. (I almost did it myself, but wasn't sure if that was okay.) Finally the bartender turned up the music (twice), which didn't necessarily get her off the phone, but did improve our dining experience. I'd definitely go back, but not for Irish breakfast.
author: CeCe J.

description: Thanks for the response. The four of us had a great time and great service down the street.
author: Adrienne M.

description:
If I lived in San Francisco, this would be my watering hole. 

Loved everything about this bar. Good food, good crowd, and lots of beers on tap, all authenticated by a truly Irish staff.

There's lots of pubs in the area, but The Chieftain is the best by far.
author: Cole C.

description: Hung out with the owner for the Super Bowl. Solid environment. Servers were stressed but stilled handled customer service amazing. Good people. Come here. Not to mention the prices were on point. The quesadilla and blt was bomb. Anyway, come here.
author: Brodie H.

description: Now that's an Irish pub! Shepard pie was really good! Place is really small but the more you drink the more you don't mind.
author: Carmelo W.

description: This bar was amazing! The service was nothing short of great, I was constantly helped throughout the night. Our bartender Rob was awesome, he gave us insight as to what sights we should see while we were here, he made our night. Definitely coming back next time I'm in SF.
author: Ali L.

description:
I needed sustenance on the day I went shopping for a wedding dress.

My sister suggested this location b/c they had great bloody mary's.  She was right.

For food I ordered the cobb salad ... I probably should have just stuck to filling up on bloody marys.  The salad was okay ... but the dressing was too thick.

The burger was delicious though ...
author: Kathleen W.

description: Loved it here! Great food, music, and bartender. Comfortable atmosphere and good location.
author: Leah M.

description: I've had my fair share of fish & chips, and have even gone so far as purposefully comparing various restaurants here and overseas.  This place has some SLAMMIN' fish & chips.  Seriously, this place serves some of the best I've ever had, which doesn't surprise me given the number of reviews and the overall rating for this place.
author: A. C.

description: Great little pub for a beer and happy hour food.  Service was great and the place was not too loud to have a conversation.  I'll be back for sure
author: J H.

description:
It takes a lot for me to write a review, either positive or negative. Our experience at The Chieftain was by far the worst I've ever been treated at any restaurant, after dropping off our BMW motorcycles at the dealership, we were walking to BART and seen this place waking by. We had on our leathers and helmets and the bar is pretty badly set up for storing gear on bar stools so we sat down in a booth near the west wall of the restaurant. Immediately a red headed hostess walked up and said "you can't sit there, we reserve it for groups of 6" to which I replied that we had our leather stuff and helmets and that they appeared only about half full in customers. She stormed away an went to get the waitress. Shortly after our waitress walked up and you could tell she was furious. Her face screamed attitude immediately and she said that the table was reserved for groups of 6 and again I explained that it was not an issue for us to leave the restaurant if it was an inconvenient. She fold her arms and stamps her feet as we begin to prepare to leave. She blurts out angrily "can I get you some drinks?" So we sit back down and I ask for an ice tea. My buddy asks if there's any specials or anything in particular she liked and with the bitchiest attitude says "I like the lamb sandwich but I'm not going to sit here and recommend anything". We look at each other and I swear I have never felt so uncomfortable in a restaurant in my life. 
We order the turkey burger and corned beef and cabbage. Food was ok, very much pub fried food with an Irish flair. 

Half way through I asked the hosted why the waitress was being rude to us and she shrugged her shoulder and walked away. 
I get that a restaurant with limited space would want to have larger tables for bigger groups, but it was Saturday at 2:00 and everyone was at the bar. We weren't greeted at the front door and when we asked for men's she snidely said "what a stupid question, of course we have A menu". 

I assume they were rude because after the initial rude attitude, she felt that we wouldn't leave a tip. It's always proper etiquette to leave a tip and express concerns with a manager and being gay, we know the to always leave a bigger tip than most. 

I will not return to this restaurant and I would steer clear of this place, I have a strong feeling it is a fairly common issue with service. One funny part was that with the check came a customer service questionnaire and one of the first questions was "How can we improve our service?". 

Absolutely stay away from this place, people with gear or bikers with helmets, they are not friendly by any means. I too. A photo of the waitress, I will try and post it.
author: Rick O.

description:
This review is for Aiofe and Aiofe only. I have worked in hospitality for 40 years and have never seen a higher display of customer service. 

We were overcharged by $15.00. After signing off on the receipt and walking out of the restaurant, Aiofe chased us down 2.5 blocks to let us know she had overcharged us. We said it was fine as long as she "covered us on a few beers  the next time we came in".

Later than night I received a text message apologizing for the mistake and letting us know that she refunded the WHOLE charge and paid for our drinks.

Chieftans just gained a lifetime customer.
author: Robert S.

description: First time visit, at a conference for work. I stopped by w co- workers because it was close to conference venue. Order a veggie sandwich and was pleasantly surprised that  it was very good. The waitress was friendly and my colleagues liked their food as well. I also noticed that personnel respond to critiques written by customers. The restaurant gets an extra star for boldness in responding to unhappy customers. I am not one but appreciate businesses that are positive with constructive criticism. This will definitely be a location I will recommend  to friends and return to in the future.
author: M E.

description: This place is perfect for an after work drink. The food is really good too.  The potato bites are to die for.  It's a little small and a lot crowded so wear comfy shoes in case you have to stand.  Other than that it's a favorite spot of ours!
author: Kristi B.

description:
What? I didn't review this place yet? 

One of the best British Isles pubs in town, possibly the best. A great place to watch a game, especially if it's not a traditional American game. A great place for food and booze at the same time. 

It's a little narrow for a wheelchair but just barely possible - ask nicely and the staff will help clear a path. I tend to avoid busy nights as it can be hard to get a table. 

Come early on sports or busy nights, it will get crowded. But the Moscone crowds don't always know about this place, so if you've got to go to a conference or a friend does, get here early for food and booze and avoid most of the Moscone post-conference crowd nightmares. 

Now that the Edinburgh Castle no longer has decent fish and chips, this is one of the best fish and chip pubs in town if not the best - my only complaint is the Heinz vinegar could be upgraded. But everything I've eaten here has been good or great, authentic and delicious. Anybody who misses a proper curry chip butty should come eat theirs; the stew is fabulous; the Irish breakfast is everything it should be. And it's consistently good, no matter when I get here. 

Beer taps: excellent selection of local and British and rotating taps. Whiskey: oh heck yes whiskey. Cocktails: my cocktail snob partner is quite happy to drink here, at least if it isn't a sports night. Cider: apparently Strongbow distribution is still a problem, but they've got either Magners or Woodchuck in bottles. 

I spent my formative drinking years in London; I'm not half picky about pubs. I like it here.
author: Anne K.

description:
Great Irish pub. We checked it out for lunch. Service was great and pub food really good. I had the lamb burger,  best I've ever had. My wife had the shepherd pie also good. 
Don't miss this pub.
author: J G.

description: Dylan and Tuesday were absolutely wonderful! They were incredibly hospitable, friendly, and engaging! We will definitely come back again!
author: Regina S.

description: Found this place walking around last night looking for a non crowded good vibe bar with decent priced drinks and I found my new spot. Loved the two bartenders working that evening they took care of my sister for her birthday drink and kept the beers flowing. There was an upset man who walks in to an irish bar ordered a Margarita he chugged and said it wasn't good and left. We all had a good laugh because he didn't know what tequila when the bartender asked and was being very particular. Who does that? Lol overall great experience
author: K M.

description: Good spot to watch any irish sporting game with some pretty reasonable prices and friendly staff! Serves food too but didn't eat here
author: Jack O.

description: Clean, seat yourself. One waitress for the whole (smallish) place but she is on it! Good drink menu, friend liked the Black and Orange. Food came out fast and tasty.
author: Brittany M.

description: The Chieftain was a saving grace for us coming out of a conference downtown. There aren't too many spots in the area and a lot of what we found was busy so we finally found this place. You can't go wrong with an Irish Pub. The place was great inside and your typical Americanized Irish Pub. Great food, excellent bartender, and live Irish music. Can't ask for much more. In a food town like SF you could probably go to other places, but if this is what you're looking for the Chieftain delivers.
author: Joshua C.

description: Rude personnel. Even though you have a table, they force sit people with you. Came here got a 3 seat table after waiting for 15 min. While my friend have not showed up yet, the waitress made 2 random people sit on the table. There were no sits when my friend showed up and we had to leave.
author: Amine K.

description:
It's a lively bar and pretty popular for the Friday Happy Hour crowd. Last week's DYL was the first time I've been to The Chieftain. Great time out with my yelp friends!

I had a couple Makers Mark Manhattan's which were around $6 or 7. Great place to stop in if you are at the Moscone for a conference, Happy Hour after work or maybe a relief from Holiday Shopping this season. 

The menu looked great, I have to try some of the food here. Kristina ordered these tasty looking fried potato with jalapeno and cheese in them things - omg they looked fantastic. We ordered some nachos, but I only had a few bites. I have to come back!
author: Rebekah T.

description:
How the heck did I neglect to review the Chieftain for so long? I live right around the corner and whenever I want to watch the Giants game or the NBA playoffs in a setting where I'm not the only one yelling, this is one of my default spots. Come early for big games though, the number of tables are limited and it fills up fast.

The bartenders and wait staff are incredibly friendly and attentive, last time I was in there, Katie was a fantastic host. They know their whole menu inside and out -- not that it's a huge menu, but I've been to a lot of bars where nobody who works there eats the food, which is usually a sign to run -- and they're quite knowledgeable with their whiskeys, per my friend who is a far bigger whiskey snob than I. (Order the RedBreast if you want to impress them.) 

If you're looking for a dark dive with discerning taste in liquor or an after-work drink spot for you and your friends without being surrounded by the FiDi crowd, check out the Chieftain.
author: Kevin B.

description:
I've read a few other reviews that mentioned the bartender being a bit rude...not sure who was there when these naysayers came through, because the gentleman working when I stopped in was quite nice. He even told my friend and I the safest way to get back to our hotel (I'm new to the area and my friend was in from New York). Which was greatly appreciated because we both tend to get lost and end up in rough neighborhoods.

I'd also like to commend the bartender on how he handled a VERY drunk girl who kept falling asleep at the table. He was very professional, yet assertive in asking her friends to take her home. I've seen similar situations handled in much worse ways. So kudos.

As for the general atmosphere, it was rather quiet when we went (Midnight on a Thursday) so I'm not the best judge. I've driven by other times and seen loads of people standing outside. So it definitely varies.

The drinks were alright. I had a Manhattan, and my friend had a whiskey sour. Honestly I like them a bit stronger, but these were fine for a night where I didn't intend to get drunk. A guy did buy the entire bar a shot at last call though, so that made up for it.
author: Marissa V.

description:
Nice place for a drink or a bite to eat.  

Most of the entrees are pretty good, but the standout for me is the Irish Grill.  It's a ridiculous amount of food for $13 and really hits the spot when you're a bit hungover.  I think most people rave about the Fish & Chips but something changed in past few months.  Instead of 3 large pieces of fish, the fish is now smaller pieces.  Not a huge deal, but I think the 3 large pieces works better.  If that's all I can complain about, I guess it's a good thing, right?
author: Larry L.

description:
My friends live around the corner to Chieftains and we have returned here to catch up a few times. Last night was another great experience...

I ordered their fish and chips, and a beer. Their fish and chips are hands down the best I have had in the US! They are not greasy like most places. When I get fish and chips, I want to taste the fish and not oil. Chieftains does it just the way I like it. 

Another awesome thing about this places is their waitresses. They are so friendly and man do they have a good memory. The place was packed last night, as is every time we have been there, but the waitresses knew exactly what each of us was drinking. They asked us if we wanted whatever we where each drinking. I have never experienced that at any other place. 

I will definitely be back to this place. Thanks Chieftain!
author: MoMo A.

description: Awesome chili lamb nachos! Burger was just ok at best. The nachos however were probably the best I have had anywhere. If u come here skip the burger, u can Deff get better elsewhere, but get the nachos!!!
author: Krys L.

description: Great burgers, great selection of beers, nice staff and a fun atmosphere. This pub's got it all!
author: Tom K.

description: Great feel, Tasty food, and Good chat with the bartender
author: Josh G.

description:
The Chieftain is my favorite casual pub near the Moscone center and the Nordstrom/Bloomingdales mall. I'd often stop in for a drink after work when my office was nearby and I still like to stop in when I'm at Moscone for a conference.

It's much smaller than some of the other local Irish mega-pubs. I've never had trouble finding a seat at the bar and service has always been fast and friendly. It can be kind of loud even when it's not crowded, so don't expect to be able to have an intimate conversation, but it's a good place to hang out with friends or co-workers.

They carry the typical Irish pub beers (Guinness, Murphy's, Smithwick's) plus a 
 few or the larger local microbrews (Anderson Valley, Lagunitas). Food is typical pub food - burgers, fries, fish & chips. Vegetarian options are salads, a garden burger or a couple of potato-based appetizers.

My favorite drink here is a shot of tequila with a Guinness chaser. You can order your favorite tequila or the well - it doesn't really matter. Take a sip of the tequila, then a sip of Guinness. The Guinness is magically transformed into bitter chocolate - totally awesome!
author: Rob B.

description: Good food and a good atmosphere. It's hard to find a place in the city that does a good happy hour that includes food. The UFC fight was a big hit as well.
author: Parker A.

description:
I'm proud to call this place my local pub!

They have a wide variety of delicious beers, Irish, local, and otherwise, and a surprising variety of Irish whiskeys (some of which can be very expensive: watch out!)

Their food is pretty decent and I intend to come for Irish brunch one weekend. Their menu changes regularly, and it looks good!

Watch out for Tuesdays - it's trivia night and if you are coming with a friend, it'll be hard to talk over the loudspeaker.
author: Josh K.

description: Best fish and chips I've had anywhere (fresh and piping hot, and their tartar sauce is perfection), great beer selection on tap and good, friendly service at the bar. Glad I saved enough room to try their apple crisp-- also excellent. Will make a point of going back next time I'm in town.
author: Troy S.

description:
It's a pretty standard Irish pub. Not much more to report here.

Pros: 2 blocks from muni, reasonably priced food and drink. (get the fries, they're really yummy!)

Cons: it's a little small, so if you don't get there early enough in the evening you may be stuck standing.

Thumbs up!
author: Shachi B.

description: Great service --- especially Dillon -- and good vibes.  If you're in soma and you're looking for a place to grab a beer, look no further.
author: Matt M.

description:
Its close by to the Intercontinental. It was clean.. drinks were decently priced.. really chill spot to come to after going out on the town if you are staying at the Intercontinental hotel. 

I went on a Thursday and it wasn't packed, so don't know how the situation is like over the weekend.
author: Jacob H.

description:
One of my favorite spots for a beer and a bite in all of SF.Great vibe, good service, and good eats. I lived in Ireland for a bit and this is a legit Irish pub.

Really good happy hour as welll!!!
author: Chris B.

description: The Chieftain is a great place to watch sports with friends. The bartenders here are friendly and the overall vibe is fun and lively. I've been here on normal weekday evenings and during crowded events like when the Giants won the world series. Regardless, you can expect to have a down to earth experience at The Chieftain.
author: Nate W.

description: This authentic Irish pub and restaurant is my new favorite spot in SoMA. The staff is incredibly friendly and fun. The live music is excellent and the soup is outstanding. I recommend this place for anyone looking for an Irish pub to spend an hour or two or three!
author: Melissa D.

description:
Came here with some friends for dinner. Nice place. I ordered the Irish stew. Normally, I am a huge fan of this stuff but it was a bit too salty for my taste. My company was much better so it still made for a great dining experience. 

Service was quick and friendly. I'd go back.
author: Robin F.

description: I don't normally write reviews, but after going to the Chieftan the past couple nights.. It's a must. This place is awesome. The food and beer were excellent, but what really set this place apart was the quick service and the ambience. Great recommendations (and drinks) from the bartender too. Overall great time, check this place out!
author: Holden L.

description: This is a very laid back non-touristy Irish bar with great food and better beer! The bartenders are super friendly and talkative.  Very cozy and warm inside. This is now or go to spot since it is right across from the hotel we always stay at. Can't wait to come back on our next visit! Reminds me pubs in England and Ireland!!
author: Sarah B.

description:
I can't really think of a lamer bar for young people (21-35s) who want to have fun. Here's why:

* flat beer
* families w babies
* terrible service
* older crowd
* near $30 for 4 beers
* no music
* no fun
author: Grayson K.

description: This bar is great for an afterwork drink and the staff are all great. I come in on Friday afternoons a lot and Danny not only keeps me hydrated but also entertained. He also makes a mean margarita.
author: Kate L.

description: Good atmosphere, good food, and good people! What isn't to like? I had the nachos which were surprisingly good for an Irish pub, and my friend got the vegetable soup with Irish bread (don't remember what it's called) , and the soup was okay (my friend was happy with it but more happy about the bread) the bread was awesome.
author: Allison M.

description:
Had the Shepherds Pie. It was just "OK". 

Great pub atmosphere and no shortage of Guinness "Black and Tan" concoctions. I will probably I back to try their fish and chips someday to see if they are in par with other Irish pubs
author: Brian S.

description:
So I came here for a friend's birthday and the place was pretty crowded.  The servers were hardly able to squeeze between the chairs.  However, the food was amazing, I had the Irish Bangers and Mash and loved every bite of it that I almost licked the plate clean.  I also had a Prohibition Speakeasy which made the meal that much better.  Most of the party got Fish and Chips and I tried that, and the fish tasted so fresh and had clean flavors.

Because it was my friend's birthday, we asked if there were any special offers, and they gave her a slice of cake on the house, which was very nice of them.  I loved the staff.  I caught one of them photo-bombing another group's picture.  They are so sincere and fun.

I would definitely recommend anyone who loves or even just likes pub food to go here.  I am definitely a fan and would love to go back!
author: Liliana P.

description: Had lunch with a group of friends. Everyone enjoyed their food. I had the Chieftain Irish Grill (Irish Breakfast) and it was delicious. My friends had burger and especially liked the fish and chips!  Good beverages and Great Irish Coffees. We'll be back!! Loved the country music. :-)
author: John A.

description: Great atmosphere and awesome staff. Good selection of whiskys and taps, plus awesome food options. A little pricey, but what isn't in San Francisco?
author: Rickey A.

description: Nice clean bathrooms clean good service good beer and food. A place t I come back to.
author: Andrew R.

description:
I had an ironic lunch today. After talking with a buddy about how I'm trying to be better about portion-control, I ordered the monstrous Chieftain Burger, complete with fries and a Guinness. 

The pub offers tasty, cooked-to-order burgers, crisp fries, and a very impressive selection of beers, whiskeys, and scotches. The atmosphere is typical Irish pub, and service was fairly quick and friendly. Prices are FiDi-standard, which is a little higher than what you'd find in other areas, but not unreasonable - $11 burger & fries, $6 Guinness pint.

Of note, they have live Irish bands on Monday nights and trivia on Thursday nights!

Warning: The signature "Chieftain burger" really is a towering behemoth - see picture. Unless you have a big mouth, you'll having trouble fitting it in. (And yes, I acknowledge how dirty that sounds.)
author: Bill B.

description: This place rocks!  The music on Saturday nights with singer guitar player Damir is amazing!  Damir sings everything from Neil Diamond, Pink Floyd and an impressive range of 70's to 90's covers.  Not only is Damir's voice incredible, but this place is very clean, cozy and the bartenders and servers couldn't be nicer!  I enjoy the size of this bar-restaurant as well, it is cozy but not too small or too large.  Just the right size for a nice, hip neighborhood pub with a little mix of travelers from the nearby business district.
author: Pauli P.

description:
I'm so glad we happened upon this place. We walked while they had live music and the atmosphere was welcoming and fun. The musician, Ivor Collins, really made the experince my group will not soon forget. No sooner than we could hang our coats and take a seat we were tapping our feet. We ened up drumming on the tables and singing along. 
Our server did a great job too! She was a natural and helped set the comfortable, casual mood. While we didn't have any of the food the drinks were quick and cold. :)  
The Chieftain made a fan out of me. I'm going to make it a point to return when ever I'm in the city.
author: Kara L.

description:
I dropped into The Chieftain on a recent trip to San Francisco and loved the place.I had the lamb burger(Awesome) and fries with a pint of Bass Ale while watching SF Giatnts on the big screen.Service was very efficent and friendly,the waitress had a natural smile and seem to really enjoy her job,which is always a good sign of a place.
My only complaint is that I do not live near The Chieftain.
author: jack c.

description: Cool Irish pub with a casual, friendly feel. It wasn't very busy at all on a Friday about 3pm so it was a relaxing atmosphere in which to enjoy our pints of Guinness. My friend and I struck up a fun conversation about movies with a fellow pubgoer sitting next to us at the bar and the congenial bartender got into it as well. Nice comfortable interior and the food looked decent, from what I saw on the other tables--a perfectly lovely Irish Pub that I wouldn't mind stopping into again should the opportunity present itself.
author: Steph H.

description:
Great pub.
Great food
Great people .
Really enjoyed this place and will definitely come back on our next trip .
Brunch from 11-2 includes the most amazing French toast I've ever had.
author: Julie W.

description:
The wings are probably the best classic buffalo wings you can find in the Bay Area.  Nice crisp on them.  Simple light batter.  Perfect blend of butter and hot sauce on the sauce.  They were very very good.  As for the fish and chips. Well done.  Very good Irish Pub.  Their food is definitely not just "OK" bar food.  The beer - I don't care.

My updated review as of 2/27/15.  Place really gone downhill.  Sorry folks.  Wings are still good though, but that's about it.
author: Mark S.

description:
One of the waitress had a mean bitch face going on, but the other one was super sweet. Thank you, nice one! 

Came in hungry and in on a mission to drink something, anything. By the time we got to ordering, I was already distracted by the plate of hot wings at the next table. Yes, I will be having that please.

Wings: Delicious. 


My manfriend ordered a happy hour PBR. Ah, college. We decided to split a burger after inhaling the wings and asked them to cut it in half. 15 glorious minutes later: food!

My half of the burger came with a surprise hair in it. Gross, but the waitress (nice one) quickly whisked it away and came back 10 minutes later with a brand spanking new burger (whole one! :) ) and an apology. This is how you do it, guys. I wasn't even angry, she was so nice. 

My new burger had a piece of broken off toothpick, but I didn't want to bother her anymore. Bill came and the PBR was on the house because of the burger incident. Yeaa


Be careful and alert when you eat. Good thing the place is nice and the food is good, so I don't care.
author: Tiffaney L.

description: Do not pass this little gem up!  The Shepard's Pie blew my mind.  Maybe it was the Guinness.   I'd liked to think it was the Shepard's Pie.   That staff is awesome and I loved the atmosphere.  Whether you're a local, or just visiting it's definitely a great place to grab a bite!
author: Derek S.

description: I had takeout one night and while the spicy irish potato bites were really delicious, the fish was soggy and had a bit too much of a fishy odor to it.  It is super convenient to where I live and the service was great, so I would definitely come back for drinks and pub fare.
author: T U.

description:
The Chieftain is a cool place to stop in for a drink. i guess if I lived right there I would be there all of the time, but I don't.

Nice selection of brewskis, decent vino, great cocktails.

Good people working there, nice atmosphere. The owner gave my buddy one of the pint glasses that had a hemp leaf on it - how cool is that - very cool.
author: Rew C.

description:
PROS
- Great selection of drinks (I got the "winter coffee:" cherry grey goose vodka, baileys, coffee and whip= $9)
- Good food to boot (I ordered the soup of the day: cream of corn with bacon)

CONS
- Only 1 stall per male/female restroom= not enough!
author: Stephanie T.

description: The perfect pub experience... And a traditional Irish band started jamming in the corner. Doesn't get much better.
author: Derek B.

description: Small pub close to Union Square.  Decent burgers and fish and chips. Loved that they had Sierra Nevada on tap. Our waiter was nice and, though it got crowded,  never rushed us.  Seemed a good assortment of locals,  college students and tourists. All ages from senior citizens to barely legal. Even though it was definitely a bar atmosphere, it was early enough that some people had kids with them. They seemed to do just fine.
author: Malinda M.

description:
I wont lie, it doesnt take much to get me buzzed...
and by this time I was drunk and hungry. 

They have great guinness here...
.
.
.
and fish and chips
I love me some fish and chips
TARTAR sauce!
;D
author: John-Michael C.

description:
Great drinks, good food, and big screen tvs.

I came here with a friend visiting from New Hampshire and he stumbled upon this place because he was attending a conference at Moscone West. He saw that it was an Irish Pub so it was right up his alley. We ordered some curry fries. i had a jack and a coke and he stuck to his Guinness. As the evening got a little later, I also had a spicy bloody mary and he ended up getting one a fancy scotch. We were both very pleased with their drink selections. The bloody mary was very filling already and also very spicy, the way I take it.

I got a little hungry and decided to order their Chieftain burger. I should've known to come here with a big appetite because I couldn't finish it all... That burger had everything on it plus a little more and a side of large fries which were very crispy. It is a little greasy though so you should get extra napkins. I already had a heavy lunch to begin with!
author: Tim G.

description: A bunch of us were here for St. Patty's Day eve. What's not to like about an Irish pub then? It was loud and crowded and a ton of fun. Car bombs flowed continually.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Yelp got me here by using the nearby feature and a discounted irish coffee. I had some good conversation with some business travelers while i had some typical irish food and spirits
author: Tahoebound T.

description: Was looking for fish n chips so checked with what the other Yelpers had to say...boy I'm glad I did.  Fish and chips were great, beer selection was great, service was awesome and the atmosphere was perfect.  If you're looking for good Irish grub I recommend this place.
author: Angie S.

description: Wonderful place! They serve food late! Excellent service.
author: Disco B.

description:
ATMOSPHERE:
Casual place, I like it. Good place to hang out.
author: Angela L.

description:
My first night in SF that I ever ventured out on my own took me to this little spot a block away from my friends' place.  I don't know what time I ventured in but the place as steady, I was able to pull up a seat at the bar and settle in.

The random people encounters were great, and the drinks flowed when needed.  Before I left SF I went there again and had a pretty chill time.   If I lived in the neighborhood this place would definitely be my go to as it seemed laidback and reliable.

Reliable with booze.
author: Cliff W.

description: Rock solid Irish Pub with good selection of food and drink.  Had the fish and chips, which were very good.  Nice carried crowed with regulars and people like me who were visiting the area.
author: Ralph E.

description: Always good food and service. Irish classics like bangers and mash and fish and chips are great. Usually no wait but can fill up for games. Reasonable prices for either lunch or dinner.
author: Chris S.

description:
We wandered in here for a quick drink before dinner reservations.  
The servers were super friendly and nice (and had wonderful accents).
The beer was decent, and since we were just here for a quick bite, only one of us got food.  She ordered the carrot ginger soup which we all tried.  AMAZING! totally the kind of soup that warms your soul.

Wish we were able to go back and hang out there more.  It looked like a neat place.
author: Nellie T.

description: Just enjoyed a platter of corned beef and cabbage for lunch during St. Patrick's day. I am amazed that the waitress could get us seated and served as fast as they did since the place was PACKED.  She got sll of our salad-for-potatoes substitutions right and didn't bat an eye when we asked for extra water and butter. Food was delicious. We shared a table with some fellows from the Pacific School of Dentistry across the street, making for a fun social outing. Well done, Chieftan and your Chieftanesses too!!!!
author: Nan L.

description: Came here yesterday to watch my Niners whoop on the packers! ok it was a nervewracking close game but whatever. We won...so suck it pack fans. Anyways the staff were very nice and accomodating and I even brought my 3 yr old Haro here and he had a lot of fun and tore up a plate of fries. The place is fairly small but can hold a good crowd and everyone was really cool and nice to eachother..even to the few packer fans there, ugh.
author: Jhoe G.

description:
I have been a regular at The Chieftain for years and will be a life long customer. The ambience is enjoyable yet relaxing, the staff is friendly, professional and eager to go that extra mile to make sure I get what I need. 
The food has continued to be consistently excellent, I have probably eaten everything off the menu and I can't think of a time I've been disappointed.
If you want the Irish bar experience, look no further than The Chieftain in San Francisco!
author: Niall S.

description:
After eating crazy vacation food for almost a week, it was nice to find a cozy pub near our hotel and have some familiar cuisine. I could probably eat a buffalo chicken sandwich every day, but my tummy wouldn't like me (neither would the BF). 

The Chieftain has a pretty amazing buffalo chicken wrap that satisfied my craving for something buffalo. Combined with an Anchor Steam and it was almost as good as being home again. Almost.

Happy hour from 4-6 includes discounted beers... but not sure if a $3 PBR is a deal. Maybe it is in these parts, but not in my 'hood. But who would want a PBR in an Irish pub anyway?
author: Abby S.

description: Local pub on the corner with solid shepherd's pie and a busy crowd on Tuesdays and Wednesdays?  I sometimes house sit for someone in the neighborhood, and this is my new official go to place in the area. Fun times.
author: Dick S.

description: Really loved this place!  After waiting for a standing room only place at jambers we decided it was time to try something new.  Great drink specials, found a seat fast, and the servers were really nice.  Order the fries and gravy to start.  They are those large steak fries, which i personally love, and they put the gravy on the side which is awesome, keeps them crispy!  For dinner got the lamb burger...it was awesome.  Perfectly seasoned and you get quite a bit for the price.  They also had a wide range of beers on tap.  Im so glad i found a bar near work thats not packed to the gills every night.
author: P N.

description: Best bar - best pilots in charge of this place. Great place to grab a pint when you stay in downtown SF
author: Matthew K.

description: A great Irish pub with exceptionally nice people working there.  I have been there several times now and I highly recommend it for service, atmosphere, food and of course drinkies.
author: Fiona H.

description: Great venue for food and music. Witnessed bartender Dylan diffuse a diificult situation with a local tech company employee who claimed he was from Boston so deserved some sort of special privelege. Could have gotten real ugly but the entitled dude with a Patriots hoodie was cut off after one beer and left screaming he would ruin the establishment with his special social media skills. The music was awesome and the atmosphere great even with the spoiled brat in attendance.
author: Dave J.

description: Dive-y. Kinda boring. An Irish place that doesn't pour a Guiness properly. Yikes. Our server was super slow getting to us and then getting our drinks out. The food was greasy and blah. It's fried calamari, but it doesn't have to be greasy. All said, we wouldn't go back.
author: Joe A.

description:
I've been here a number of times. 
Always had good service here. Nice beer and booze selection. 
Last time I was there I ordered the chips. I'm usually wary of "chips" because a lot of places serve them limp and greasy. Ordered these "extra crispy" and received a plate of the tastiest fried potatoes I've had in ages. 
The fried calamari is excellent as well, but I'd omit the chipotle mayo (tastes like hotdog water?) dipping sauce and ask for a few lemon wedges instead.
author: R W.

description:
November 6, 2009, Saturday @ 6:40pm (3.5 Stars, Maybe 4)

AMBIANCE: I could have let out an ear-shattering scream at this pub and nobody would have heard me.  This place was LOUD!!! Maybe because BF and I went during Happy Hour and a hot game was going on. 

SOCIAL SCENE: Well, it is a pub! And a happening one. Locals and tourists alike were having a good time.  I'm not complaining. Just sayin.....We came here for pre-movie dinner.
