SERVICE: But even when the Happy Hour ended at 7pm, the place emptied out but it was still loud!  We had to find our own table but the server was nice, on her toes and we got our food like clockwork despite the craziness of the place. 

DRINK FOR ME:  PANTY-DROPPER "DON'T BE SHY" :  (Square One Vodka, Midori, Pineapple Juice and Grenadine Sinker) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QkaSsRmSHnc7vlypsfNfyA?select=YEK7Z_AXq_jgoAedquNkxA
Sweet and tasted like candy but not enough ETOH for me to drop the Victoria Secrets!

DEVOURS:
Appetizer:  SAMPLER PLATTER:  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QkaSsRmSHnc7vlypsfNfyA?select=vIo_fI0yBnkCTRT44L_lPQ Jalapeno poppers, chicken wings, onion rings and quesadilla with 2 dipping sauces.   The jalapeno poppers were the freshest I've ever tasted. They were not the frozen type and they used real chiles. Very tasty. Even the chicken wings were cooked well and yummy!

Me: GUINESS BEEF STEW: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QkaSsRmSHnc7vlypsfNfyA?select=HgS-T3wPZ9dSkeN7CiKucQ Not much veggie/seafood selection and I didn't want to eat Fish N Chips.  The Beef Stew was a good choice. Very flavorful and comforting meal with big chunks of carrots and potatoes. The meat was tender.  Honestly, it tasted like what I cook at home although BF said mine stew was better.  (Trying to make me drop the VS, Babe? LOL!)

BF:  THE REUBEN:  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QkaSsRmSHnc7vlypsfNfyA?select=B3tLs6DTBxGSPE2fiTM_jA  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/QkaSsRmSHnc7vlypsfNfyA?select=fHBwAO3vkS7IdPolGz-pfQ Corned Beef with melted swiss on marble rye and sauerkraut.   BF said it was good but he was hoping he'd get a big pile of meat like at the Carnegie's or Kats in NY! He was slightly disappointed.

TAB: $60 with Diet Coke, tax and tip.

OVERALL: (3.5-4 Stars) 
Chieftain Irish Pub offers delicious comfort food to warm those cold bones at very reasonable prices. The dishes were priced at about $10 on average. The most expensive item on our menu was the appetizer platter at $14 but I would say it was worth it!

RECOMMEND: This pub is great to hangout to catch a game, share a pint with friend or nurse a cold with a plate of stick to your ribs but delicious pubfare. Portions were adequate and not gargantuan.  

IMBIBE: For those who imbibe, they carry a nice selection of Scotch Single Malts and Irish Whiskeys.

LOCATION: Perfect location on 5th Street, not far from BART and shopping!

MOVIE:  "THE BOX" @ Century San Francisco at  Bloomies.  Trippy sci-fi. Totally unexpected plot!

TOURIST TRAP:  NOT!!! If you're a European tourist and feeling homesicked, come here!  My friend said Chieftain Irish Pub reminds him of every pub he's been to in Ireland.  Probably much cheaper than what you'll pay for a meal in Motherland!
author: Leah E.

description: Have checked this spot out a few times now that I have been living near by.  They have a nice drink selection and a pretty good fish and chips.  Each time I have been in there I have had good service and liked my selection.  Will return again to try out some of their other menu options.
author: Andrew V.

description: The burgers here are really good!!  With that said, it does take a while for the food to come out.  The place is good after work but I wouldn't recommend it for lunch if you have a 1 hour timeframe that you have to stick to (waited 40 minutes once).  The seating situation is tight so make friends with your neighbor because they'll mostly be  bumping some part of their body on you while they get up to go to the bar or bathroom.  Been here a few times and have yet had a nice waitress :/
author: Jenn C.

description: Super friendly staff, great food, great beer. What else do you need? Came here to watch an international friendly game (Argentina vs. El Salvador) changes the TV right away to accommodate out request. Also let me try several beers to find the perfect one. I highly recommend this bar!
author: Drew T.

description: im a fan im irsh good food good place good decor might come back again in the future
author: Leigh G.

description:
fuck this place on st patricks day! i dont know what i was thinking i would enjoy a bar atmosphere on my birthday--st patricks day, so loud and packed i couldnt move. i downed my beer and got the fuck out of there

if you love loud music, balls to the wall people, then this is your place.
author: Ellie B.

description: Great bar, fun atmosphere. Friendly bartender is over the top. Good choices of beer on tap. I enjoyed the Black and Tan.
author: Holly W.

description:
2 words....lamb burger.   the best on the planet!!!

i don't have enough words so i will just repeat lamb burger

lamb burger
lamb burger
lamb burger
lamb burger
mmmmmmmmmmmm !!
author: Cameron L.

description: Great food and friendly service. I usually go for the chili and the shepherd's pie; the beef stew is also good.
author: David S.

description:
Went here for dinner and drinks. They have a wide variety of irish beers from the obligatory Guiness to some unknowns that I've never heard of.

It may get  bit crowded as we had to wait for a table but the food was spot on. It was not your typical bar food. I had a guiness stew which was flavorful. it had a slight bitter taste from the Guiness but it was yummy. Fish and chips were great. Some of the other dishes ordered in our party was the corned beef and cabbage, which was good. And a bowl of mussels, which had a dairy sauce of some sort. You have to try the orange chocolate guiness cake. It was to die for. 

Service was very friendly. They even have a waitress who is from Ireland. She gave us some good pointers for our upcoming trip to Ireland.
author: Kenson K.

description: Only stopped in for beers... Place was packed! And all the food that passed by... Look & smelled wonderful!
author: Mandy C.

description: Service is great and the ambiance is awesome (would give 5*'s for that) but the food was average (3*'s).  Wings ok but on the small side - home made Blue Cheese dressing was great.  Fish & chips - good for the fish..whole pieces..freshly prepared and lots of it, but the 'chips' were just plain steak fries that were a bit soggy.  Beer selection was varied.  Definitely a great place to hang, drink and chat with friends.  Also we got a Yelp deal for $75 to get a $100 voucher which made it very enjoyable.  Highly recommend.
author: Nancy L.

description: We came here for a howaboutwe date. Loved it! After a long day of classes we were there to celebrate! Chieftain was perfect. Little did we know, they have live music every Sunday. We tried two layered beers and the calamari (with aioli sauce - yum!) Great pub in a great location.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Headed here on a Wednesday night after seeing the Yelp review to meet up with some friends. Unfortunately, I was pretty disappointed with both the food and the service. 

The waitress was rather slow in noticing I had joined my friend before taking my order. The high tables were cramped and uncomfortable. 

The cocktails were good. I ordered the Sazerac which was quite a refreshing Green Chartreuse twist on a Manhattan. The spicy Irish potato bites we ordered as an appetizer were fantastic. However, the daily special ravioli the waitress recommended was wayyyyy too salty. And It wasn't just my order. My friend ordered a buffalo chicken wrap that also turned out to be enigmatically salty. 

In addition, getting the waitress's attention was a ordeal, whether it was to order another drink or to get our check.

Admittedly, my experience at the Chieftain may have been atypical (perhaps someone was adding salt twice in the kitchen due to miscommunication), but the poor service on a Wednesday night left much to be desired for both the food and the service.
author: Jugal S.

description: Staff is incredibly rude. In particular, the blonde bartender serving drinks when we went refused water and shouted at patrons. Would not recommend coming here if you value having staff that respects you in any way, shape, or form.
author: Peter S.

description: Our kickball team came in here before a game.  Cute little pub in a spot I wouldn't have thought of.  The bartender was very nice and we got an order of the fried spicy potatoes - yum!  Beers were decent price.  It has become our go-to spot before games now even though it's a little small for big groups.
author: Amanda K.

description: We came here for lunch. I give it 2 stars because the food was really good. The service was awful. The waitress never bothered to ask how our food was, asked to take our plates while we were still eating, and then gave us our check without even asking if we wanted anything else. And I may be nit picking because I'm crabby about my experience, but both waitresses were in black leggings/yoga pants. Totally sloppy. Maybe the service is better during the night time hours, but I would expect better service during a non peak hour.
author: Erin C.

description: great music and an awesome burger with bacon and a fried egg on top! cant go wrong at the Chieftan! Staff are really nice and the chicken wings are pretty good too!
author: Phillip J F.

description: Good pint for a reasonable price, the staff was very friendly. I would come back.
author: Jonah K.

description: Came for the wings. Stayed for Dylan behind the bar. Good dude, always worth tossing back a few more with a good bartender. Will be back.
author: Mike G.

description: Stopped here for lunch.  Had a fried chicken sandwich and a bowl of potato leek soup.  Not bad and service was good
author: Jared I.

description: The food itself was delicious! Our server seemed to be in a bad mood, definitely wasn't helpful. It looked like a smile mightve killed her. As other reviews say, it was pretty loud. There was a live band though. Which I enjoyed. Space was a little tight. This would be an excellent place to go to have some beers with a friend. I really like the Celtic atmosphere and casualness of the place. I would definitely take out for dinner in the future.
author: Sarah H.

description:
The Chieftain is our neighborhood bar and I we simply love it!

The things I love the most about Chieftain:

- Super Friendly staff
- Fun atmosphere (authentic Irish pub)
- Great food, my favs: Hot wings, the chieftain burger, hot Potato Bites, Quesadilla, Fish & Chips, Turkey & Avocado sandwich and the lamb burger. 
- Live Irish music on Sunday
- Great place to watch games
- Rewards card

If you're around market & 5th, go grab a bite at Chieftain!
author: Carol S.

description:
Do not come here. 

I came here a week ago to try and watch the Raiders game. I came in with a couple friends a few minutes before the game started and we grabbed a table. Service was really pushy and wanted us to order immediately.

Right before the Raiders game the server changed the channel to the Broncos game. Confused why a Bay Area bar wasn't playing a Bay Area game I quickly asked the server if she could play the game that so many in the bar were anticipating to watch. Her response was that since the Broncos game was requested first by a small group of fans they would only play that. 

Honestly, if you're looking for a good place to watch a game do not come here. The TVs are ill placed and hard to view, they will probably not play Bay Area games, and the drink selection sucks. Also, this place is not clean. 

Do yourself a favor and choose another bar. With so many better bars in the area I promise you will have a much better time elsewhere.
author: Jay S.

description: Came here twice this week while in a business trip.. Food is so good! I had the quesadilla one time and the southwest turkey burger the last time. It was DELICIOUS.  Co-worker loved the tacos as well. Quaint little pub with a great atmosphere!
author: Rachel A.

description:
What can I say? I love a good pub. If I can walk in a place that feels alive & have great food & drink along with a great time & go home with a smile, that's got to be 5 stars. That was the Chieftain on a recent Friday evening after work.

I was the last person to arrive for what amounted to a double date. The girlfriend & I plus her friend & friend's boyfriend were our party of 4. Inside is the classic Irish pub look. Plenty crowded & noisy, there was somewhat of a celebratory feeling in the air. Friday is always reason enough for me. Our table was right next to the open front door & shouting was often required for conversing. It was a good crowd, though, with lots of random friendly banter with other patrons at the bar or just while walking around.

The girls had already eaten since they'd been there a while already. Service was friendly & attentive. I had a Murphy's stout while looking over the menu & then decided on the 1/2 Pound Lamb Burger medium rare. My male counterpart ordered Corned Beef & Cabbage. The Corned Beef & Cabbage looked good enough that I would strongly consider ordering it next time. My Lamb Burger was spectacular. Cooked properly to the specified medium rare, the meat was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. Add blue cheese, mushrooms & onions on a nice firm on the outside, spongy inside bun & this was the ideal complement to all the delightful beer I was throwing down my gullet.

After the meal, I felt like having liquid dessert. I sauntered up to the bar, ordered an Irish coffee & asked the bartender for his Irish whiskey recommendation. His eyes grew big & a wide smile drew across his face at the prospect of bestowing upon me some kind of Irish whiskey epiphany. As he rushed off to fetch the bottle he had in mind, it was obvious to me that here was a man who enjoyed being a bartender, enjoyed being Irish & enjoyed Irish whiskeys. In short, the right man for the job. And epiphany it was. He poured Red Breast 12 Year Irish whiskey & now I know Irish whiskey as I never knew it before. Subtle, delicate & sublime with a complex array of flavors, Red Breast 12 Year for dessert was a wonderful contrast to the hearty, heavy & rich meal of lamb burger with stouts. The Irish coffee was really good too & rounded out everything nicely.

For atmosphere, food, drink & service, the Chieftain was as good as any Irish pub experience I've had. I look forward to celebrating another Friday here as soon as possible.
author: John M.

description:
This place has quickly become a regular lunch place when our office moved into the neighborhood.  Good drinks (beer & whisky) and good food.  It can be a bit loud, but booze helps filter out the noise.

Great fish & chips, very filling.  Been getting the lamb shepard's pie there lately.  Service is friendly albeit a bit slow at times (I had about 5 bites of my pie left before I got my hot sauce I asked for when I ordered my food) and sometimes they forget things like non-alcoholic drinks you order.  

The atmosphere is nice over all and the people always seem friendly.  Definitely a popular spot.
author: Van W.

description:
Meh... sounds about right. I was here around 7 on a Sunday night just after landing in SF for a conference. Experience started off good with very friendly service from the bartender, but when the rest of our group showed up and we seated ourselves at a big table (which, I guess it was cool that they let us do that) service went downhill. My corned beef sandwich came and it was decent, but after that it took FOR-EV-ER to get more drinks or anything else. It was like the waitress totally forgot about us... and it didn't even seem that hectic... and she was helping everyone around us... it was weird. 

The icing on the cake (or whatever the opposite of that would be) was when the bill(s) came... somehow we were under the impression that she was transferring our tab started at the bar so that we would all end up with one bill, but we ended up with two so that a bunch of us had half our stuff on the bar tab and half on the table. Weird and really confusing, AND there was an automatic 18% (!!) gratuity added to the table bill (but not the one from the bartender... who I wanted to tip much more generously anyway since he was actually helpful). Obnoxious. I'm not a stingy tipper but I have no desire to tip 18% for literally the worst service I've had in a couple months.
author: Rachel P.

description:
My boyfriend and I stopped by here to watch the Celtics v. Lakers game last Sunday before heading to Luce across the street for dinner.  I'm really glad we did; The Chieftain is really a cool spot to grab some drinks, eat some good food, and enjoy a game.

The actual place itself isn't that big, but it is very cozy and reminiscent of a real pub in Europe.  There is a large drink menu, with many types of beers, cocktails and hard liquor to choose from.  I ended up trying an Irish cider, which was served with a glass of ice.  It had a nice apple flavor to it, and was cool and refreshing.  

The food was surprisingly good!  We didn't want to eat a lot, given we were going to get dinner shortly after, but we did end up splitting an order of garlic fries.  The fries were thick cut and deliciously garlic-y.  I was curious to try it with the curry (they have curry fries, cheese fries, garlic fries, etc.), so I ordered curry on the side.  For some reason, I was expecting Indian-style curry, but the flavor reminded us of Japanese curry.  Not bad, just different.

As we sat and watched the game, we also watched other people getting their food and it looked really yummy.  

Staff was friendly, prices were fair, atmosphere was chill, food and drink was great.  What more can you ask for?
author: Laura S.

description: i love a good irish pub. i have been going to this one for a couple of years. They always have the giants game playing, good whiskey, and great food. Their spicy irish potato bites have me coming back every time. So Good! Its also close to the Bay Bridge and shopping on Market.
author: Ria B.

description: Came here last weekend, great drinks, friendly bartenders and a mellow atmosphere, saw a few people with food, looked amazing. Will definitely be headed back soon.
author: Dan D.

description:
The place has a nice atmosphere- good selection of beers- tables are a bit packed together along the wall- hard to get enough space to sit back to back.  But other than that, pretty spacious.  Be very wary about the food- I ordered a lamb burger med. rare with no cheese- and the waitress didn't put in the change so it showed up with blue cheese melted on top of the patty.  I pointed it out and she apologized and took it back.  In fairness it looked pretty good.  One of my buddies got fish and chips- which also looked good and he said he enjoyed.  Within about 5 minutes my replacement burger showed up and I started eating.  After two bites I realize the burger tastes very rare- in fact raw.  Now, I've only taken two bites from the edge and the meat is browned on the outside, and looks kind of light pink on the inside, but I open the bun to get a better look, and I see the burger is just barely marked from the grill- light browning.  I pinch off a bit of meat and find that the light pink inside is completely raw room temperature meat.  No wonder it came back so fast... they didn't cook it.

I was upset at  having been served raw meat and made it plain to the waitress- I told her to take the burger back because it's raw and that I didn't want any food from there kitchen, period.  Apparently she didn't like that, because when she came back with the check she told me she didn't like my tone and I had no business being rude to her because she just serves the food she doesn't cook it.  Then she ran off.  When she came back to get the money, I said look if you don't take any responsibility for the food that's fine, why don't you go get the manager or whoever does have responsibility for it.  She just said she wouldn't do that and then literally ran for the kitchen- and I followed her.  The bartender came over at that point as well as some jerk who apparently just knows the waitress and was there eating apparently with the girl he wants to dump in her favor.  Anyway, turns out- no manager on duty.  How about the cook?  He only speaks Spanish- hey that's fine I speak Spanish- she asked if I speak it "fluently" (?) as if you need to be fluent to say este hamburguesa no esta cocinado.  I think he would get the idea- but anyway it's no wonder things come out bad when the wait staff cannot communicate with the cooks- or at least that is what they claim.

After we left the bartender came out and appologized- said he hates dealing with that waitress and I should just take it easy and come back tomorrow if I want to talk to a manager.

I'd say stick to the stuff that's deep fried at this place- especially on off nights because they apparently just let the waiters and bartenders run the place on their own then- not sure how the cooks know what to do on those nights, but it seems the atmosphere excuses the kitchen problems for most people.
author: Robert C.

description: Cool pub, excellent traditional Irish breakfast.  The black and white pudding takes me right back to my childhood.  Great place, but the location is odd....  I will keep on stopping by.
author: Michael D.

description:
I would love to give this place as 3.5 stars really, but this system is not allow me to give half. 

We went to this place before hitting the movie this evening, i wasn't hungry but when i knew that they had fish and chips. So i just changed my mind, beside i didn't want to feel hungry while i was watching the movie.

My fish and chips came as a  big portion to me than i was expected it. I got 3 huge of deep fried fishes , lots of french fries. For me, the fish was a bit tasteless i had to put some salt and pepper on it,  However, i did enjoy my meal though. 

Decor is very interesting to me, i was feeling like i was a princess in the castle. I' d say the service was very friendly and good. I don't mind to come back and check out more some other time.
author: Sasitorn O.

description:
3.5, I say.

It just doesn't seem right to give it a full-on 4.  The food has been good.  The beer, plentiful.  There's something amiss though... something that's keeping me from suggesting to come here when we're figuring out our plans.  Maybe it's the location or the frat-like feeling I get...?  I enjoy a good Irish Pub, but this one feels less authentic to me for some reason.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
I am so glad Yelp pointed me to this little gem. 

My friend wanted to go to a pub for his birthday, and I had tracked down the Chieftain during my "look at everything on Yelp" phase that we all go through, so I suggested it as an option and he thought it sounded like a solid place to celebrate. Six of us headed into the city, and I don't think any of us were disappointed. 

We went on a Thursday, and it was certainly a little more cozy than I expected, but not cramped. Found a spot with no problem, and immediately went into seek and decide mode on drinks and food. I was pleased they had cider, though not as happy that it wasn't on tap. Oh well, a Magner's in a bottle is still a fine beverage. Two in our party tried their mixed drinks, which are delicious. 

We shared an order of the fried mashed potato balls...get these, they are awesome. I could have just eaten an order myself and had my cider and been happy...but dinner still awaited, and it was great. In our little group, 2 people ordered fish & chips, 2 ordered the guinness stew, 1 got bangers and mash, and I got the shepherd's pie. There was very little left on anyone's plate. My shepherd's pie was rich and flavorful, a great choice on a chilly evening. I tried the guinness stew from one of my friends, and it was equally hearty. 

I'll just take a moment to call out our waitress, because she was awesome. I don't remember her name...but she has dark brown hair and she was super sweet and very patient with our group from beginning to end (especially when we were working out who was going to comp what part of the birthday boy's meal). I'm definitely coming back here.
author: Jamie B.

description: My son recommended we drive up to SF from San Jose to  meet him in the City to celebrate his birthday this past Monday (Memorial Day).  We were a party of 5, and had the best time!  The service was great... and the food was delicious and authentic...  A wonderful assortment of beers...and food.... something for everyone.  Definitely worth the drive... even without a reason to celebrate!
author: Mimi S.

description: After meaning to go here for a while we finally decided to stop in for a drink and some snacks.  They have a pretty good food menu and a good selection of beers.  The atmosphere is nice and relaxing and the staff is friendly and prompt.  We had some fries (just plain), which are available four different ways and they were pretty good.  We also got the Fiambre, which is something I've never had anywhere before and wouldn't expect in a pub.  It's a tasty potato salad served on a bed of Avacado and is worth trying.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Scott L.

description:
Well... it's an Irish pub.

Nothing incredibly special here in my opinion. I had the shepherd's pie, which was good but not great. Ordered two of thier foreign beers, which were also good but not great. Service was average.

I would definitely return but I wouldn't go out of my way to do so.
author: Adam K.

description: Great live music on Sunday night - a couple pints of Guinness and the Lamb Chili is great on a cold, wet night.
author: Steve R.

description: If I wish to be treated like trash and insulted I would go somewhere like Dicks.  I came here on a day I had received some bad news and was trying to just enjoy a beverage and a bit to eat but between the bartender constantly yelling obscenities at the sports and the people next to me arguing it was a total nightmare..  I asked for a clean class because their was stains on mine and the bartender almost lost it .. I was actually scared .
author: Mary Jane M.

description:
How can I not go here every so often when working on the same block. 

Good atmosphere, owner is the nicest guy, bartenders are real, (if you're nice they will be nice, if you're not nice, why would they be nice to you?)

Good garlic fries & nice beer. Overall I like this place. The reason why I prefer to go to another bar is cause it's too close to work (too many possibilities for awkward situations).
author: Helen D.

description: Had just gotten my licence renewed; when I tried to order a drink the bartender kicked me out along with my friend whom he had just served. Food and drinks may or may not be good but after this experience I have no intention of ever going back.
author: Byron C.

description:
As far as pubs go, the Chieftan is tops.  My father is English and I grew up in pubs and know good pub food when I taste it.  We were in three times over a week - the first time for drinks on a Sunday afternoon and then for lunch during the week.  The service was great every time - they do the team style service, so someone is always checking on you.  

As for the food - I had the Shepherd's Pie and the Lamb Burger.  Both were fantastic!  If you are debating between a regular burger and the lamb burger - go with the lamb.  The flavor is amazing.  I had my boyfriend take a bite (he was eating the regular burger) and it kind of ruined him on the regular burger.  Our friend had the Fish and Chips and really liked it.  He also ordered the fried Potato Balls the first time we had lunch there and we all fell in love with them.  They have a little jalapeno in them, so they have a good spice to them.  The beer batter they are done in is light and crispy.  Had to order them again when we went for a late lunch.  Also the pricing is reasonable.

If you want to do lunch - go early or late.  The pub is small and seating is limited.

Looking forward to the next time we are in town so we can come back!
author: Allegra G.

description:
Awesome atmosphere right next to the Moscone conference center.  

Headed here for lunch after the latest WWDC and stumbled into the crowd singing "God Save the Queen" as some football looking game started up.  Luckily we were able to grab a few remaining seats.

I wasn't overly impressed with the beer list, but the atmosphere of the place rocked.  The food and the service were both above par.
author: Gino M.

description:
If you're in the mood for a great Irish bar to gulp down some Murphy's, this is the place to do it. Pepper in a few shots of Jameson and you'll start growing a beard and talking with an accent. Or maybe it's more of a slur.

Walking around with a few coworkers, we stumbled across this bar and decided to give it a shot. We ordered beers, a couple shots and some nachos. The bartender came back with the colorful plate of nachos, set them on the table and said, "You've come to the right place."

Indeed. I can't wait to go back.
author: Tyler H.

description: Even as I can honestly say there was nothing wrong with the food or beer itself(we shared a 4-piece fish & chips), I have to give them a 2-star rating because of the service at the bar tonight just before the Giants game started. We sat intending to share the plate an drink til the game started  and then watch it while enjoying more booze, food... Unfortunately for us the bar-keep was much more interested in taking shots with a colleague than serving his patrons, that otherwise may have returned. Fist we ordered drinks and as he began to pour my beer-from the wrong tap- I had to correct him that I'd ordered a different beer and he actually said, "oh good then I get to drink this one.(I'm thinking what buddy? the proper thing to do is give me the mistake and bring the correct pour as well right)Then, I literally had to tell him: "yo we're ready to order food..."...getting the check was another wait whilst he continued to pay more attention to the co-worker(I don't care if she was a little cute!) this was about bad bar etiquette if you aske me thnx.
author: Brian C.

description: The worst "corned beef sandwich" EVER! Then to top it off the air conditioning was out while it was over 95 degrees outside. It was such an uncomfortable experience.  I can't blame the waitress because she did her best to accommodate us but the food was well below average.  The sandwich was served like a burger on a bun without sauerkraut. No, the menu did not say it was a Reuben but who the heck eats corned beef on a bun with onion, lettuce, tomato, & pickles.  Absolutely gross!
author: Simone W.

description: By far the best vibe, service, hospitality and customer service from the bartender Dillion, I've found south of market.  Dillon had a very welcoming vibe once you walked in and made you feel right at home... Not to mention he had some amazing jokes to follow. 10 PLUS stars for the drinks but especially *****DILLON******
author: Karla D.

description: Outstanding service and staff. Dylan is excellent. Fish n chips are amazing too. Can't wait to come back.
author: Barry F.

description: Had a great time. Staff was super nice. The Shepherd's Pie (lamb, as it's supposed to be) was to die for. And the beer-battered fish was light and crispy. The space is VERY loud, so we left earlier than we wanted when it got crowded. But anything under the staff's control was on point.
author: Colleen A.

description:
I was searching for a sports bar to watch my Texas Longhorns play BYU... not exactly a popular game to watch in San Francisco!  After looking around on Yelp, I called the Chieftain to see if they were playing the game... they were not, but would be willing to put it on for me.  It was just the beginning of a very positive experience...

While it wasn't the loud sports bar I was expecting, they were more than gracious, changing the channel on the TV, turning up the volume for me, even though no other TV had the volume on, and I was the only one watching the game!  The staff was friendly and very accommodating... it was only once the place was super crowded that I had to wait more than a minute for service.

And as a bonus... the food is great!  While I wouldn't go back to watch a game (it's really not the place to go if that's your primary objective), I will definitely come back and try the other items on their menu.  And the special cocktail, "Coconut Shamrock" was awesome... I didn't plan on drinking that night, but I had more than one of those tasty drinks!
author: Jimmy F.

description: Great location - cute pub! Was a little disappointed with how loud it got as the night progressed...was meeting a colleague for dinner and it got nearly impossible to hold a conversation over the music and other noisy patrons. Not quite what I expected from a classic pub but would have been a great place for a group to come hang out and dance!
author: Ashleigh E.

description: I've been here twice since my friends used to live in the apartments above this place. The first time i think i had fish and chips but the 2nd time I had the Shepherd's Pie. It was Soooo good. I've never had shepherd's pie before that but it was pretty darn tasty. Environment-wise its an Irish Pub in sf so its what you'd expect a pub to be like, noisy, full of interesting characters, etc. Food's great tho!
author: Rehana K.

description:
Imagine getting away with your favorite girl. Imagine just happening upon a quaint, fun and hidden romantic spot as your first experience in your getaway. Imagine it also being your last experience before you leave the place you collectively shaped into bliss ..... 

Situated on the corner with the typical casual bar of brass, glass and light woods as well as the typical Irish-type setting of choices and ambiance - you are here. The Guinness is flowing and the food is damn good (we had brunch as well as lunch entrees). The service is totally laid back and awesome in both timing and friendliness. The patrons are sparse, eccentric and definitely all in their own little worlds. 

And then there's our own little world. 

Thank you Chieftain for making the entry and exit of bliss melt in my mouth.
author: Snuggly G.

description:
Really s lo w for a Saturday, so my roommate and I were getting watered and fed when we needed to be...

and the bartender even sat at our end and stuck his face in our biz in case would need him at a drop of a hat. Not at all intruding.

Great selection of beer, although I got my usual Jameson sour. Would definitely return to check out the Giants on their tvs next day game when I'm free!


I love Irish pubs, because there has never (in the many I have been in) been a time where I would never return. Might just make this my regular city bar. :)

Hats off to the Chieftain!
author: Jessica R.

description: Went there for lunch on a Monday and really enjoyed it! The wait staff is nice and helpful! Our food came out hot and quick! The drinks are strong! Yay! Such a fun pub with good food options! Can't wait to try it at night!
author: Erin W.

description:
All around great food served here.

I almost always order the Shepard's Pie and it's fantastic.  I have ordered most of what's listed under Chieftain Classics and they're all great.

Yesterday a friend and I went and she ordered the daily special: chicken & mushroom pot pie.  Amazing flaky pie top, with a salad to go with it.  

Definitely coming back on Thursday for the Fried Chicken daily special!!
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Good atmosphere, good prices, excellent food.

We had the Portobello Mushroom Burger, Shepherd's Pie and a couple of pints. Best meal I've had in a while. The Shepherd's Pie was the perfect amount of seasoning, and they use lamb. The Portobello Mushroom Burger has a great melody of flavors, a touch sweet but nothing overpowered anything else in there.

This isn't a place that I would drive into the city just to eat at, but I highly recommend it if you're in the area.
author: Kylee M.

description:
Oh yes, The Chieftain! This is currently one of my new favorite hangouts. I typically roll in with my friends on Thursday nights after trivia at another neighboring bar. Right when you walk in, you feel right at home, and so cozy. I've never had a hard time finding a table, but then again I haven't been on a weekend night. Servers are friendly and patient, and definitely efficient. 

The Chieftain has libations galore, and daily drink specials. 
The food is amazing, and I usually get the Smoked Turkey and Avocado sammie, served on wheat bread with lettuce, cheddar cheese (of course - yay cheese), and this mango chutney (of course since I'm a mango freak). Well, technically on the menu it's a pear chutney, but I swear it's mango. I digress. Anyway, this is a healthy item on the menu, which most Irish pubs and restaurants do not have. However, when you pair it with some french fries, I guess the meal isn't all that healthy! Regardless, they have a great diverse menu from the apps like the crab stuffed portobello app (so yummy), potato poppers, mussels, as well as the traditional burgers and sammies, and Chieftain's classics like bangers and mash and shepherd's pie. 

The Chieftain is in a good neighborhood and away from some of the craziness of the upper SOMA area. Great, dark interior and there are TVs throughout the bar for your sports watching. Oh, and there's even a trivia night here (which I haven't tried, but 2 trivia nights a week for me is a bit much). However, I'd be down to try their trivia night at least once. Why not, right?
author: Gill C.

description:
Quite possibly the worst Bloody Mary I've ever had. 

Stopped in here after a day of shopping for a drink. Have probably passed by hundreds of times since I live just blocks away. Noticed that they get quite crowded on occasion and had even turned away from trying them due to overcrowding before. 

Being a fan of good Blood Marys, decided to drop in after reading favorable reviews. Boy what a mistake! It tasted like they took what might have been an ok Bloody Mary and then poured half of it out and filled the rest with water. Yuck! Couldn't even finish it. Had to settle up and move on.
author: Paul M.

description:
My favorite neighborhood place.  Great people and great service.  Oh and great selection of beer and whiskey.  What else would you expect from the Irish place.  
Good to have you guy in the neighborhood!!
author: Alex R.

description: Fine place. Service was subpar, not interested in any chat or recommendation. Limited drafts - mostly macrobrews (Bud, etc.). Close to the Moscone center.
author: Marissa C.

description:
Good food, nice ambiance, great service.

My wife and I stopped in for a quick lunch during one of her business trips to San Francisco. She'd heard good things about the place on Yelp and we quickly saw why. We ordered a couple cheeseburgers and were pleasantly surprised with their thickness and taste. The fries were good -- although I think they could have been a little crispier.

Nice Irish bar feel and wonderful service. Maybe it's just because I live on the East Coast, but the waitress was incredibly attentive, polite, and helpful. I wouldn't hesitate to go here again.
author: Mike B.

description: Stopped by here after the Cal game for a beer and some dinner.  On a Saturday night it was fairly packed and the servers were very friendly and attentive. I ordered the BBQ ahi tuna with wasabi mustard sauce sandwich and it came with steak fries.  The tuna was covered in melted swiss cheese and the sandwich came with avocado slices, tomatoes, lettuce, and onions. The tuna was a little bit dry for my taste but nevertheless tasty.  This place is a great place for people to socialize and have a few pitchers with some friends *(they have a full bar I believe) and there are LCD screens mounted on different corners of the walls playing different sports from MLB, NCAA Football, to UFC.
author: Tim C.

description:
Hmm,

5 stars for an Irish pub??? How would I get to 5 stars for a pub? 

Let me count the ways...

1. Clean and literally dust free. They actually must dust this place because the wood louvers, and window sills had not a spec. 

2. Solid, hefty tables and nicely built booths. Quality of craftsmanship shows through. Padded seating so i can sit on my arse longer. 

3. Exceptional Beer selection (all my fav's) including prohibition ale and Bass Ale on tap. Full Bar of excellent spirits.

4. Nice roomy bar with padded stools.

5 A good amount of TV's without being in your face (like greens on Polk).

6. Attractive Crowd.

7. Attractive Food (and everything is tasty, and I've had much of the menu).

8. Great Service and servers.

9. Nice Decor. Someone really thought about the fans, and lighting. Good job to the management. You are obviously doing something right, and thinking about the customers. 

10. Great tunes on the jukebox. It was all 80's for the hour i was there today.

All this adds up to 5 stars. There we're no faults and over the past 4 or 5 visits I've been through here over the past year, everything is easy and spot on. If you want a good Irish bar that is clean and comfortable with good food and drink, attractive crowd and nice servers, The Chieftain is the spot.
author: Adam X.

description: The Pub is okey there are a few screens to watch the world cup and a good atmosphere but the service isn't so good and the food is also not so good.
author: Simon W.

description: Nothing special but really great service and a decent selection of beers and the bathroom is clean. We came as an alternative to Tempest down the street, which was just way too packed and loud.
author: Sonya Z.

description:
Usually come here for a drink when up in San Fran. They used to serve Boddingtons but now Kilkenny is the white guiness served. Steak cut fries are not very oily and the curry dipping sauce is pretty good. 

I had a Chicken ceaser salad which was pretty heavy on the chicken, I couldn't finish it. The burgers are always not disappointing.

Too noisy and crowded at night, but a great place to stop for lunch. Staff are very friendly and attentive.
author: Y B.

description: Nondescript little pub just a couple of blocks from the bart Powell Station and the Westfield Shopping Center. Friendly service, affordable menu, daily drink specials. Slainte!
author: Lori A.

description: Although we were late to the party the bartender led us to a great place to eat. The service from the bar was awesome and great drinks were recommended. Thanks Dylan for the superb service and great recommendations for San Fran!!
author: Al F.

description:
First off, this place earns a star right off the back for forcing all of the beer wenches to perform their duties with Irish accents.  Whether they are real or fake, I care not.  WENCH BRING ME MORE LAGER!

Secondly, their food is a fair deal of tasty.  This means a lot coming from a girl who loves neither sports bars, nor their food, nor their decor.  But you know what? The Chieftain is pretty good at all of the above.  I'm a big fan of the beef stew thing, with carrots, potatoes, and parsnips (p.s. what a cute word... paaarrrssss-nip.)  And I once saw someone eating a plate of the poverty pie, or whatever they call it, with the mashed taters on top, and it looked fabulous.

The sports are there, for sure, but they're quietly in the background of an otherwise dimly-lit, warm restaurant.  I prefer to sit opposite of the TV, so I can pretend that my dining partner's blank stare is actually wordless captivation resulting from my limitless diatribe about ghosts, pigeons, or some combination of the two.
author: Mari C.

description: Exceptionally nice and accommodating staff despite the huge influx of customers that came in to watch the start of the NFL season.  Televisions are placed around the bar so patrons can watch whatever game is on at any seat/table. I ordered the Bangers & Mash and was completely satisfied. It can be a little loud, but it's a bar so I wouldn't expect anything less than the noise level of a typical bar.  Overall fun and homey atmosphere, warm staff, filling food and decent prices.
author: Sabrina R.

description:
I was so inspired to write this review today, that I spent literally over 45 mintues trying to come up with the perfect words to reflect my unprecedented meal yesterday. 

Only to save it...without being logged in, and lose everything.

I'm taking it as a sign, that there was some room for improvement, and I am now well over twenty minutes late for my dinner party, and I am still determined to write this review.

A strong testament of a truly moving meal.

If fact It was the best meal that I have ever eaten in the financial district.

I repeat. The BEST!

From the moment we walked in our waitress was quick to serve and seat us. All with ease and a smile.  

And the meal...

Fresh grilled mahi-mahi fish with lime-aoli and ripe avocado on a toasted ciabatto roll with perfect fries (lightly browned and soft in the middle) and a lovely side of ranch dressing to dip them in. It was acutally our waitress who suggested the ranch dressing for our fries.

I was impressed. She obviously knew her "Dip 101"  - http://www.slate.com/id/2123991/.

Ranch dressing is a close second behind honey mustard.

And soooooo......here I am, a day later after my Cheiftain masterpeice, sitting on my bed listening to Otis Redding,  writing this review for the second time, about to be very late for my dinner party...

pining for savory Mahi-Mahi

in the evening dusk.

.....

Just wasting time.

((whistle))
author: Jessica T.

description:
Although I love San Francisco, I often miss Boston.  There is something about the pubs in Boston that make me feel like I'm coming home.  Maybe it's the raucous patrons, the smell of the fish and chips, or because I've got a little Irish in me.  I don't know what it is- but the Chieftain brings that feeling back (minus the snow outside).  

Why the Chieftain will become a regular for me:

-I got the parking spot RIGHT OUT FRONT.  While I may not always need it, I always love to see my parking karma in action.

-The guy who Nicole and Jessica set the happy hour with was AWESOME.  So were the other bartenders, who didn't laugh at me too much when I ordered a mudslide (which turned out to be a bad idea later, but oh well).

-The fries are yummy.  

-They have 3 strategically placed t.v.s which might be beneficial for watching some Sox beat some Angels...

----And although it is unrelated, there was the cutest puppy ever outside, looking all forlorn and just waiting for me to take her home.  Which I didn't.  But I thought very hard about it, because she was THAT cute.

This is a place I'll definitely be visiting again, and I will definitely try a burger.
author: Pam S.

description:
Lots of hustle, but on a Friday evening it's hard to keep up with the crowd.  

Two waitresses were working like crazy that night, and I saw lots of burgers and dinners fly by.  When I first walked in one of them asked me what I wanted, but as the evening went by and the business picked up, I had to compete for their attention.  Guinness was $6 a pint, PBR half that.  

Never mind the great french fries, which became a hot commodity as hungry Yelpers arrived.  It was the Yelpers who made the evening, not the food and beer.  Thank you for arranging "the last DYL for 2010," Kristina! 

I also noticed as the evening went on that the place seemed to get smaller.  I mean between the time I walked in around 7 pm and left around 1 am, it shrank by about half its size.  Does beer really affect depth perception, or was it that I actually picked my head up and looked around?  

There were plenty of Yelpers and non-Yelpers alike for great conversations.
author: David D.

description: Good stuff, good ambience and food. Just one drawback they have a really rude lady. Totally ruined our experience !!
author: Karan S.

description: Decent pub fare, nothing life changing, but when you're in the mood for a good shepherds pie, nothing else will really do. This place can definitely satisfy that occasional urge.
author: Mark B.

description: Second time here - this time we had the Shepard's Pie and the Corned Beef and Cabbage - both were excellent!
author: Patrick M.

description:
This little bastian of Ireland is like a little island that broke off Eire and went adrift from the north Atlantic, around Cape Horn and the Indian ocean, and across the pacific to San Francisco, landing amidst the hustle bustle of downtown SF, SOMA to be exact, near the Metreon entertainment complex and the Moscone Center. 

It is a small pub with a nice small pub feel, with dark woods, a mantled head piece bar with cubby holes, and a friendly crowd of locals grabbing a sandwich and a brew. 

We stopped for a quick lunch on a workday. My friend got the corned beef and cabbage and I got the corned beef sandwich with cheese and fries. 

I love me some CBC but I like it with a choice of 3 or 4 mustards with it, like dijon, mustard seed, and some other exotic flavor. They may have had these, I don't know, but it was French's squeeze bottles on the table. So for me, the CB sandwich was a decent choice. 

They have a variety of Irish favorites in food and spirits, but also the typical faire you would find in most any Bay Area diner or brew pub.

Our waitress was a lovely lass with a brogue any ex-Dubliner would be proud of, and she had a fine spirit and a sparkle in her eyes that would make ordering another pint almost as happy as dancing a jig!
author: Wanugee N.

description: The Battered Mashed Potato Appetizer is phenomenal!
author: Lisa F.

description:
The bartender called me sweetheart,

and I liked it. :)

It was packed, so packed it was tough to navigate around.  Luckily, I'm small and stealth.  The friendly bartenders were doing a great job of keeping up with the large crowd.

I scored a strategic spot in the corner booth, so I was able to people watch.  There are 3 large tv's, the one above me was showing a baseball game, the one to the right of me seemed to have various sport stories running and the one directly in front of me was showcasing the 2001/2002 Raiders. :l 

Tuck rule my ass.

Thanks to that programming selection, I suddenly needed another drink.

The food looked and smelled great.  I heard a lot of compliments rolling around about it.  I wasn't hungry but was coerced into trying the crab dip and it was good.

tip: The malt vinegar is the same shape and size of a beer bottle.  Just be careful.  *wink* Nicole *cough* :P
author: Jenn N.

description:
I still have not had a chance to come on fried chicken night. Or if i have, i always come late and they've run out. Total bummer.

This was the first bar around that i know of to start carrying Oktoberfest brew IN JULY. Big points there. I came here a lot after work until i moved across town. This place has the best bangers and mash i've ever had, and the baked beans were terrific.

Everyone i know pretty much loves this pub too, but it can get pretty crowded. Meh.

I seriously just took a 10 minute break in writing this review to write an email to my friend saying we should go here later this week.
author: Phuong M.

description: The place you can sit down, talk, drink and eat!! The food was good, typical bar food, great burger, reasonable, too.
author: Yoko S.

description:
Awesome place to watch sports, relax, drink a beer, and eat some solid food in a very casual, relaxed, no-frills no-ego atmosphere. As far as a basic sports/Irish bar goes, this place is superb.

Beer - nothing super fancy ... but properly poured Guinness, cold Anchor Steam on tap, and a few other basic beers.

Food - the basic Irish bar grub ... burgers, wings, calamari, bangers & mash, sandwiches. again, nothing super fancy, but super well-done basics, plus a dash of interesting and tasty options (lamb chili is superb, specials each day including a chicken adobo that sticks to your belly)

Price - reasonable, appropriate

Bartenders - attentive and friendly in a very matter-of-fact, not in-your-face way

Waitstaff - good enough, did their job and were friendly

Seating - for a small place, plenty of options ... bar stools, high tables with stools, a few smaller tables, a few larger tables

Bathroom - darn clean for a bar ... and a very interesting (and surprisingly useful) custom of taping newspapers with the day's top news over the urinal ... 

Entertainment - certain evenings, they have live performances ... I don't know if it was because I was already seated, but I didn't get charged a cover. The two times I saw someone, they were very good and enjoyable ... sort of general rock/guitar stuff.

For a frame of reference, I found this place because I was looking for a bar in that area with TVs showing the Stanley Cup (Boston Bruins) games, where I could enjoy the game with a Guinness ... this place fit the bill well. There were a good number of TVs, some with captions. I would definitely return sometime just for a drink or a quick bite ... or perhaps to see a game again.
author: J C.

description:
A nice place...I stopped in for anightcap with a friend after a VERY long day.
It was dim and busy, but not a depressing dive; the right kind of place to just relax and have a chat or laugh before calling it a night.
author: Ed B.

description: I just had the best fish and chips and I've even been to England! The atmosphere at this lovely pub in the heart of downtown San Francisco was welcoming. The staff was incredibly friendly and didn't sneer when I begged for their lightest beer. Now to the good part. The cod was fresh and cut into lovely fingers. The breeding was not to greasy or heavy, just the perfect compliment to the tender cod. The chips were the perfect compliment, they melt in your mouth. I will be back before my trip ends.
author: Sarah M.

description: My favorite Irish pub in San Francisco, mainly because the kitchen recipes are the best for hearty pub food anywhere. Reminds me of the bars back home in eastern Canada. I live the bangers and mash with real English style beans, the stew which has lots of turnips and the lamb burger. Actually, just about everything on the menu is great, and there's a great beer selection. The TVs show sports, though they keep the big screen off until there's a big game so as not to detract from the atmosphere at other times.  For me, the only negative is it gets really loud Friday nights and they have live music but it's not where you want to be for a conversation. That said, it's my default go to pub after a long day at work.
author: Derek D.

description: Great place to watch a game with locals.
author: Megan P.

description: Small pub with a decent menu of grub. The ambiance and design is very pleasant. The staff was friendly and attentive. The live Irish band in the corner was lively and really set the mood for a night out in the city for my wife and I. The breeze whipping in the front door (propped open) was a bit chilly, so bring your jacket.
author: David H.

description:
Damn fine food.  In the SOMA area it can be a bitch to find a decent place that doesn't get outrageous.  This place was cozy and not insane when i went.  

I had the irish breakfast and it reminded me why I miss the UK.  Everything was tasty even the puddings which many Yanks balk at.  But the black pudding was peppery and savory and the white pudding was subtle and well made.  My Girl had the Shepard's Pie and she was well pleased with it, and that girl can be picky about a shepard's.

They didn't have Strongbow but they had Magners which will do in a pinch.  One of my girl's friends had some slippery nipple sex on the pink martini glass type drink which she liked.  

It feels a little stereotypical but I'm all right with that.  Feels a touch of a movie set really with the big fake aged beams and dark decor to make it feel smoky when CA doesn't allow smoking within a 1000 yards of anything.  They had American Football on some TVs and proper football on others.  I think they even had some Gaelic Sports League coverage which was awesome.
author: Miles C.

description:
In all of these years, I'd never been to the Chieftain. It looks a bit divey from the outside, so I was expecting sticky floors and tabletops but was pleasantly surprised to find a relatively bright, nice little pub. 

A couple of us went to the Chieftain for lunch and beers (it had been a long week). I suppose if you're playing hooky to watch sports, this is also a good place to catch a game during the workday (and probably on weekends too). On a Friday afternoon, the place was ~75% full so there was no wait and somebody to seat you (which gives it an advantage over the madness that can occur at Zebulon during the lunch hour). 

I got the burger with cheddar cheese and avocado (yes, that's my version of a healthy burger - it doesn't have bacon!), and the burger was cooked to my order (medium!) and tasty. I'm a believer in steak fries (it takes me back to my youth spent at Lyon's restaurants), so I was happy to find steak fries with my burger. Steak fries can be delicious, especially when they are super fried and still nice and potatoey on the inside (like the ones at the Chieftain). Plenty of beers on tap - looked like there were ~8.

Our server was super nice and helpful, and the food arrived quickly. We were in and out in ~45 minutes without any need to hurry the kitchen or the server. 

A pricier lunch option (burgers start at $9 with extras...costing extra) but pretty good for a sit-down, high-quality meal.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Saturday after catching my friend's show at 965 Mission, the entire troupe and guests walked the one block over to the Chieftain, a long standing establishment on 5th, nodding indifferently to the thousands of tourists headed toward Union Square.

Dark rich woods dominate the interior, with mirrors reflecting the numerous low lighting throughout and the more you drink, the more attractive people become.  Usually frequented by regulars, sometimes the occasional tourist(s) stop in and its amusing to find the shift in conversations and decibel levels do to adjust.  We always sit around the center poles, since it makes for easier conversations and elbow room reserved for friends only.  Tonight, however, found us lining the back wall for stability and warmth.

Most of our group elected for the red wines and beer, but I was on a vodka tonic run.  Bartender was friendly and servicing.  Took my order without having to deal with a line of people clamoring for attention.

Drink was smooth and light, but I felt the vodka hit me right thereafter.  I understand my flirtations drifted over to another member at the table, but it was all held with respectable intentions.

There were several groups of different classifications of people. but in this bar, these categories are dropped at the door.  Great atmosphere, great layout, and the perfect place to get together with a group of wonderful people.
author: Miika M.

description: I'm in therapy after experiencing their terrible service. Typical Irish pub food with below average quality and above average prices. Shit drinks, shit service.
author: Jacqueline O.

description: Definitely liked this pub. Very authentic feeling and I've heard that the food is excellent. Unfortunately, I never got to try any as I went on St. Patty's day to listen to music and the place was packed. Managed to get a beer relatively fast though...they've got a really excellent bar here
author: Lily K.

description: I don't often post reviews but when I feel the need arises I must.... Unfortunately I hate to give a mediocre review to an Irish establishment especially being Irish myself. But I have been to the Chieftain a few times among other Irish bars, but here its really hit and miss from my experiences at least. I was moved from a table to supposedly accommodate a group of 4 but during my whole time at the bar/restaurant only one person of that 4 was present and the server didn't even apologise or offer to reseat me.... When finally after seating myself at the bar- I found the bar man to be snappy at best.... After waiting for 5 minutes for him to even say hello he didn't. All he said was when ever your ready and disappeared for another few minutes... This again is bad customer service where customers should firstly be greeted.... I think their Irish Breakfast is good but unfortunately I don't eat tomatoes so I request some extra fries. And without fail every time I'm lucky to get 5-6 fries on my plate. This is extremely disappointing service especially after being told by the barman that I'll get extra as a substitute for the tomatoe. Also not once did he ask me was everything ok and 20 minutes after I finished my first drink did he ask do I want another... So I guess today the staff we're having a bad day. And the review is really based on the service received. So unfortunately no tip here. Thanks.
author: Mark R.

description: Great beer, great food, great place when in San Fran! If your in town make sure you stop by.
author: Keith S.

description:
I'd been here a couple times for drinks with my dearest lumberjack. Usually we'd stop here en route to some other place but on our most recent visit, the final SF DYL of 2010, this is where we began and ended our evening.

First, though, I was hungry. We hadn't had dinner yet and I needed meat. It took a while to flag down someone (the place was packed) but once I did, my order was in and she returned often enough that I had no real reason to get up for anything (except going to the bathroom). 

The burger was deelicious. The meat: meatilicious- thus satiating my carnivorous cravings. The burger dripped with wickedly delicious meat juice which begged to get licked (truly, it did.). My dude ordered a burger as well and split it with a ravenously famished friend. (He is so sweet!) They ate up everything, including the drippy meat juice.

The burger came with just a handful of fries. It makes sense because the burger is really quite a meal on its own. Still, I love carbs. I ordered a couple more rounds of fries but they seem to have evaporated really quickly. 

Word to the wise: order extra fries.
author: Loli L.

description: Cool little hidden gem with good prices and better than average bar food.
author: Lauren C.

description: Stopped in to watch the England v Italy game the other day. Great atmosphere and outstanding food. Service was also very good! All in all very good!!
author: John D.

description: We loved this place. It was so nice to find a non tourist infested destination. It has a neighborhood bar feeling and really good bar food. We had the rueben; the chieftain burger and the corned beef dinner along with Guiness drafts. All of it was very good but the real magic was the atmosphere. There was a Giants home game on all the TV s and the crowd was attentive and very supportive. It was so fun to cheer along!  The only warning is the location. We walked from our hotel and the neighborhood was a little sketchy especially after dark.
author: A L.

description: Stumbled across this place with a friend after our other plans went awry - what a pleasant surprise.  I opened the door and through the dim light I saw tables filled with business folk in suits.  But despite that, we headed in and were greeted politely by the hostess.  Two different staff members came to our table with menus and checked on us regularly.  The food was good.  And there was a soccer game on the big screen.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I think the yelp community would benefit from more reviews that get straight to the point.  Kind of like this.
This place had

1) Great Food
2) Decent Pricing for the Great Food
3) Available Parking
4) Great Customer Service

This is what I thought about various elements of my experience at this business.  You see my rating, and you know what factors led to that rating.
author: Warren C.

description: Good food, good beer, good service. I ended up walking here for food since it was so close to my hotel while visiting SF and it turned out to be a great decision
author: Midnight B.

description:
My roommate and I happen to both work in SOMA, but just far enough away that we aren't in walking distance. However we do own mopeds and meet in the middle for lunch about once a week!

He decided upon this place when I requested he find somewhere that had a burger to calm the craving beast that was inside of me. That alongside beer and I'm happy anyday.

I ordered Budvar from the Czech Republic. The girl said it was rare and everyone was ordering it. Plus my roots are Bohemian from Czech Republic...and I figured then was the best time to try a beer from the homeland.

It was amazing. 

So we were drinking our beers, and realized that...whoa! 40 minutes had already gone by....where is our food???

He said that we should just wait, it is going to be amazing.

It finally came and it was more than amazing. Totally worth the wait and a few extra minutes of lunch time praying my boss didn't yell at me =D

We are definitely going back (besides the wait time).

Even though it took long, there were only a few people eating at the time we went. So since it shouldn't have taken quite as long as it did...minus one star.

UPDATE: My roommate and I went back again (but after work this time so we didn't have to worry about running late during lunch) and got Fish and Chips. 

O.M.G. Best Fish and Chips in the town! Lots of fish, easy on the batter (which was also light in consistency) and good fries. I'd say, "The best Fish and Chips in the town"!
author: Jennifer P.

description: Great classic Irish food. My brother and I had the Shepard's Pie and Fish and Chips. He couldn't finish his pie, but I helped him out with that. I just couldn't stop eating. Fortunately or unfortunately, I didn't order a pint of Irish stout to go with the meal. I don't think I could have finished the meal if I did order a pint, but I'm sure it would have been great with the meal. I'm looking forward to visiting again when I'm in the city again.
author: Steven L.

description: Oh my lord! The spicy potato balls or whatever they're called are seriously amazing. Worth a trip across the bridge alone. Cheap pints, great atmosphere and my waitress, Melissa, was awesome and totally there when my glass was empty!
author: Kris P.

description: AUTHENTIC Irish pub in the heart of San Francisco, just a few blocks away from Union Square! I was really satisfied to have this as my first meal when I arrived in SF over thanksgiving weekend as my last time there was an utter disaster! We randomly spotted this place while walking out and about after checking into our hotel, when we walked in we expected there not to be much to eat but decided to grab a table and check out the menu anyways. SO glad we did!!! Me and my best friend were completely satisfied with our meal! I went with the 'Chieftain Burger' per waitresses recommendation and she was so darn right!!! The food tasted of the savory flavor as all authentic Irish food should! Can't wait till the next time I'm up North, definitely will be back here for a meal or two! Awesome deals on Yelp!, and unique selection of bourbon, beers, and whiskey's! Don't second guess this place if you don't wanna be let down.
author: Harout S.

description: I always stop by this Pub when I'm in frisco and it's also super close to the mall... it's my favorite Irish Pub in the nation and I have been to a few.  They have Jameson stations on both sides of the bar. Smithwicks, killions, guinness etc for beer... Plus the food is good.  The last time i was there was on a wednesday night, around 11pm and a group of 4 irish chicks with irish passports came in looking for jobs, which goes to tell you that you never know what's going down on weekday either.  I left though since it was getting late and i had to still drive home and get up at 5am.  Hope that old guy scored a number or at least a name... who knows maybe he found a new house maid.  Enough of story time, this place is a great pub whether you are by yourself or with a crew, on a crowded weekend or a casual weekday... 4 stars!
author: E N.

description: If you are ever in the mood for a black and tan and a house burger with egg, this is the spot. You can't go wrong. Great atmosphere, they have a few Tvs there playing the sports game and one projector right in the middle of the bar.  I like it too cause when you need to take a piss, they got the SF Chronicle pinned up on the wall, lol.
author: Sameer P.

description: After reading yelp for offers around my hotel, decided to try the fish and chips at Chieftain. OMG..the best I've had since leaving Chicago! The batter is great. The fish light and flaky. Highly recommend!
author: Michele T.

description: I wanted to like this place so badly. I might have come on an off day. I ordered the  Fish and Chips which was a yelp reviewer favor dish, and it wasn't very good. I didn't get much fish with it with. The cider I had was good but that was about it. It felt like it was more of a spot people just hung out at after work during happy hour.
author: Beebe L.

description: Came to the Chieftan during Pride Weekend, on our way home. It is conveniently located near a BART station, which made it a perfect place to grab a quick lunch. We weren't in the mood for a beer, but they did have a nice drink menu with different beverages with Guinness. We ended up ordering the Pastrami and Swiss sandwich and Shepherd's Pie. Super healthy. The corned beef was juicy and flavorful and plentiful! The French fires that came with were also pretty good too! The star was the Shepherd's Pie, which of course had a Guinness gravy. The lamb was great and everything about that pie was amazing. I would definitely order both of those dishes again. The waitress was friendly and attentive for the most part, even though it wasn't busy at all. This is a great place to hang out, drink Guinness and eat delish Irish food.
author: Sarah E.

description: I love a good Pub & this is a Great Pub.  Watching football, the half & half beer and the food. OMG the food is just incredible! My Grilled Chicken burger was just fresh!  The tomatoes, red onions just popped in flavor!  The fries awesome.  The server was a 10 as far as we were concerned.  I will return there with friends again soon and again and again!
author: Karolyn H.

description: Great solid bar to hit up after a long day at work. Casual, loud at times, great energy, and good food too. This is the place to be for some good "craic"!! You irishman know what I'm sayin...! Slanche! :)
author: Courtney M.

description:
My newly discovered Irish pub in the city. 
Very chilled and cozy setting. 
Friendly staff and service. 
Good simple Pub menu.
Good fresh Guinness, very close to what I had in Dublin... very important!
author: Truc N.

description:
Wandered in here kind of by accident, hungry and in need of a bloody mary we entered curiously. 

Sat at the bar, took a bit to get noticed but eventually ordered bloodys and the eggs benedict. 

The bloodys were kinda eh, and lacking lime and garnish which is a big no no in my book! The food was great. Eggs were perfect, sauce was delish, irish bacon...yes plz! The heinz baked beans are a good touch as well and the potatoes were spot on.

This is definitely a cool little place, although the atmosphere and general vibe of the other patrons was a little off-putting..ill be back someday!
author: Britney K.

description: After 2 years of giving The Chieftain" 1 more chance"  the day bartender finished it off for me. After a mediocre lunch I asked for my check. He acknowledged me, rang it up and just walked away and went to the kitchen, walked around the room, hung out with his friends, chatted with the server and the manager and just left me standing there with my money in my hand. Last time.
author: Richard L. D.

description:
We used to go to The Chieftain for their fun trivia night. They're very generous with their top prize - a $60 gift certificate to (try to guess, try to guess...) The Chieftain. Unfortunately, that meant we begrudgingly ate their food on many occasions, and we'd always half wish we'd lost. There wasn't a bright spot in the whole menu except for the fish and chips about which I can say: they were decent.

Out of 5 Stars
Trivia Fun: 4 
Trivia Prize: 4
Odds of Winning: 3
author: Kathleen M.

description: Exactly what I was looking for. An Irish pub with cold beer and good food....and close to the convention center. I had the lamb burger and my buddy had the corn beef sandwhich/burger. He said it was the best he ever had. The lamb burger was damn tasty as well. The waitress was very nice and friendly. Did I mention cold beer? Love the place.
author: Kalen K.

description:
I've gone here a few times now and it's decent pub fare. There's tvs and it's pretty noisy at times with people watching various sports. 

Appetizers, a range of burgers, Irish/British based food, lots of beer.  I've heard the Bangers and Mash are amazing, but I can't verify that.  The fries really are great though (thick cut steak style yum!)  I've also tried the potato skins, the nachos and the veggie burger.  I noticed a portobello burger on the menu, that's definitely something I need to try next time I'm in.

Overall, the options are very slim for a vegetarian.  Surprisingly, the cocktail list also isn't very long and I saw nothing on it that I wanted to try (wound up going with vodka/cranberry instead) but I wager the beer is what most people go here for.  I'm very picky about what flavours of beer I like and none of what they had appealed to me, so I didn't try any.

Not a bad place to stop by for a quick bite or a place to hang out with friends while munching on snacks and having a few drinks.  It's really close to the movie theatre so a good option if you're looking for something quick beforehand.
author: Cassandra J.

description: Great location but very busy during the evening hours. Nice shepherds pie. Lots of live Irish music and a nice variety of patrons. I was kind of underwhelmed by their draft choices but it wasn't that bad.
author: Stevie C.

description: This place is such a treat in the SOMA! Last night before my girlfriend and I's long walk to Thirsty Bear, we stopped here to grab a drink before we endured the cold wind of San Francisco. It was my friends birthday, so I ordered Patron shots w/ lime. Once the bartender figured out it was her birthday, he made her something special too. It was in shot form, but apparently it tasted like chocolate cake. The place is div-ey.. and looking around I remember everyone had some food on their table, which meant this place had good eats. So, we got our shots, warmed up our bodies, and began our adventure in SF.
author: Briana W.

description: Loved this little pub... we stopped by here last weekend for lunch after walking several miles around the city. It's pretty small but in a quaint/cozy way; in fact, it really did remind me of a pub you'd find in Ireland or in a more suburban town in Great Britain. The food was both affordable and tasty; I would recommend the corned beef sandwich or shepherd's pie as both were delicious! We didn't order any beer but they had a good variety on tap (and of course, plenty of Guinness/Guinness combinations). The service was a little slow, but everyone was very friendly. All in all, it's a decent place to check out if you're craving hearty food and beer!!
author: Heather M.

description:
We were wandering the streets for way too long looking for another restaurant before we gave up and ended up here. Cute little Irish Pub - we were sat at a high top bar table, which I love. It was a Sunday night so it wasn't very busy, but the waitress somehow kept forgetting about us. She was friendly enough though and we weren't in any hurry. I wasn't super hungry as we had a late lunch, so I ended up with the Grilled Cheese Toastie (on sourdough, of course). The bread was great, the cheese on the other hand was very cheap tasting and in way too high of quantity. My friend was actually laughing at me trying to eat it. The fries weren't very good either (not seasoned at all), but certainly edible. 

It is a cute place though and I would probably have liked it better if we had just gone for beers and not food.
author: Amy S.

description: I went into the Chieftain for a quick drink and left with a smile on my face.  Dylan was behind the bar.  He was so kind and treated us really well.  You can get a drink anywhere, but these days you are usually greeted by some hipster jerk with a long beard and bad attitude; someone who doesn't give you the time of day.  Dylan was the opposite.  So hospitable and unassuming.  Thanks to Dylan, we will be back!
author: katie b.

description: Pretty pretty pretty good.  I had fish and chips with mashed potatoes instead of the chips.  The fish was very very good.  I would definitely come here again.  The bartender was friendly and there was a live Irish band playing traditional Irish music.
author: Ashraf L.

description:
I love this place on a night out. The food here is relatively well priced and the wait staff is friendly. 

They have a massive selection of drinks from a craft-brew to regular old PBR. The food is tremendous. Its all very stick-to-your-ribs pub food. I like that its actual food there, bangers and mash, fish and chips, shepherd's pie. Not the usual deep fried assortment. 

BTW, the curry cheese fries are INSANE! I've never done crack, but if you melted cheese on top of it, I bet it would be this good. I don't like curry as a rule but this is one huge exception. Order them and thank me later.
author: Kevin D.

description:
After a hard day at the office I came across this little gem of a bar...greeted with a smile I soon settled in. The lamb burger was recommended by the friendly Irish bartender- I was not disappointed- best burger I have had in awhile!!!

Overall a great experience. I willI be back.
author: John A.

description: Found this place on Yelp with fairly good reviews. I'd say it didn't disappoint at all. We went on a Thursday night around 8 pm for dinner and beer. It was extremely small and very crowded when we walked in so I was immediately discouraged. However, we were greeted almost immediately and the hostess said it would be about a 5 minute wait.  We only waited a few minutes and were seated. The beer and alcohol selection was good. We ordered our beers which cane quickly and then our food. Much to my surprise we only waited another 8 to 10 minutes for our food. My fiancé ordered the Shepard pie and I had the Turkey BLT. Both were hot and EXTREMELY delicious!  The chipotle sauce is to die for! By far the beat sauce I've had anywhere.  With how busy it was the waitress only checked in once, but I wasn't bothered by that because the food and beer were so good. It is a little more spendy then I'd like($45 for 2 people), but overall I'd encourage relaxed and go with the flow people to check it out. If I visit san francisco again I'll remember this place!
author: Sheena W.

description: Great beer selection and friendly waitresses, especially the blondey one! I've been to most Irish bars in San Francisco and this is one of my favorites. And just happens to be conveniently located a block or two from the SF mall :)
author: Siobhan M.

description: Great Irish bar would recommend the potato bites and the lamb burger (with a side of curry sauce) -  good place to watch a game on the big screen
author: Fiona R.

description: Awesome burger and nice beer selection on tap.
author: Brian R.

description:
