Ceiling gazing almost always means lack of intrigue.  It was a really nice ceiling.  The good news is, it was easy to hear everyone in my party talk (even using their inside voices) and the place felt clean and relaxed.

I would like to come back some night that isn't Monday.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
At first glance it seems like any other irish bar, only a little more crowded than most and with consistently great service.

But this irish bar serves a burger with a fried egg in it. (I know, it sounds gross, but tasting it is like seeing the Kyrgyz Light.)

Does the Plough and The Stars have such a burger? I don't think they do. The Four Deuces doesn't either, and while The Liberties had some good food last time I was there, I don't think they have a burger like this. The Dogs Bollix? Please.

There's soccer and rugby and stuff on TV too, but I think most other bars have those. But not fried egg burgers.
author: matthew r.

description: Nice neighborhood pub in not the best of neighborhoods.  Multiple tvs, and a big projector screen to watch the game, although on Saturday they were randomly playing the UC Davis game....who cares about UC Davis?
author: Lisa H.

description:
In order to review The Chieftain I have to make it very clear that I may be biased. I live above it and truly have no choice but to love it. 

The wonderful thing about it is, it's always there, looming in the background (well really just underneath me) like a friend's gift you gladly display whether or not you like it. 
If I have a dinner party and the food sucks, well we can go downstairs. If I run out of beer, we can go downstairs and pay 4.50 for a Sierra Nevada. If I need to watch rugby at 6am, I can go downstairs....

No, really the bar is a great place. The staff is always happy and talkative, and the food ROCKS! So you should go, just be prepared for it to wrap you into its cocoon-like atmosphere, and not spit you out until you are a drunk, but beautiful butterfly.
author: Stephany T.

description:
It was a HORRIBLE day weather wise in San Francisco, freezing, dumping rain, windy, you name it...it was coming down.

So when my boyfriends sister and I were suppose to do lunch I was hesitant to leave my nice warm office.  But I grew a pair and headed out in the rain, what I found was like an optical illusion, like seeing a perfect watering hole in the desert.

When we walked in the door it was warm, smelled amazing, bustling and full of constructions workers on their lunch break...score!

Some how we scored the best table in the place, the beer specials were good ALL DAY, and their small menu actually had several things I wanted to try.  The service was great, the server was a cute upbeat gal who didnt mind the fact that I sent my salad dressing back.

The bill with lunch beers was about $30, totally worth it.  I will definatley be back, lord knows I need to know all the bars with in walking distance from my work!
author: Alicia K.

description:
Fish and chips from the fucking gods. Seriously that fish was just what I was looking for. 

We came here on a Friday and it was packed and noisy. But honestly, I didn't really mind. It was fun. So fun I drank like 5 black and tans, which I had literally been visualizing ordering and drinking all week long.

Tasty beer and good not too greasy, melt in your mouth fish. Yum.

Note: Bathroom door lock is funky. I walked in on a girl. Be careful to check it before you sit down to pee.
author: Andi R.

description:
A great place to go after work for a drinks and a good burger. It's the kind of pub you like to go after work to decompress with coworkers and friends and gossip about the people who are not there.  

While I probably would not come here on a weekend night or if I worked far away, I still highly recommend this spot.
author: Lupe P.

description:
I was pretty drunk by the time I made it to The Chieftain at the end of a pub crawl; but what I do remember about the bar is that it had a very cool and authentic Irish theme, the Irish car bombs were cheap and delicious, and the non-Irish bartender was nice. The huge selection of Irish whiskeys and single malt Scotches was also very impressive; a bigger variety than I've seen in most bars around SF.

I'll have to come back and try some food...
author: Aaron J.

description: After going to kells and Murphys Pub a while back... I have decided to try another Irish Pub which was called The Chieftain Irish Pub & Restaurant... I came here on a non busy monday before 12:00 p.m. the place maybe small but who cares... All, I know is that the food at The Chieftain Irish Pub was really good!!! What, I have ordered from their menu was a half pound Lamb Burger which came with fries of course and also the one thing you gotta have to go along with the Lamb Burger & Fries... The Guiness Beer!!!!!!!!! The service of this Irish Pub was excellent the food that, I have ordered came to my table really fast from my server!!!!!!!! The restrooms that they have here at The Chieftain Irish Pub & Restaurant are really neat and clean!!!!!!!  Before going inside to The Chieftain Irish Pub & Restaurant  to eat lunch... I had also noticed that there was a yelp sticker that was on the window at this Irish Pub which probably means alot of yelpers have came here to eat and gave their yelp reviews...
author: William B.

description: Great Irish pub. Perfect beer selection, I recommend the Murphy's Stout. The bartender was great. Also a good bourbon and whiskey selection. I never tried the food as we closed out the night each day at the Chieftain while in San Fran.
author: Jason D.

description: Went here for the first time last night with a bud of mine. The location is pretty good if you work down town or in the SOMA and they have a great selection of beer on tap as well as whiskeys. The bar tender was very nice and knew what she was talking about in all regards to liquor. Didnt get to try the food but will do the next time i go back. I was pretty surprised that the place was not crowded AT ALL; even on a sat. night. But sometimes that's kind of nice.
author: Tyler L.

description:
Good drinks, excellent bar food, and friendly service. The Chieftain burger, fully loaded with two cheeses, onions, bacon and a fried egg will kill any hangover. A great stop for after a Giants game, Metreon movie or shopping.

Update: Camille the bartender! I crush.
author: jim b.

description:
bartender is vomiting demons as the jukebox is corroding my soul. Oprah is on the Television and she's followed by DR PHIL (satan) 
    "NOOO!!! i will not tolerate humanity any longer" the bartender screams like a fierce wind blowing maddening destruction of everything as the blood from inside us is beckoning the outside world. pounding at the door to the other side of our skin and flowing to all extremities, building and throbing and finally, we all exploded.

       -looking back it was quite an experience to have. but at the time it was excruciating and terrifying.
author: Pflip W.

description:
The Chieftain has a decent atmosphere and good beers on tap. Although with it's proximity to the street traffic, you never know when an errrant taxi cab or MUNI bus will crash through the front door. Hey, it happened to that porn shop on the corner of 6th & Mission a couple years ago, so you never know.

The service is average, but easily overlooked when they throw in some hot fries and Premiership Football into the mix. The Chieftain should definitely upgrade it's televisions. Other than that, you've got a decent 4-star pub conveniently located downtown.
author: Be N.

description:
One of the best pints of Guinness in the city - woot!

Great food.  I wish they'd bring back the "deep fried spuds of love" - well, that's what we called the potato bites.  Mashed potatoes, rolled into balls, dipped in hot sauce, then deep fried and served with ranch.  Your health-food option.

Was there once and a group was having a fun birthday party - you can order platters of food and drinks and bring all your friends - kewl.
author: Lis W.

description:
I really enjoy Chieftain's.  The drinks are good, the food is good, the staff is friendly.  If you want to have a good burger, Guinness stew or shepherd's pie with a pint - I definitely recommend this place.  

(Also, they tend to have at least 2-3 sporting events on their TVs at all times.  This made college football season very enjoyable!)
author: Mackenzie O.

description: So i don't live in the city anymore i live about 80 miles from it and coming to San Francisco is always a treat for me cause we always got to The Chieftain. I was introduced to it last year and have fallen in love with it. It is a salt of the earth Irish bar with more whiskey then i have seen in one place besides Bev Mo.  Their service is always fa nominal and i feel right at home with all people who walk in the door from the old timers to the young adult baseball fans. Defiantly a place to stop in when Ur in the city.
author: Amber H.

description:
Irish Pub is usually not my kind of theme but I had a very good time at the Chieftan.  

One friendly bartender and one aloof bartender both of whom poured a surprisingly good drink.
author: lisa g.

description:
Pretty decent neighborhood pub. Came here for round three on Friday night. It was pretty packed, but we managed to get a table. 

Decent selection of beer and all the liquor you could need. 

Clean bathroom too.
author: Jen D.

description:
This is a decent utility Irish Bar. 

You will come in here for two reasons: to get drunk, or to have a drink on the way to getting drunk. The crowd is fun but in  that specific way that typically involves youth, loudness and stumbling. 

Also screaming laughter.
author: Karsten P.

description:
This is a watering hole, but not a whole in the wall. (But PS. They do have a food menu).

It's a no big deal place that you can go to a thousand times over with friends and just grab a drink.  

Tons of tables (high top, booth-like, and low top) gives you a thousand ways to hang here.

The service rocks - very responsive and totally down-to-earth.

They have trivia on Tuesdays but have never been.

I always get the Guinness.
author: Mandy S.

description:
UPDATE:

So, a lot has happened in the last year at the Chieftain.  Menu chopping, chef scramming, door replacing.  I'm sad to say its not the same place it used to be.  They've cut the menu down to a few burgers/sandwiches and a handful of standard dishes, upped the prices on some of the items and essentially shot themselves in the foot, in my book.  The quality has gone way down hill and I can no longer justify recommending it.  

I still pop in every once in awhile, but mostly because I have secret crushes on a few of their waitresses.  

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

I work a block away from The Chieftain and go there for lunch at least once or twice a week.
The food is good and the service is as well (although they seem to either have an extremely large staff or a revolving door, since i rarely see the same server twice).  
Ham & Swiss Toastie, Chicken Cheeseburger and Fish & Chips are all really good - coworkers swear by the Sheppard's Pie, but I've yet to be in the mood to have it.  The fries are steak cut and great with a side of ranch to dip them in.
author: c o.

description:
I'm a regular here for the Tuesday night trivia contest, which is always a blast.  The top team gets a $30 gift certificate, the second place team gets a $20 certificate, and the third place team goes home with a fancypants bottle of wine.

The food at The Chieftain is surprisingly good considering it's an Irish pub.  The lamb burger and the bangers and mash are my particular favorites.  The crowd is generally pretty laid back, so it's a chill place to hang out.  It's a good neighborhood bar to hit up for that after work drink.

The wait staff is really nice if you're a regular, somewhat distant if you're not.  It took us several weeks of consistent trivia playing to get on their good side.

As far as local watering holes go, The Chieftain is great, and I'll keep going back as long as I keep winning at trivia.
author: Rajiv B.

description: You don't expect much from bar food, but Chieftain rocks.  From the fish and chips, buffalo wings, etc., to the uber juicy lamb burger, you won't go wrong here.  The price is something to like too.
author: Laurence H.

description:
Friends and I headed to the pub after the Yelp holiday party.  The live music was entertaining and the Guinness was delish.  Kudos to the manager for being so responsive.  I misplaced my phone and sent an email the same evening.  When I awoke the next morning, I already had a response.

I haven't tried any of the food and didn't have to deal with the bartenders, but given the ambiance and my experience so far, I think it's a better pub than Murphy's.
author: Annalynn C.

description:
One of my favorite pubs in the city...

Great pub food, good enough selection of beers though not great, knowledgeable and friendly wait staff, always a soccer game on TV, cozy atmosphere, AND it's right across the street from work. How can you beat that?
author: Reza E.

description:
01/17/2008 follow up on my repeat visit for lunch
I went here today for lunch and got the Portobello Melt sandwich and a side salad.

WOW!!! Chieftain is constantly making me smile.

The side salad with their signature mango dressing was light, crispy, and flavorful. The mango dressing and the parmesan cheese sprinkles are the key.

The highlight was my portobello sandwich.
Large grilled portobello mushroom with melted provolone cheese, roasted red peppers, raw spinach, their signature aoli, grilled onions on the lightly toasted ciabatta bread had me smiling throughout my meal. This was a wonderful sandwich. I'm not a vegetarian, but I love mushrooms and let me tell you, this is some fine food right here.
Perfect lunch for a perfect day!
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I'm only commenting on the food and service since I don't drink any alcohol.
Yes people, I'm a teetotaler (I think that's what you call the square non drinkers)

Brad and I went in for his birthday, and they were extremely nice.
Fast service. Also they gave Brad a complimentary Long Island Iced Tea.

When you come here you definitely should have

Their Fish and Chips - Light Brown, Crispy, juicy and fresh cod fried in their beer batter. Once you bite into it, the juice will a) burn your mouth b) the freshness and tenderness of the fish will engulf your senses.
The accompanying steak fries were cooked perfectly; crisp on the outside and tender on the inside. They serve it with a light and wonderful tartar sauce. 

Their buffalo wings are wonderful. Tender on the inside, crispy on the outside and very spicy. Deelish

My favorite lunch time treat is their Shimp and spinach salad with mango dressing. I always have them make me a special order of their chicken salad with mango dressing. The dressing is absolutely suberb. Good flavors and spices.

Ok...I think I'm going to get this for lunch today. :)
The waitresses are always fast and friendly. We went in the late afternoon.
author: Charlene C.

description:
OMG their potato skins are so good. 

I had a long island - nicely potent, but not too much. I got buzzed, I had good food (maybe a little too much), and I had a damn good time. Their little trivia night thing was going on, they played old school mashups - and I can't believe they played Rick Astley's "Together Forever" (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B62p-dEfUZM), circa 1987.  now that's tight.
author: Jennie L.

description:
An enjoyable spot for watching MNF football with some softball buddies. 

First down, great selection of beers/drafts on tap....I went with Stella and Pilsner

Second down, decent food selection.  I did Angus Burger and fries....maybe made the mistake of requesting Well Done as the burger came out a little toasty.

Third down, Nice place for watching the game as it was not too crowded.  We were able to take over two tables to watch the game.

Fourth Down, the larger TV was not the greatest of quality for the game..but it was still watchable.

Almost punted, as maybe one attractive blonde came in during my time there...but that wasn't the reason I was there....more of an good opportunity to hang out and watch the game with friends.

Overall, an good place to watch the game as it was not crowded like Kezar and has an good selection of drafts.
author: Shaun O.

description: Had a really great sando here, though the boyfriend's breakfast wasn't in the same class at all. But we'd probably go back if we hadn't found the service so chilly---not a smile, not a word more than necessary to place an order. We don't require groveling over-friendliness in our restaurant interactions, but a little warmth is not too much to ask, methinks?
author: Helen P.

description:
I watched the italy/germany world cup game here at noon last weekend, and I didn't really have high expectations for the place, mostly based on location (it isn't far, but the block it is on is kind of desolate due to some construction).

However, this place was FANTASTIC.  Generally I find that at events like this the employees get frustrated at the crowds and the tables not turning over, but the service here was amazing.  Seriously, this was possibly the best service I've had in a long time, and certainly far beyond any pub I've ever been to.  Our waiter was awesome, the waitress gave us a free beer for no apparent reason, and the food was better-than-expected pub grub.

I'd happily go back any time. Oh, and they had a decent selection of beers on tap.
author: james s.

description:
This was my neighborhood bar for a couple years.. Years ago, it use to be M&M's, where all the Chronicle journos use to hang out. Rumor has it, that they were there so much that the bar had a wire to the paper's newsroom. But I digress....

In my opinion, Chieftain has lost a step or two over there years.  On my last visit, I ordered my favorite burger in the world, The Chieftain burger....but dammit, it was missing some key ingredients! Eggs, mushrooms and bacon. Hopefully the Chief went back to his old burger, because it really did the place justice. The rest of the menu is pretty legit, not to mention they have daily specials that will make your mouth water. The vibe is still cool, very comfortable Irish pub, with great wood work, and feel good booths (that are ceremoniously named after people, cool). Not to mention, they serve Magner's tall-boy bottles, as all legitimate Irish institutions should. I miss the old neighborhood, I miss The Chieftain.

On a side note, I use to kick it around with The Chieftain soccer team. 2 or 3 successive promotions! You'll see the trophy's on the wall. Unfortunately, the success came to a crashing end, coach Gianni was a bust.
author: M S.

description:
Walked in here on a lovely Wednesday afternoon, was politely greeted and sat down to glance at the menu.

Our server was polite and friendly, answering our silly questions about how spicy the wings were, were they with that orange sauce, etc.  Attentive, nice, friendly and sweet.

We shared the wings, which were indeed tasty.  Not too much orangy sauce, not crazy/wicked hot - but just right.  Good option, no wonder it is a local favorite.

We then shared a chicken sandwich which was lackluster.  The chicken was dry, the bacon too cooked, though the fries were tasty and I ate every last one!

I love the atmosphere, quaint but big enough for a good crowd.  Not overly crowded walls filled with crap, but tasteful.  It just had a really good vibe, well, and a good tap selection.
author: Sabrina A.

description: The Chargers lost, but that's okay.. 'cause the Corned Beef n Cabbage was off the chain!  Not too salty or over-cooked, just perfect.. This joint's ambiance makes me feel Brave-hartish, like I'm in Ireland.. No wait, wrong country..  u get the drift though.. Nevertheless, it's a kool place to watch the game and enjoy some good food..
author: Tom D.

description:
The list of beers on tap
Guiness
Smithwicks Ale
Carlsbad
Fat Tire
Czechvar
Sam Adams Boston Lager
Bass Ale
Pilsner Urquell
Stella
Sierra
Murphy's stout
Bud 
Bud Lite.

Beers in Bottles include
Corona, New Castle, Anchor, Magners, Coors Light, Becks, Heineken.

Plus a full bar and a kitchen that closes 930-10pm.
The music is surprisingly FREE. There is no "internet jukebox" which i would still want to pay money for. The bartender wasnt too busy, so the service was great.

Between here and the Tempest Bar you can definitely have some quality cold beers.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
Eh! I could take it or leave it really!

Nothing ever seems to be consistant there, sometimes the food is great sometimes not so much!

Sometimes the waitstaff/bartenders are on top of it sometimes not!

It seems the only thing consistant in there is the rudeness of the manager Pete!

I see he has gotten great reviews by others here, but I don't get it, well unless you're a girl because that's the only people I see him being nice to!
author: Jason K.

description: Stopped in here for a drink while staying in a local hotel.  Was worth the check out.  The bartender was great, he was really friendly and talkative the way you expect a good bartender to be.  He reminded me of a west coast version of Donnie Wahlberg so that was pretty cool.  He ultimately told me he was from New England or up state NY or something so it kind of made sense.  He gave a great recommendation on a dessert.  Will definitely stop back next time around because it looked like some great stuff on the menu for dinner.
author: Scott M.

description:
Food poisoning warning!

I generally like this pub and will certainly go back for the beer. However, last Thursday I had the turkey and avocado sandwich at lunchtime and felt quite ill later that night. I didn't identify The Chieftain as the culprit at first but a friend who also ate there separately on Thursday stayed home throwing up Friday. I wonder if they didn't wash the spinach in that sandwich or their staff don't wash their hands? Perhaps you have to stick to the deep fried food to be safe here.
author: Mary L.

description:
I don't know why I didn't write a review of the Chieftain sometime ago.  I used to work there, I know one of the owners and two of his siblings (they are triplets-two male and one female).   

I have been to the pub for birthdays, lunch, dinner, going away parties, welcome homes and just because.  The place does a pretty good business and lunch certainly manages to bring them in.  My hats are off to Eric, who runs the kitchen and creates the menus.  He always manages to put together a different special and really has managed to turn the food around full circle.  Sure you will find your traditional fish and chips and cottage pie but when you think of Irish food you don't think gourmet.  

Today I had the special:  thinly sliced pork tenderloin on an amazing roll with caramelized onion, roasted red peppers, and some amazing goat cheese.  Sure it sounds simple but it was simply delicious, and besides I just don't think of this type of food for Irish fare.  

Take a trip to the Chieftain or call them and book a party, they always work with you on your budget and will certainly make you a happy customer.

Cheers!
author: Scott P.

description:
Delicious Irish food with a laid back atmosphere. I ordered the sausage with a side of mashed potatoes and beans, and it was delicious. If you're looking for a no-frills place to get some comfort food, I would highly recommend the Chieftain. 

If you're looking to have a drink with your meal, I wouldn't go for wine, since they have a limited selection. Stay with the beer and hard alcohol drinks.
author: Michelle G.

description:
The food was OK bar food, but I had the worst service in a bar I've ever experienced in the Bay Area so far.  I know it was fairly busy (but not terrible) so I didnt give them just one star, but when I had to track down the waitress after waiting 30 minutes for her to return with my credit card when it was no longer busy, I decided I won't bother going back.

There's the charming slow pace of an Irish pub, then there's just bad service.  This was bad service.  

Plus, I saw an employee seem to hassle someone who appeared to be a disabled person with a service dog.  Didn't help my impression.

Honestly, as much as I like Irish pubs generally, too many of them lack distinction.  This was one of them.
author: Surf R.

description:
I've walked past this place a jillion times without thinking to stop in.
Finally I did, and I was pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere (daytime anyway) was mellow, and the service was good- the fish and chips I ordered came lightly battered, & not greasy & the chips themselves were well-apportioned. I was served a beer "on special" which I misread on their blackboard (1.50 OFF the price, not 1.50 for the beer!) but all the same (Smithwick's) was not a bad ale. More to my taste than Guinness, which I have come of late to rather dislike. The Liverpool F.C. banner hanging in the back was also a sign I'd feel welcome here- more a generic Celtic feel here than particularly Irish. 
But then,  I was here in the daytime. Anyway, a bill well-spent, and I plan to go back more often now.
author: Mark L.

description: 5 stars for their fish and chips and I'm a fan because I work nearby but other than that, a bit overpriced for your average bar food.
author: German L.

description:
Yaaaargh, pass me a warm Guiness Pint!

Despite the dirt and the dinge, the Chieftian has a great set of beers and the old-world pub vibe to match.  Lunch is a decent enough affair, but it's hard to compete on food in SOMA.  Overall, it's a good midday lunch spot on workdays, or a  decent watering spot with the boys - but not too much beyond that.

Not bad - but kinda soccer-hooligan-ish.
author: Paul L.

description:
The Chieftan is a nice place, as far as the building, but its' current management really sucks ass.

I took three of my friends here last night for a round of beers after a false alarm for a protest of DEA action at a nearby medical cannabis dispensary.  I gave the bartender my credit card for about $21 and explicitly asked not to have a tab opened.

Bartender refuses to return my card or even make eye contact with me while serving other customers for at least 15 minutes.  After I finally sit and drink about 1/5 of my beer, I take a break outside to medicate / smoke, and return to find that my card has been declined.

I pull up my account on iPhone and see that the bar has charged significantly more than my balance - enough to keep a tab open - and made me unable to purchase lunch the next day - today - which is why I have time and inclination to write this.

I may have raised my voice, but I certainly can be louder, and got a bit upset at the bartender for screwing my account and then demanding that we pay cash for his dunderheaded mistake.  The bar own flew at me with physical threats, refusing to look at the account statement I was showing him, refusing to show my friends while I was smoking the actual credit card bill which was declined, only giving them a list of drinks poured, which we didn't stay to drink, though we paid, because WE are reputable citizens.

The bar manager had the nerve to tell me to "come back when I was sober", though in fact, I was sober, having only had 1/5 of my Sierra Nevada, and we all felt that we smelled liquor on his breath - tequila, perhaps?  I'm from Texas and I can pick up hints of it.

I called SFPD and asked them to come down and breathalyzer the manager, who was physically threatening me, but they told me that I'd have to wait around and endure threats to make a report.

I complained to Chris Daly on Facebook about this, and the SFPD reaction, and will be going after The Chieftain's liquor license.

If you enjoy this place, I'm sorry, start looking into taking over for the old management soon, or find a new place to drink - SF has no room for establishments run like this.
author: Justin R.

description: I've been here a few times and never had a problem. But I came in almost two weeks ago and I didn't leave the bartender a tip because he was unbelievably slow. He came over to our table to complain about it, eventually getting in my face. One of my friends even heard him accuse me of being "racist." All over a dollar. I called the manager to complain. He said he would speak to the bartender and get back to me. It's been almost a week and I haven't heard back. Hence this review.
author: Steve N.

description: Good food, friendly staff, interesting patrons, and they have cider. What else do you need?
author: Bob T.

description: Met up with some friends afterwork for a St. Patty's day Smithwicks. The bar was crowded but not overly packed and the crowd was really fun.
author: Christy Z.

description: Extremely convenient if you're staying at the Intercontinental.  The fried jalapeño mashies appetizer are interesting, but I was disappointed that the sauce was spicier than the bite.  Bangers & mash are yum, fish & chips - no complaints.  Good service.
author: Jennie Z.

description:
A surprisingly nice pub in a questionable part of town... pretty isolated.

Great fish and chips, and a fun Trivia Tuesday night!  Good questions in a nice atmosphere.
author: shaun l.

description:
It's tempting to call the Chieftain the best Irish pub in San Francisco, it's pretty close to attaining perfection in my opinion.

The beers on tap are all great and are poured perfectly by Irish bartenders and  there's always soccer (er...football) on the 3 small televisions scattered around.  Come in during a big game and you'll hear a lot of cursing and yelling at the televisions, usually at around 11 in the morning!

The best part of the Chieftain is the food.  It's surprisingly good for such a small place.  The burgers are great, the pizza is really good and the fish and chips is crispy and delicious!  Go a few times and try to attain 'Neighbor' status and get 15% off your meal!
author: Craig E.

description:
Ah, the Chieftain.  One of my coworkers always suggests this place anytime someone mentions everyone going somewhere afterwork, whether it's for a drink or someone's birthday.  "Hey, how about the Chieftain??"  

This place is nice.  This is coming from a chick who doesn't really drink very much, much less enjoys hanging out at bars.  It does get busy after work and into the evening.  I've been here a few times just to hang out and also for trivia night.  On trivia nights, it gets a bit crowded, so just be aware.  The servers are nice.  If anything, the food here is great.  I've never eaten anything that didn't taste good.  Anything fried is yummy.  I mean come on, food that's fried makes anything better.  Mmmmm.  Some of my coworkers have actually ordered lunch from here to go so it's that good.

Trivia night is fun.  Granted, it does get noisy as the night wears on because everyone starts getting drunk and it's hard to hear the trivia guy read the questions.

Bathroom is clean and surprisingly kinda nice and not gross like your typical bar toilet.  

A definite place to check out if you work in the SOMA and feel like grabbing some drinks and food with some friends or coworkers.
author: imelda j.

description:
This is the local watering hole for good reason.  Actually three good reasons.  Good food, good hospitable service, and good ambiance.  Two co-workers and I went in today.  The server was friendly and the manager popped by the table to say hello.  Exceptions to the menu were made without a fuss and for being neighbors we were given a neighborhood discount without having to ask.  The food was served quick and was delicious and it was a worry free lunch.

This is typical for Chieftain.  I've been privilaged to get to know one of the managers and the owner in working with them and they are great guys.  Hospitality and good food are key words and I've never had a bad visit and usually have someone to say hello to!

What's more, they played the world cup on three screens and didn't tell when we sneaked away from work to watch;)  It was a fantastic time being there rooting for favorites as the crowd was lively and fun.
author: Cat A.

description: Decent pub, good food, staff that remember you and your regular drinks. Lots of European football on TV. The only possible gripe I could have is that during big conferences it's always packed with nerds in stupid polos proudly displaying they're name badges. Take your mugger ID cards off nerds.
author: Lager K.

description:
The only weekend you should never go to The Chieftain?  Saint Patrick's Day.  Wow.  What a mass of humanity, half of whom who would not know Irish Culture from Irish Spring that seethe through that place.

But the Monday after Saint Patrick's Day, all was well at The Chieftan.  The wood tables.  The wonderful staff.  The endless supply of David Bowie Music.  The cool vibe.

My crew was there on Monday Night of this writing both for dinner and then drinks after our Improv Make Em Ups down the street at 975 Howard.   

You can't get any better than chilling with awesome people in that place and eating some incredible fish and chips.

And giving I Think I Love My Wife Thongs to the Bar Staff.

We are officially regulars.  Come see the Make Em Us at 975 Howard.  Come with us afterwards here.

Drink with Improvisers.
author: Shaun L.

description:
I absolutely love The Chieftain! What a great place to hang out with friends on the way to or from plans downtown. There's always room to cop a squat, whether the streets are packed tourists outside or not...whether it's rainy or sunny...whether you're a large party or a couple people only. There are traditional irish jam sessions on Sundays from a large group of talented musicians, trivia nights on Tuesdays, and always showing the games you wanna be watching. Also, their food is as good as the service - meaning slightly pricey for an Irish Bar, but so worth the extra few cents. 

Go have a drink. You probably deserve it.
author: E.Mo. ..

description: 5 stars for the best Shepherd's Pie I've ever had. I only order one thing when I come here and that's it. An ice cold beer and heaven in a dish.
author: Matthew H.

description: In Mississippi we have a few "Sports Bars", but no real pub style place that is cool. The Chieftain Irish Pub & Restaurant is definitely a cool kick back kind of place to have lunch, catch a game, or hang out with friends and have a few beers. They have the best burgers and fries. Yep, if/when I come back to San Fran, I am stopping by here again.
author: Karsten H.

description: This is a pretty solid Downtown Irish Pub. I have been here a few times with a large group in the afternoon and they were very accommodating and have always had tables saved for groups. The servers are very nice and are willing to split checks. The happy hour is mediocre at best. It is only $1 off well drinks, nothing else. They do have some good pub chips though.
author: Peter V.

description: Went on a Thursday night and the bartender was extremely friendly. Vodka tonic made well. I will try their food if I ever go back.
author: Samantha C.

description: I would go to this place again b/c it was easy to find a seat and wasn't too loud and in a good location. However, nothing about it was spectacular. I think others will agree with my summation.
author: Andrew K.

description: Excellent service by a friendly Irish waitress who was very gracious to give travel advice.  The food was also delicious. Do not expect bar food.  It is more like gourmet comfort food. My husband ordered a burger and I had chicken with mushroom gravy.  The chicken was large enough to split. Great value!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
We went here because it's nice and accessible as far as location goes. She and I had dinner before two others arrived, so we got to experience some of the dinner atmosphere and some of the later night stuff.

The food was surprisingly good. It's definitely beyond bar food and firmly in good pub food territory. I had a burger with cheese and bacon (artery-clogging goodness) and they even gave me enough ketchup to finish it with (2 squatty bottles). Her bangers & mash were also very good.

For pours I had the Paulaner Hefeweisen first, which, while decent, doesn't compare to a Pyramid Hefeweisen at the Pyramid Alehouse. Then I had Paulaner's Oktoberfest which was actually pretty good -- better than Sam Adams Oktoberfest anyway.

They had sports on multiple TVs the whole time, but we didn't pay attention much. One of the large TVs (or its projector) has a large splotch in the middle of it that annoyed us even though we weren't consciously watching it. They also had a music playlist in the background, some of which was good.

Overall the experience was good, the atmosphere cozy and the waitresses helpful. The only critique I could level in good conscience would involve a request for it to be about 5 times larger with 5 pool tables. Oh well. We'll probably find ourselves here again when we're in the area.
author: Brad F.

description:
Hm... what to say about The Chieftain. As my local Irish pub, even though it is a 15 minute walk away, there's something I like about it. Maybe it is the real Irish staff, or the fresh Murphy's stout, or the generous pours of whisky, or the Magners cider in large and small bottles, or the fact that they rewards locals with a little discount. 

I don't know why I really like the place, because the crowd here runs from constuction workers to neighborhood regulars to the occasional street person asking to use the bathroom. It's not my scene, yet somehow it's my style.

Anyway, it's comfortable, the beer is fresh and the glasses are clean - and there's nothing wrong with the place. Hell, they even have Setana Sports on the TV, another plus. With all of the plusses, you would think it is a lock for five stars, but it was hard to give it the fourth. 

If you're in SOMA and craving a whisky and a pint, you could do much much worse than The Chieftain.
author: Avery G.

description:
While I have drank at the Chieftan a few times (what up Renell) I've only recently eaten here with the specific intention of trying their burger. I am glad I did. Spot on. This was like the Platonic Form of a Pub Burger, save for the Kaiser Roll, whose toasted crunch might be an improvement. I even ordered the bacon on the side just to try it in its pure state before I slapped on the salty bacon awesomeness. I eat a lot of burgers, in fact I am on a personal crusade to try every burger in SF. The Chieftan does it right.

The whiskey and scotch selection is a plus. Just be wary that the place fills up fast when the downtown set gets off work in the early evening.
author: Zac H.

description: Great lamb burger and the Guinness is the proper temp! Will be returning soon, very soon!
author: Matthew M.

description:
I had only been to this place for beers. It's a typical Irish Pub, and one of the few places to get Murphy's Irish Stout these days. But last night I went there and experienced something that made Chieftain truly Yelp-worthy - Trivia Night. Every Tuesday they have trivia night, and some of my friends are avid participants. In fact, they almost always win. Last night was my first trivia night. 

The place was great. There were about 5 or 6 teams that were playing - people grouped around tables, discussing answers, drinking beer, eating pub-food. If only we could have taken the SAT in this manner. When it came to answer time, each group that got the answer right started cheering. It was nerdy, yes, but fun nonetheless.

I did get my typical Murphy's Irish Stout (yummy) and had some Bangers and Mash - two sausages with mashed potatoes and backed beans. Delicious. Really good food...considering it is pub food. 

Overall, a great experience. I'm not one for trivia, so I don't think I'll be a frequent member, but the whole vibe is so chill and cool that I'm sure I'll go back again with my trivia-addict friends.
author: Samir P.

description:
This place was surprisingly small, another spot I hit up on my pub run of St. Patties 07.

I liked the prices and the service, it was really quick, I know this because I don't remember the next place we went to after here.

They dish out strong drinks at a rapid rate and have fun little cocktail suggestions.
author: Lauren G.

description:
I always wonder about this place when I was living in south of market. Never went in. Couple of days ago, while wondering around in Valencia looking for a bar in the middle of the day (what's with all the bars not opening until 5PM? I thought this is a drinking man's town), eventually ended up down town and went into the Chieftain for snack and beer. It turns out to be a nice little place. Good bar food and beer. They have Smithwick! Definitely will return next time I am in the neighborhood. 

Three star for now
author: Mr P.

description:
Tuesday Night Trivia! Strikingly good food for a bar too.

I recently had a craving for something "Tuesday." Thanks to Yelp, I found a bunch of things to do in the city on a Tuesday night. Chieftain was one of them and it also happens to be a bar I frequent due to its proximity to my house.

The thing is, it isn't really my crowd though. I don't know how to describe the crowd really. Maybe the conference and after-work crowd. It's usually not very crowded late at night either. Not sure why they stop serving food at 10pm. I think if they kept the kitchen open, they would get more business.

Anyhow, the girls that work here are AWESOME!! Each of them is so freakin' nice. Any one of them bringing me a big pint of beer brings a smile to my face. The food is also strikingly good, for bar food. Hell, it's pretty good compares to a lot of restaurants too. I personally like the Cottage Pie (Shepard's Pie) and the burgers. The salads are ehh.

Tuesday Trivia night was entertaining but people have told me there are better ones in the city. When we went, we were totally decimated by one team of 9 people! 9 people!!? Of course you know all the answers with that many brains!
author: Cindy P.

description:
Grabbed a couple of Harp and enjoyed the Portabello stuffed with crab, as well as the fish and chips.  I made the call to have garlic added to the chips and that was a great idea.  Fresh garlic loaded all over them!  Delicious!

Tuesday appears to be Trivia night as well.
author: Matt C.

description: I grabbed a bite to eat at The Chieftain as it was close to the Seventh Son Tattoo shop where I was getting some work done. All that really needs to be said is that the lamb burger = awesome... I never got a chance to try anything else while I was in town, but you can't go wrong with the lamb burger... just get one and thank me later.
author: Sonny W.

description:
If you are in the Metreon area and want a quick drink or bite to eat look no further than The Chieftan. We happened upon this place a few months back while in the area, looking for a drink and somewhere to waste some time.

Our first visit was strictly for drinks, but we were disappointed. Hubby and friends got beers, from bottled to draft and they enjoyed them all. 

I had a mixed drink (which was a bit overpriced) but when you see how quite it is, you kinda understand. (Also since mixed drinks aren't the thing to get at a pub, you have to expect that as well). But we also found out that on the weekends they have mimosas for $4! That's awesome!! 

We recently went here for some dinner and a drink on New Year's Eve  and all enjoyed various sandwiches and burgers, not the most elegant things to eat but total pub food. 

Definitely a pretty chill and comfortable environment and I would recommend it to anyone who lives pubs and beer!
author: Erin B.

description:
Good food, within walking distance to my apartment (4th and Harrison), Guinness and nice people that will serve you even if their kitchen is about to close in 15 minutes.  What's not to love?

I was so happy to find my local neighborhood pub the other night.  Now that I've found the art supply store, radio shack and my pub, all that's remaining to make this neighborhood a home is the discount textile store.

I can't wait to revisit The Chief.
author: Corey F.

description:
stopped by here after fleet week and it was a chill spot...

food is pretty good and it was the first time i had shepherds pie.. the Guinness stew was ok and over all i liked the friendly atmosphere.  its a good little stop if your in the area
author: Nic M.

description: I wanted to update this, as I felt Mark handled my complaint in a professional and timely manner.  I've always enjoyed the food and drink at the Chieftain, even when the service was slow (generally bc they were so busy.  I am changing my ranking. Probably the next time I go to Chieftain, it will rise to 4 stars.
author: Valerie F.

description:
*tap tap tap* This is a friendly PSA to let the management know that REALLY BAD TOP 40 POP MUSIC does NOT belong in my Chieftain on St. Patrick's Day!  BOOOO HISSSSSSS for that really really bad choice.  And I hear that you might be considering that DJ on a regular basis???  Oh no.  Please no.  My whole group of friends ran like our hair was on fire after the 5th Black Eyed Peas song was played.  THE FIFTH.  It was horrible.  Sooooo not OK.  I mean, the last thing you'd expect at an Irish pub on St. Patrick's day is for the WONDERFUL LIVE Irish band to get the boot so a lame DJ could play his Black Eyed Peas CD.

I love Jen, I love Darnell, I love Camille, I love your food, and I really love your Stella, so PLEASE do do that to me again.  Please! Wrong place, wrong crowd, wrong district.

I hate removing my 5 stars.  :(
author: Jennifer B.

description:
My brother and all his Electrician buddies frequent this bar and he told me to go and check it out, since he knows that I like to drink a whole lot. I mean a whole lot. Shit, if you can only see me gut right now. I need to work out or begin an AA class, probably won't do either one, but it's nice to dream. But I have been to the Chieftain.

This bar is cool. It has been fixed up really nice since the very first time I went in back in 1999 or some year like 1999. A great variety of beers on tap, including my favorite "10 pint night"  Amstel Light. 
I didn't have 10 last night but I still enjoyed myself and my company at the bar. Real laid back place with nice restrooms and clean tables. Gotta love a clean Irish bar. 

Go have a pint and watch some rugby and try to figure out what the fuck is going on in that game. 
Cheers.
author: Eric B.

description:
They have good fries, fish & chips, burgers.  The staple pub food.  Stay away from the cream soups, or soup in general.  The Irish are not know for delicate cream soups if you get my drift.  If you are having lunch there, plan on it being an hour easy.  If you call for delivery, they will not make it till you get there, which is irritating.

Bar guys and attentive, but servers are a bit slow.
author: Nicole F.

description:
Looking for a place downtown for a quick bite with and old friend, and this came up interesting on Yelp, so we took the plunge.

We were in the mood for chatting and they were holding a bingo night or something so it wasn't the optimal setting for our reunion. However, they were serving $4 pints of beer, so it was an even exchange in my book.

The food was delicious, if just a wee bit skimpy for the price. But overall the place had charm, the eats were satisfying, and the staff was mighty friendly!
author: K. C.

description: The Chieftain Irish Pub is a great place to hang out.  The atmosphere is always live and direct especially after work hours.  The drinks menu is stacked with beers on tap and if you prefer beers bottled, they have that too.  I was also shocked to find out that they also sold cans of beer.  The food at The Chieftain is pretty damn good also.  Gotta recommend the lamb burger with the gooey blue cheese and the sauteed red onions and mushrooms.(insert Homer Simpson drool here)  And how could you go wrong with the fish and chips, it's comfort food at its finest for for christ's sake.  You have to have the spicy potato bites too! Let me stress it again comfort food at its finest.  Just swung by the other day and they've got a chalkboard that lists they're weekly specials.  And I've had the oxtail. That oxtail is like melted butter!  This is THE place to be at when you're local sports team are doing good too.  Was here when the NINERS went thru they're playoff run and can I say that I sure felt like I was at the game!  They also show rugby, soccer, and practically any sport you'd like to watch.  All you gotta do is just ask.  Seriously people, This is the place to be at when you wanna hang out and have a pint with friends, co-workers, and whoever.  Chieftain Irish Pub, you guys get a thumbs up from me.  Keep up the good hard work!  OOh, and did I mention the brunch menu?  Sorry, you're just gonna have to check it out yourself.
author: Papa S.

description: I had a fab time in this pub, completely at random. Had a couple hours to kill before meeting a friend, and this was the closest drinking establishment to our hotel. We bellied up to the bar and ordered pints. By the time we got out of there we'd been given one (1) free pint of Guinness and 2 free tasters of Lagunitas Hairy Eyeball. I love this bar and I love the staff.  A++, would drink there again.
author: melina l.

description:
I've been going here pretty regularly for years. I go almost every Thursday night with my man and his hockey team (also called the Chieftains). I also have been here for brunch, and to see the World Series, etc, etc, so yeah, I'm a regular.....The staff is awesome, they will take good care of you. Camille is amazing and always on the ball. Vernell is always a welcoming friendly face behind the bar. Fiona is my favorite server, even when I come in at 5 til 10, she always deals with my indecision and gets my food order in! I love that woman! The food here is really good by the way. The housemade soups are amazing--especially my favorite, ginger carrot. It comes with deeeelicious bread!  They have excellent fish and chips, Guinness beef stew, even great salads.
The only bad thing about this pub is that it sometimes gets too crowded and it's a little harder to get drinks. But that's what happens when your neighborhood pub is also a tourist spot for out-of-towners. That said it does make for interesting conversations with people from all over the globe.  I like the diversity in clientele. 
Just go check it out! I'll see you there...cheers!
author: Adrienne A.

description: Game 2 World Series Rangers @ Giants.  TVs TVs and more TVs...and a projector! Oh my!!!  Friendly, attentive service.  Got a beer in t minus 5 minutes of sitting.  Ate some wings, potato crab cake, garlic fries - all very tasty.  Bathroom was clean (I used the little boy's room as the ladies room per usual had a long line).  They didn't split the check but let us split it at the table. We got billed for gratuity with six people in our party (at some places it is 8 but whatevs because it was like normal 20%).  Cheers!
author: Amireh G.

description: The lamb burger, medium rare, was one of the best burgers I've ever had. The Prohibition brew on tap was a very hoppy beer with a great finish. The service was attentive and quick. It's a working bar though and you had to scrounge for table space, but it was Friday night so what did you expect. You will see the whole spectrum of San Francisco in here if you spend the night here.
author: Bob J.

description:
Lord, years ago it was Dangerous to walk by here, but no more, yuppies Everywhere... huh?...  a pub, and open for FOOD on New Years Day... koooooooooooooooool.  And I like the traditional style of dark wood all around.  

Very thirsty we discovered she Knew How To Draw a Guinness!  Creamy and Smoooooooth!  Service was attentive and good natured, and if it counts she was lovely too.  ;-)  

A diagonal block from the Metreon and mall and parking, a key location for those of us preferring pub food to Mels and such.  I plan to go back and try more of the food and make this a hang out for those movie and mall days.  More reviews after that.  :-)
author: Joe J.

description:
Car bombs? Fuckin' bathe in that shit. Car bombs, car bombs, car bombs, car bombs...plick chug chug chug chug...cawr bawms.

Tight pour on the Guinness, too. Real tight head, Murphy's stout was excellent, too. Smooth like Eliot Spitzer.
author: Josh B.

description:
There are a million reasons why I can justify my 4 star rating for the Chieftan but most of those have already been covered by my fellow yelpers.  Aside from wonderful service, great whiskey/beer selection and some of the best Irish pub food in the city there is one this that makes them the shinning star in my eyes.....Friday's Seafood Chowder.  I cannot decribe the decadent tastyness that is contained in this soup.  Several types of marine life (no longer alive) floating amongst cream and bacon and spices to make this my favorite soup in the city. Whats even more amazing is the price! I ordered two to go bowls last Friday and it was less than ordering two bowls from SF Soup Co!!! 

My only complaint is that I wish this place was bigger! During the daytime its fine, but at night if you want to get dinner it can be tricky if you have more than 4 people.  I wish they had a dinning area separate from the bar so more people could enjoy the awesomeness that is the Chieftan.

PS- try their Irish Coffee....its some of the best in the city and goes perfect after polishing off a bowl of seafood chowder!
author: Seana L.

description:
This place is far away from most of the haunts in SOMA, yet it kinda stands out on the corner of 5th and Howard so its easy to find.

Its a good place to gather with friends in a laid-back atmosphere but it can get very crowded in this small establishment when the 9-5 work week is over. 

The bar has a large variety of beer on tap but its a bit pricey.  All my party bought were a few drafts but it totaled over $90.  The beer is fine, but I think I can get the same tasting beer at another place for much cheaper.
author: Chan L.

description:
This place is one of my oldies but goodies!  I first discovered The Chieftain when I worked nearby a few years ago.  My coworkers liked heading here for happy hour and I liked joining them so I could eat the tasty burgers that would come with a fried egg on top. =P  I first discovered fried eggs on burgers at Red Robin and have loved them ever since so I'm a happy camper whenever I discover another place that serves up this tastiness.

Each time I come back here I discover something new.  One time I learned it was a great place to catch sporting events as there are multiple screens around the room and I watched Vince Young single-handedly spank USC.  Another night they had bar trivia and while I had a blast, I also found out that the guys on my volleyball team are useless when it comes to knowing anything aside from fixing cars and chasing girls!  And last week when I dropped in, they had a live Irish band playing some Celtic country favorites while regular old-timers sang along.

The staff is super helpful and awesome...I've never had bad service here.  I've tried a variety of items on the menu and have liked everything so far.  The food is well-prepared and the portions are generous.  Nobody minds if you loiter at your table and all the patrons are friendly.  The location is very convenient, parking isn't bad, and even the bathrooms are clean!  If I were to have a neighborhood bar like Cheers, I'd have to say that The Chieftain is where I hope they know my name. =)
author: Helen T.

description: Dillon, the bartender, was very friendly and attentive.  Decent beer and whiskey selection.  Cozy, dark, and comfortable.  However, the menu is standard bar fare.  You could take the menu and substitute it for one from any chain restaurant and there would be little difference in the selections. In other words, there is only a few vaguely Irish dishes.  The rest of the menu is dominated by chicken wings, 'tater skins, etc.  I had the Guinness beef stew, a favorite menu item in just about every American Irish bar from Boston to SF.  It was one visit for me, but there was little reason for me to return.
author: Timothy D.

description: Finding a decent bar downtown for happy hour can be, for some reason, a bit of a challenge.  This place is the typical irish bar.  Drinks weren't very strong, best to stick to beer.  Service was okay, we had a big party so they may have been flustered, but they were accommodating.  They didn't seem to mind splitting the bill between multiple cards.  Food wise, we got four different kinds of fries, which worked as fine bar food.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description:
FUN!!! We had a great time!  We went for a Liberty on the Rocks function on a Friday night and we ended up staying and enjoying dinner and great conversation. 

Caesar salad review number two...My wife had the Caesar salad, of course, she'll try them anywhere and she enjoyed it.  Not too fishy thank goodness because that freaks her out.  I had the dungeness crab stuffed portabella and it was really good!!! I was amazed actually and knew that I would order it again. It had great flavor and the ingredients tasted fresh and I was very happy with my choice. 

We will definitely add this to our list of pubs to be repeated.  The staff was friendly and finding parking was easy, even for a Friday night.
author: Jennifer J.

description: I had just successfully pawned my prize vintage silvertab Levi jeans and was feeling pretty good about myself. I thought the only way this day could get any better is with some fish and chips. I didn't want to eat any. Just see an smell them. Successful mission.
author: Terry H.

description:
Some of the best pub grub all around- flavorful, hearty, and just the right amount of grease.  You can't go wrong with their fish and chips or shepherd's pie, especially when washed down with a Guinness.  Service is friendly and down to earth.  So is their decor.  I only go there to eat so I can't really comment on the entertainment.  

The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is that looking for parking around there is unnecessarily stressful.  We would definitely eat there more if this wasn't the case.
author: Miss K.

description:
This went from a quiet, chill, neighborhood pub to being discovered by Thads and Debbies.  WHERE ARE YOU DICKS COMING FROM?  GO AWAY.

The food's rumored to be good but my boyfriend didn't like it.  I'll try it one of these days.
author: Frankie D.

description:
I've come here a couple times now for drinks. The bartenders are friendly, real people, and fast. The beers are LARGE. $5.50 for a .5 liter beer...not bad. The fries are pretty good too, especially when you've had a couple already.

And since it is on the same block as my work, I can just leave my crap in the office after work and pick it up on my way out.
author: Stu M.

description:
Um, how can you not love this place... a bunch of beer at $3 per pint, delish food at $10-$15 per plate (and you'll be stuffed!) and probably the most friendly bartenders/owners of any irish pub in the city.  
Will soon be one of my weekly or bi-weekly haunts.

If you're into trivia nights, I'll see you there on Tuesdays -- a huge plus: they give out a lot of free pints during the night!
author: Simmi M.

description:
Not that I'm one to pass up a bar, an Irish bar for that matter. But I was meeting non-drinking friends in the area and had no time to stop in. 
We went to Rocco's down the street and were about to head back to their house when we heard trumpets.....

My friend said "Hey, they are playing Ring of Fire!" and , knowing that i have a rule to go in any joint if I here Johnny Cash playing.  We were served promptly a creamy Guinness and two club sodas or whatever white soda they were drinking and sat and B.S.'d about life and admired the decent selection of single speeds parked outside. 

OK... BEER... JOHNNY CASH...SINGLE SPEEDS!!!!


The only reason i give it for stars is that it is not across the street from MY house!!!
author: Inga R.

description:
Never a bad time!

I don't know what a true Irish brunch should consist of, but the one time my roommate and her the current BF visited the Chieftain the food was terrific.  Service was impeccable, and the rugby game being televised on one of three flat screens made the experience that much better.

A couple weeks ago the BF and I met my Dad here.  Of course going to an Irish pub and ordering and order Bud Light.  The BF and my Dad had Guinness and I had a Harp...okay maybe we had three rounds.  LOL!

The decor is mostly comprised of dark wood and Irish family crests.  Lighting tends to be a bit dim, however your eyes will adjust.  Oh yeah!  they have a new front door!  WOO HOO!
author: Shane P.

description:
The chieftain is a tough review for a few reasons. The service was painful, 30 min after we sat we got our first drinks,,, after we ate our appetizers.. There were 2 people working the from of the house, 1 bar tender and 1 waitress serving all the beer and food while busing all the dishes.. the place was busy and the staff was in the weeds.   We ordered the fries with cheese and curry, they forgot the curry and were rather tasteless. I got the Irish coddle and my friend got the Irish stew, both were very good.. 

I'll give it 3 stars fgor the food and the fact that the service could not be that bad all the time. perhaps someone called in sick and left them hanging.
author: Brian K.

description: Great place to watch an important game. Watched the World Cup final here, with barely enough room to squeeze to the restroom. Drinks are stiff and decently priced, food is pretty good for a pub, and the bartenders are really cool. Lots of screens, and plenty of tables and chairs on a normal day. I really enjoyed the Chieftain and would go back to try more of their menu.
author: Amanda D.

description: Some food is mediocre but the bangers and mash are amazing.
author: j s.

description: They have a hearty menu and of course a wide selection of whiskey. It's never too crowded or too loud and sometimes the flat screens are playing weird movies if not on a sports channel.
author: Kim L.

description: Excellent watering hole.  I hear the food is good too, so plan on stopping by to try!
author: laura g.

description:
Looks nice and authentic when you walk in, but spend a couple of minutes here and you'll realize that this is just another tourist/conventioneer trap that might as well be inside the Metreon.

If rubbing elbows with customer reps from Lincoln, Nebraska while squinting your eyes and trying to pretend like you're in Dublin sounds like fun to you, be my guest.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Great pub, excellent service and lots of beer and irish whisky. Great place for watching Int'l sport (rugby/soccer). Setanta is all they watch there :)

Tuesday night is quiz night. It's tons of fun and very challenging.
author: Isaac N.

description:
What pub is dedicated enough to serve beleaguered rugby fans live euro tournament games at 7 A.M. on a Saturday morning? This one, and thank jehovah because its the only place in town that you're gonna see it. They've got through all 6 Nations games and now I'm waiting to see if they'll do the EDF Energy Cup. Beer is great, always a perfect pint and they have Guinness and Murphy's so the Irish from Cork can be snippy about the stout. I had good fun. Pete is great, and all the other bartenders were wonderful, the servers are reliable and always ask after me when I have committed an empty vessel foul.

Irish breakfast is good, lots of variety, and I hear the other food is good too, although I liked the pudding so much I stuck to the Irish the whole tournament.

All said, has anyone seen a place showing the games closer to Bernal Heights?
author: Ryon B.

description: Cool downtown bar. Great draft beer selection & Good place to watch a game or hang out with friends. Great menu(fish&chips and Chiefton buger are the BOMB) good service too.
author: Edgar G.

description: Great atmosphere and good selection of beer. I had the curry fries, but no other food. The curry sauce could have been spicier. I'd come back to this spot.
author: John B.

description: It seemed a little suspect outside--people were getting a bit scared by the man outside talking to himself and dancing, but hey, then again, I'm used to that.  The Chieftain has the best bar food that I have tasted thus far.  Plus, very good beers, the Tricerahops is a must have for IPA lovers.  It is a nice, laid back environment.  Great food. Good times.  We started out with the spicy potato balls, which I think I cleaned out 3.5/5 of them.  It was our lucky day, chicken and mushroom pot pie special!  We swooped on the second to the last one.  Word to the wise: If you want the special, go early!!  They sell out fast!!  We also ordered the Lamb burger with bleu cheese which was a party in your mouth!  LOL  The burger (cooked medium) was nice and juicy, and it was smothered with red onions (which I picked off just b/c I don't like eating them, but I like the flavor of them on it).  Big screens with the Giants game on, and a friendly waitress made the chill spot 10 x better!  So bottom line: Don't let the surrounding neighborhood discourage you from stepping into the Pub.  You won't regret it!
author: Steph W.

description: We came here for a co-worker's birthday lunch and the service was close to non existent. No sign of acknowledgement for a while. Then we sat in a dark corner next to the bar so we were further ignored. We found a menu lying about. Beers and food got ordered, but the beers did not come until 20 minutes later. We ordered one more drink, but the bartender forgot about making it, even after he checked for ID. He just went about his business printing out checks, wiping the counter, leaving the bar, coming back to the bar, not making the drink... When we asked him, he realized then. Food did not come until 40 minutes after the beers. The waitress finally saw us and realized she forgot us. Miraculously, all the food was still steaming hot. The sausage was burnt. At least it tasted good. The fries were pretty dang good too. Actually, all the food was pretty damn good, but the lack of service ruined it all.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I parked on 5th to go elsewhere and when we came back to the car, we decided that a late night brew would be great and this place was right on the corner.  Perfect!
Great atmosphere, good for a friday night, no dress atire required, lets all meet at blank o'clock, authentic Irish Pub.  I felt that I was welcome at this place...particularly because the manager came over and kissed me on the cheek.  God I love having Breasts!  
Good size beers for a fair price, what more do you need from your local pub?
Worth a first visit and a second and a third....
author: Shauna C.

description:
You have to try the Shepard's Pie..it truly is a Chieftain Classic! The perfect meal on a cold rainy day. 

Every time I've visited, it's been a slow night and I actually enjoyed that. The staff was great..the food was great..and the drinks are just right.  And.. to top it all off.. it's just a short walk from Westfield..HEAVEN!
author: Peit P.

description: Fun atmosphere to chill, eat and throw back a couple Guinness. Had a couple drinks and an amazing steak sandwich the other night. Stumbled back to BART, fell asleep and woke up at the end of the line. Got back on BART the other way and finally made it home much later. Woke up the next morning chewing on my pillow still dreaming about that steak sandwich!
author: Matt H.

description:
i will give this place another try

but when i was here for saint patrick's day, all i could think was

this place smells like feet
author: Josie M.

description: Been here a few times, and will continue to come back for the great atmosphere! Fun, laid back pub with stiff drinks! I did eat here a few times, and frankly don't quite remember the food beside the corned beef meal which was very hearty. Other than that i can't recall! Don't know if it was because the food wasn't memorable, or if it's because the drinks were!
author: Amanda B.

description: This place is just below average. My boyfriend and I went on a Sunday and we ordered Calamari, Wings and I ordered a Lamb burger. The server asked us how we would like the food to come and we just said bring out the calamari first and the wings with my burger. We waited for 30 minutes before she brought out ALL the food at once. The burger was supposed to be Medium rare and it was well done so I sent it back.. The calamari was over breaded but the dipping sauce was good. The server was below average and was aloof with us. She doubled charged me for my burger and didn't even realize she made a mistake until I saw it rang up twice on the bill. She did take care of it but it was a hassle. I don't think I will be back to visit or eat at this establishment. Just pass it up .. there are way too many other great pubs to eat at.
author: Sarah N.

description:
I'm not a drinker...anymore. That said, I like to come here. The waitstaff is great. Friendly and gorgeous are the words I'd say...at least to their face. Fucking hot is what I was thinking. 
When I drop by for lunch, I always get the fish and chips. 
The last time I was there however, I was dissapointed by the small size of my fish serving. Fat and juicy good-scrawny and dry bad. Owners please take note. This was a one in ten bad showing so...I'll go again.

Swing!
m
author: Mark B.

description:
Ok, I believe in full disclosure. I'll be honest I came here and already had a headache. I know it's a pub, sports are on the tv, people are watching the NBA whatever hoo-haw was on. 
It was packed. We finally grabbed a seat and a waitress' attention. We were not given any silverware or napkins. I was told the burger was amazing. I went on a whim and ordered the lamb burger. Big mistake. It smelled like rotting flesh. I kid you not. I love lamb, I love burgers, I love lamb burgers. This was just all bad, all wrong. I'm never one to have that much plate envy to the point where I can't eat my meal. This time I just couldn't eat it, one bite made me sick to my stomach. I had to steal my boyfriend's burger like a total baby. I really didn't want to be that plate stealing girl, but I had no choice. We were in a hurry, I couldn't send it back nor get the attention of the busy waitress to do so. Luckily, Zac thought it was the bee's knees (I don't know what he was on). I had to leave the Chieftain before the bill, because that place was too loud and if I had to smell more of the rotting flesh I was going to vomit. Seriously, that burger needs to be taken off the menu. For reals. The other burger gave me indigestion and also called for some Pepto. I will not come back here for food, unless I suddenly become some crazy sports fan.
author: Kristy H.

description: Super dark inside, straight up man beer, good burgers and cheap. It's a pub and lives up to it's status.
author: Cassaundra D.

description: Nothing different from any other Irish bar I've been to. Beers on tap are cheap as was the HUGE bottle of Irish Apple Cider. Not my type of crowd but pretty laid back. Waitresses were hard to find. I was able to flag one down after 5 minutes of sitting around and she was perfectly nice but as she was ending her shift, she forgot our waters. Passed by this place everyday when I worked in the city, glad I didn't pass through.
author: Cheryl P.

description: One of the best Irish pubs I have been to! has all the classics. The potato jalapeno poppers were great, the fish and chips were great, and so was the corned beef and cabbage! On top of that we had Emma as our server - Who is from Ireland - and she recommended some great things.
author: Jamie L.

description: This is a live commentary. I just walked in to grab a quick bite for lunch...I happen to be working at the Moscone Center today so this is pretty convenient...EPL on the telly with the sound off.....that's cool. Music nice and low....also cool. Bartender and waitress both regarded me with certain degree of apprehension as I walked in...like I was about to ruin their day by ordering something...like I just asked them to drag a boat down a  gravel road. Just ordered the turkey toastie....simple, tasty enough...it comes with fries....14 fries to be precise....oh well it's better than the crap at Moscone which costs an arm and a leg
author: fergaldo f.

description: We sat and waited and waited for some service. After about 10 minutes someone dropped off some menus, and then she never came back. We left. The atmosphere was very sports bar-y. Not a great Irish pub feel. It looked like they had a lot to offer when it came to drinks and I really wanted to try the cheesy steak fries. I would still like to try again, I could tell that there was one waitress for the entire floor, plus the bar tender if he wasn't busy, so I'm going to assume they were short handed.
author: Emily N.

description:
Started my St. Patrick's Day 2010 shenanigans here bright and early, at 10AM.  There's nothing like day drinking.

I had the bangers and mash for breakfast.  I had no idea what I ordered, I just liked the name.  My order came in and WOW!  Huge plate of big ass sausages, mashed potatoes, and beans!  Delicious!  I've never had bangers and mash before, so I have nothing to compare to.  But it sure was filling, and a great way to start my day drinking extravaganza.

I had an irish coffee here and then left because a) the bartender kept pushing me to take shots of Irish whisky and b) the bartender was giving me shit about my expired driver license (what am I supposed to do, the DMV hadn't sent me my new one yet).  

Would love to come back and watch a sporting event here.  I can see things getting crazy and fun in there.
author: Charlene R.

description: This place is the after party for POINT BREAK LIVE SF!  After every show on Friday and Saturday night you can find the actors and some of the patrons hit this spot due to it's close location of the Metreon.  Great prices on drinks for the area!  Might actually be the cheapest in prices for the area.
author: Jason W.

description:
Dropped in with 15 of our customers, not a big deal for this experienced wait staff. Kept us refilled as necessary and greeted all new comers immediately and got their orders. No one gets ignored here.
Ruben sandwich was good, not much fat although the sauerkraut was without punch.  Over all I'm glad we chose this place to entertain some out of towners in SF for training
author: Tom R.

description:
Love to hit this place, especially when there is any major soccer action. Gets too crowded then, but its all the more fun to watch soccer. 
Food is good, love their bloody mary's and Lamb Burger
author: Anish K.

description:
I work in the area and it's a decent irish pub.  The food is pretty good for a pub but I come here less now because of the service.  

The girls that work there have never failed but one bartender there always seems to find a way to ignore me if I'm the only one sitting at the bar for lunch.  Think his name is Dylan.  A friendlier regular bartender would probably net this place another star.
author: Michael P.

description: For St. Patty's Day, I wandered over to The Chieftan with Nish and Stephy for some beers and real down home Irish food.  Wow, this dive really blew away my expectations.  The food was served really fast for a pub grub lunch, and the shepard pies, fish & chips and sausages were authentic and tasty.  The atmosphere was loud but not tooo rowdy, which was perfect for a mid-day break from the office grind.  I think the best part may have been watching the regulars who like to hang at the bar -- real characters I tell you.  Turns out comfort food and beers mid-day are not conducive to getting much work done.  Without a pick-me-up afterwards I would have been zzzing.
author: Nicole G.

description: So I was totally off the mark on where I thought this bar was, so by default (weather and dress considered) we ducked into this spot to get out of the cold for a couple of drinks. Immediately when my date ordered drinks, she demanded that I show my ID. Yes no problem, but is it necessary to glare at me from across the bar while you do so? It was werid...she was apparently in a bad mood and it showed. Be nice to customers- it's a basic science...
author: NaNa M.

description: The service was bad and the food was icky.  Drinks were OK, I guess.  The curry fries weren't curry-licious.  I honestly couldn't taste any curry.  Who wants curry fries with no curry?  WTF?  There was this weird pale flavorless sauce that was *not* curry.  It made me sad.  I won't go back.
author: Meghan S.

description: Came here for hubby's work happy hour... looks like a pretty cool Irish bar, but I should say that the waitress look like grumpy people! One of them was nice though, but that person didn't serve my table! I should say that they have pretty good list of Irish wishkey.. after all, it is an Irish place. We didn't order food, but if you want to just hang out in the city, I think it's one of the better bars.
author: Daisy S.

description: Fun place to hang out after work and drink some good beer. I recommend the oktoberfest beer very tasty.
author: nathan r.

description: The bartenders here are extremely friendly and had me laughing a lot! It's a cozy little bar and has a great atmosphere to just hang out and enjoy good company.
author: Desiree R.

description:
Came back with another friend to try the food -- It was outstanding!  And, here's why:

Drinks - Perfect: Ordered Bloody Mary's, perfectly seasoned, with the right amount of garlic and bite. Seriously, this things have a kick! Also ordered a few rounds of Jäger and Jameson/Bailey's Guinness Bombs, 

Starters - Outstanding: Irish Jalepeno Bites, mashed potato with cheese, jalepeno and other goodness deep fried and served with a side of magic sauce. 

Entrees - Fantastic: Ordered the cheeseburger, fish and chips, and the Chieftain burger (the one with the egg). Burgers were perfectly cooked, just the right size -- burger patty was thick but not too thick,  ratio of bun to meat was ideal, all condiments come on the side, garnished with lettuce, tomatoes and pickles. The egg on the Chieftain burger was a perfectly cooked over-medium egg, made just as ordered. The fish was probably great for people who like fish. The batter was perfect--great flavor, not too much, little greasy  but hit the spot. Unfortunately, I'm not a big fish eater, and I'm kinda picky about it when I do eat it. So, that said, the fish was HUGE, like the size of King Size Snicker bars, maybe 10 inches long by 1+ inches thick. That's just too much fish for. Others who love deep-fried cod would most likely disagree. Oh! And, the fries were big, fat rectangle style ones that were wonderfully addictive, some crispy, some not, some both, just the right combination.

Service - Fantastic: Fantastic drink and food services. Waitress, whose name I did not learn but she was the blonde waitress working Sunday night around 6pm, was super attentive, a glass never went dry, not too chatty but chose to engage when she wanted to, making it feel genuinely like she wanted to talk to us rather than having to because customer service is just part of the job (perfect!).
