Atmosphere: Busy but not too crowded. Watching OKC lose to San Antonio. Between that and the above items, the atmosphere was perfect.
author: Sarah K.

description: Good Guinness stew and good beers on tap, staff is cool and have good stories. They open at 11:30am-12 noon I think.
author: D J.

description: I can recommend the burger here - and the selection of brews is good.  Packed into this place to watch some Champions League soccer.  Good spot for that.
author: Stephen A.

description: I've gone there twice in the past couple of months and have been very impressed by the service (the bartenders are a blast), the booze, and food...all of it is SO SO good.  Try the portobello mushroom sandwich, the daily special of a MASSIVE burrito or an order of super good garlic fries.  A total WIN for this place. Yes, try it now.
author: Veronica S.

description: A nice little pub with good food!  Their shepherd's pie is absolutely yummy! Their lamb burger is to die for, but you should have a BIG appetite to finish it!  The only downside is that it can get pretty loud with all the tvs going on at the same time and people screaming for their favorite sports team..
author: Nadine G.

description: I am in San Francisco for the week.  I first came in to the pub a few days ago and Fiona the bar tender was awesome.  She suggested some great food and drinks.  Since then, I have eaten and drank most of their menu.  Everything is so good!  Fiona, Davie and Dillon are so friendly!  They make you feel like a local and make you want to keep coming back.  The Irish fare is truely authentic and they also have other things that are unbelievably delicious.  The selection of beer is immense...delicious and perfect for the Irish atmosphere.  I have been there several times this week and highly recommend this pub to anyone who want a great meal or drink at a great price.
author: Jan D.

description:
went there a while back. from what i remember, my experience involved a cute waitress, express service so we could make our movie on time, a tasty beer special, a tasty pot pie.

minus one cause i ordered a side of what sounded like super special awesome fry's, and then some fry's came with my friend food as well. and  the ones ordered weren't any more super dopalicious then the regular ones at all. owell

atmosphere kinda worked for me to. who woulda thought?
author: justen e.

description: I guess I kinda missed out on the great experience everyone else had here cuz I just found this place mediocre.  The service was SUPER slow, albeit cheerful.  However, cheerful doesn't get me my food and drink quickly enough for me to leather-up and get to the Folsom Street Fair.  I thought my lamb burger tasted kinda weird.  Some bites were good while others were kinda off in a way I can't put my finger on.  Maybe it wasn't seasoned evenly?  The appetizer sampler platter had only one thing on it that I enjoyed and that was the wings.  The potstickers were pretty bland and the coconut shrimp weren't memorable at all.  Also for $4 I kinda thought that I would get a bigger mimosa.  However, everyone else seemed to enjoy their meal so maybe I was just the lucky loser that ordered the wrong meal here.
author: Jill D.

description: In the spirits of St Patrick we decided to go to an irish pub.  I was not impressed by my shephard pie or my sticky table, but i was impressed by the size of my apple cider :D
author: Karena L.

description: Another homey, inviting neighborhood oirish pub.  These places are always pretty fun.
author: Rick H.

description: What a charming place! I have lived about 4 blocks away for 10 years, and while I have always thought about going in when I passed it, I never had....UNTIL yesterday!! I was wandering by about 3:00 after picking up some Friskies for my 20 lb hairball (apparently he would rather starve than eat the high end organic stuff I was trying out on him...) and I thought what the hell, it's 5 o'clock somewhere (I am easy this way)...And it was just as cute as a bug! I plopped myself down at the bar and ordered a drink from a super sweet bartender, and she helped me decide between the numerous tasty sounding salads....A spinach and shrimp salad...YUM!!! Very well done with avocado and a mango vinaigrette...The whole vibe was super friendly, so I stayed for another round and then wandered home feeling like I had just made a new friend...Of course, it may just have been the rum.
author: Lara D.

description: I had a pretty good time here. The waitress was very nice and did a great job. She happily replaced a crab dish that smelled like aluminum death and tasted only slightly worse. This was not her fault and they had no problem swapping it out for another dish. Overall, good things.
author: N S.

description:
i ordered a dish called the chieftain irish grill, aka irish breakfast with sausage, irish bacon, baked beans, blood pudding, tomatoes, eggs, fries and toast - but i had it at dinner time, and i had it with an anchor steam.  really good combination.  

nice decor for a sports pub. not what you would expect given the location.

i have to give this place only four stars though, because they only have one waitress during peak dinner hours.  maybe that was an anomaly.  

i will be back to try the cabbage and if the service improves i'll have to adjust my review.
author: Greg D.

description: corner pub, south of market....quick jot south of sf shopping....bar and tables....wooden 'n' aged....glass of fat tire..self liking light....chieftian being not just beer....but, food being popular....shot of fernet....chicken wings, appetizers 'n' xl platters served out....if not for the drinks....go for food......
author: Hen A.

description: the shepards pie was amazing and the brown bread they serve with it is even better.
author: Greg H.

description:
Good Food.
Fast service for a late lunch (12:40p)
No wait.

This was not on a day that moscone was blowing up. I imagine it's a different story when conventioneers are everywhere.
author: Brian P.

description: We need more bars like the Chieftan in the SOMA area. This place is a solid spot to get your drink on, watch any major sporting event, or just grab a quick bite with some good friends. The prices aren't "dive- bar-cheap" but for San Francisco, they are reasonable, and every shot I've had here has been poured in a rocks glass.
author: Michael H.

description: Pretty good food for a pub. I had the Bangers & Mash, but I will have to come back just to have the Guinness stew. I also had a Guinness, but it looked like they had an interesting selection of whiskeys. There was blurb laying about explaining that the Arabs are the ones that perfect the distilling process, which made it's way to Ireland via Spain. Interesting!
author: Ken L.

description: I like this place mainly because it doesn't try to be something it isn't.  The food is always tasty, but exactly what it should be, and that's nice simple pub food.  The fish and chips always look good, but the Chieftain burger is what I usually go with.  This heart clogging concoction comes with a 1/3lb patty, bacon, cheddar cheese, and a fried egg on top and is exactly what you want when you're out drinking.  It also comes with pretty good thick cut fries which I have no complaints about.  The staff here are all really nice and seem to really try to provide the best service possible.  Combine this with some decent music, and a laid back atmosphere and you have a pretty great place to come after work.  Unfortunately I work in the Presidio, so it isn't too conveniently located for me, but if you live or work near soma, this is definitely a place you should check out.
author: Joshua W.

description: Came here with some friends during fleet weekend. The place was clean and the server was very friendly. The style of the place is really neat with all the wood work on the walls, kinda had a cozy feel. We had dinner and drinks, food was good and there was a nice selection of drinks from the bar. If ever in the area and in need of a drink i would visit again.
author: jessica h.

description: Fish & Chips are worth the stop to The Chieftain. Service was good and the lovely bartender gave me a free coke. Sometimes life is good!
author: André C.

description: This place may be a little cozy for groups larger than five, but it's a great place for convention-goers to get a pint of Guinness.  I loved the crowd, atmosphere and the Chieftain burger (bacon, cheese with a fried egg on top).
author: Darren S.

description: Cool little sports bar:  Overall good bar food and service, many beer selections, full bar.  Pete really knows how to run a bar and make his guests feel welcome - will definitely be going back often=)
author: HY L.

description: This place was fabulous!  Charming atmosphere, great beer AND they have grilled cheese on the menu. Which for me is fantastic!  Our bartender/waiter Dylan was wonderful!  Overall great experience and I will definetly go back.
author: Caitlin M.

description: This is NOT a dive bar, which is refreshing in a city overrun with them. If you are in town for a convention, this is a good choice since its right across the street. Nice and comfortable bar good for watching soccer.
author: Michael H.

description: We came here for a bite while spending the day at WonderCon. This is more of a bar then a restaurant. There was a rugby game on the big screen and the TV's so we had to pay a cover of $20 each even though we just wanted to have lunch. Not so great. It was cramped and crowded. The waitresses were hard working but worn, only 2 on the floor and it was really busy. My husband liked his lamb burger with a small amount of blue cheese (and he asked them to hold the onions). The steak fries were ok, a bit cold when they got to us at the bar. I had the Shepard's pie, which was excellent. The Shepard's pie had tasty ground beef, peas and carrots, and fresh herbs topped with fluffy mashed potato. My actual lunch was great, not too filling, just the perfect amount and warm comfort food on a cold rainy day. The crowd was cheering the game and even though some were cheering for the French and others the English everyone seemed to get on well. Also I did noticed a few Irishmen here so if you are looking for an authentic Irish pub this seemed to be one. I don't usually like bars/pubs as I don't drink anything stronger then coffee, but if you want a good place to have a pint and watch a rugby game this is probably the spot for you.
author: Tiffany T.

description: Good for Tuesday pub quiz, but I probably wouldn't go otherwise. Food is decent, but overpriced. Service is spotty and some of the waitresses in the past have been grumpy and rude, although the current batch is better.
author: Lisa B.

description: A solid irish bar, excuse me, pub with solid irish food. No really. Happy hour is a good time. The only thing that seems to be missing is spontaneous break out into irish song. Maybe I'll do it the next time I'm there. Oh danny boy, the pipes, the pipes are calling, from glen to glen and down the mountain side...
author: Jordan M.

description: Finally, a Pub Quiz venue that would be worth going to even without pub quiz!  This is a great place for a pint or for dinner.  Has that warm and toasty yet modern pub feel, with beautiful wood decor, similar to The Liberties, except this place was far more bustling, at least when we came.  What else is there really to say except that this is an essential stop on the SF pub circuit?
author: Wes M.

description: Ack!! My bf and I stopped in here assuming we'd get rockin' good fish and chips, but we were sooooooooooooooooooooo disappointed. They were soggy and flavorless, and among the worst I've ever had. I went with beer (a safe choice in a pub), but bf ordered his first bloody mary, and may never have another, poor lad. The atmosphere was okay-ish, but the food and service were poorly lacking. I would have loved to have loved this hole--in-the-wallish, authentic-ish, ir-ish pub, but...I didn't. Yuck.
author: Fran I.

description: I was here once, for happy hour. I was supposed to check out a place to rent, but the guy ended up flaking so I was bummed. But being there with friends, and a beer in hand definitely helped lift the mood up. Maybe I'm not used to the SF vibe, but it's places like this in SF that make me want to come and live there, so, if I was downtown with a bunch of friends, this is the a place I'd be saying " hey guys, I know this great divish Irish bar just around the corner..."
author: Rogerio F.

description: I very much enjoyed a pint of Guinness and a good burger here. The burger had all the right toppings, including avocado, mushrooms, bacon, grilled onions, and although I am not a french fry eater, I did sample one and these were delicious.
author: Mark C.

description:
i've been here a few times and its the type of place i wold take my dad if he wanted to get a beer, but it's not really my scene.  i just have something against the whole irish bar thing although this place seems like it might be pretty close (i've never been to ireland but i have been to scotland). either way i prefer bars that don't charge six dollars for a beer.

i would recommend this place for a drinking dinner though.  the food is nice and heavy, custom made to soak up some booze.
author: Markus B.

description: love me some garlic fries with non-sautéed garlic! nom to the max! dislike the $20 for a double grey goose and seven. outside of the price, the waitress was somewhat off her game the night I came in. instead of a vodka/7up, I was given a vodka soda. epic fail in my book. as well, the waitress asked if she took my drink order three minutes after taking it. c'mon now, get your game back, woman.
author: Jasen S.

description: I'm a sucker for an Irish pub.  I was in San Fran for some work and this place wasn't too far from my hotel to walk.  I was here a few nights and enjoyed the food (corned beef/cabbage, garlic fries, fish/chips) and the Guinness.  I sat at the bar and had no problem with the service on weekday early evenings.  It looks like a dive and feels like one inside, but still pleasant.
author: Eric W.

description: This place even has non-alcoholic beer! Not that you usually go to a bar to drink that stuff, but hey don't knock it. I went through a sober stint and really wanted to be able to hang out with friends and still have a beer in hand. So we went here. Not to mention that my fiance works a block away so we get free parking! Good vibe. Futball i.e. soccer almost always on and a great place to watch World Cup. Went at 9 am and it was packed! They have great fish and chips and these litlle fried potatoe and cheese thingys with jalapenos. Very good with beer! Anyway now that I am back off the wagon, I still love to go there mid week or Friday after work with all the Cybernet kids to do some good hearty drinkin'! Cheers!
author: monika l.

description: A word to the wise: avoid the veggie burger at all costs. If you're vegetarian, stick to drinking dinner. If you're not vegetarian, don't be like me and wonder why you didn't spend less time talking and more time looking at the menu and ordering something less prone to (mis)interpretation. The other items my dining companions ordered fared much better--a better-than-passable fish and chips, a decent Irish stew, among other orders. No complaints for the Irish on their drink selection--a big variety of beer on tap and lots of Irish whiskeys to choose from. The ambiance was relaxed and on the smaller, intimate side without being overly crowded or noisy, but then again I haven't been there during a football match...
author: Megan K.

description: Jules Winfield would love the Neiman Ranch burger. The curry cheese fries could've used more curry sauce. But the big deal here is that I've discovered Smithwick's! Yum.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Enjoyed the shepherd's pie and the Ninkasi beer, but the fish and chips were soggy and very much a "meh" experience.  Not sure why people are raving over them.
author: John D.

description: Chieftan's a reliable neighborhood pub that always seems to be there right when you need it.  The staff is friendly, the food is good, the whiskey selection is wide.  Not much else you need to know.
author: Oliver N.

description: After a carb-a-riffic dinner at Bucca di Beppo up the street, we decide to knock back a few stiff ones within a short walking distance. I mean, after a dinner with carbs like that, we couldn't have made it more than 1-2 blocks without walkers. So, we land at The Chieftain, so many people in our group have been there before, "landing" there many other times. I give them a couple thumbs up for the effort in making it seem so close to an actual Irish bar. Although, Foley's has beautiful people and beautiful Irish people working, and the Chieftain may not have as many actual 100% "Irish" folk working, it's all the same. A bartender is a bartender, right? There's plenty of room, plenty of chairs, TVs, a long bar, decent prices, and very clean bathrooms. Thumbs up!
author: Braden B.

description:
First off, I'm a journalist. And any bar that's near a newspaper will surely do well. It's the nature of our profession that we like to drink.

But what's different about this place is that the food's really good, too. It's much better than pub grub. Great sandwiches, apps and burgers. And they generally have good picks on the TV.

Great beer, great eats. And the wait staff is pretty nice, too.
author: andrea a.

description: my wife and I were staying at the hotel across the street we were delighted to find the chieftain bar. It was a very busy sunday night but relaxed the food was great the waitress Fiona recommended the lamb burger which i had  and the corn beef sandwich that my wife enjoyed they have a home made mustard  to die for, very friendly Irish staff and the drink is half what you pay in the hotel!!!
author: duncan h.

description:
Best fish and chips I've had in The City, bar none.  That pretty much sums it up right there.  It's a good thing it's not conveniently located to me, 'cuz I really don'r need to eat any more fried food!

Most of the time, The Chieftan manages to capture that old-world pub atmosphere.  I especially love coming in on a cold and rainy day for steaming hot irish coffee and fish & chips.  Plus, they have both Guiness and Murphys on tap (Don't know what else.  Who needs anything else on tap if you've got those two?) and a list of whiskys about a page long.  Very yummy!

The crab & chese dip and the curry & cheese fries deserve honorable mention.  But I barely get to have them because if I'm here, it's almost always for that fish & chips fix.

Two caveats though:

If there's a baseball or (american) football game on, The Chieftan loses all of its ambiance and becomes just another american-style sports bar, with all of the obnoxiousness that entails.  Avoid at those times.

Also, whoever does the scheduling needs to have his head checked.  Some weeks back, a bunch of my friends and I came here at midnight or so after seeing a movie.  And they had only one person working where there's usually four.  She was a trooper, and did her best.  But there's simply too much work for one person there.  So service suffered pretty badly.
author: John B.

description: Anywhere that has Miller Lite on tap is going to be a favorite of mine....again as I have said in other reviews..try it before you judge..its amazing. Anyways, the Chieftain has a fun atmosphere and fortunately has not become a "trendy" bar which keeps is casual and low maintenance. The bartenders are great and even on a busy night are really attentive and fast. This place is great to go to with a big group because it is pretty spacious and has a good selection of beer. I have never tried the food but from the other reviews I will on my next visit.
author: Annie M.

description: The BEST place to start your B2B drinking at!  See you there next year at 8am sharp.
author: Megan H.

description:
we were roaming downtown with some time to kill before an appointment, and my boyfriend was getting antsy about a football (soccer) match that was currently playing.  i was in dire need of some food, cranky, and ready to snap off and chomp the next person's head who walked by.

i suggested the chieftain, as we were a few blocks away, and it seemed like the remedy of compromise for the both of us.

they were tremendously packed being that it was during the height of the lunch rush, and also had a right crowd as the infamous aresnal and manchester united teams were duking it out on the field.  that being said, it took a while to get seated, and even longer to get the menu and orders placed.

when the host who seated us noticed no one had taken our orders or served us water, he gracefully took it upon himself to do so and was very apologetic.  that gesture and acknowledgment took away my irritable attitude, and subsided the thoughts in my head about the negative review i was going to write on yelp.  after that everything was smooth sailing, and our rounds of drinks and dishes came out with no problems.  the staff were very cordial laughing and joking with me throughout the match, which obliterated my initial impression of the staffs' service.

i'm an equal opportunist, and although harsh and critical on customer service -- i worked as a bartender for a long time, and only expect the best in customer service -- i can respect and commend a stellar comeback after an unimpressive initial encounter.
author: Sheri N.

description: I'm at this place pretty much every week, as I do a lot of work at the Off Market Theatre, just around the block. I'm a sucker for pubs, so I'm a bit biased, but I always enjoy hanging out here. The food is very tasty, although I'm usually hitting it right after the kitchen closes. (They do have meat pies after kitchen hours, but I only recommend them if you're desperate for microwaved food). The beer is always good, and I've always been treated well by the staff. I prefer it on Sunday nights, or duing the week, late, as it's not so crowded. Expect to shout to be heard during peak times.
author: Dan W.

description: The chieftain is the place i go when soccer is on and I need to get away from work for awhile. It is like taking a mini-vacation from sterile downtown with good pub food, cute waiters who wink and waitresses who smile. How unlike other pubs in san francisco that I can think of. Oh did i mention they will repay the love of a regular with a small discount....
author: Cassandra T.

description: Everything is good: burgers, shephards pie, irish breakfast, etc.  Great bar for happy hour or lunch.
author: Cory J.

description: From the extremely nice wood and stone interior to the jger shrine at the center of the bar, everything in here felt halfway out of place.  And yet, it worked:  It was totally mellow without being empty at prime time on a Saturday, they had $3 pints, and they had Murphy's Stout for a nice change of pace.  If it were a few blocks closer, I'd probably come here regularly.
author: Bailey S.

description: In town for business and looking for a good place to watch the Al vs LSU game.  Pleasantly surprised by cozy atmosphere, friendly wait staff and very good food.
author: Ann S.

description: Overall, a pretty good bar experience. Not too crowded on a Saturday night, and the drinks were fairly inexpensive. A laid back place to hang out with some friends.
author: Dana L.

description: 100% unremarkable, except that some of their dishes leave a lingering, pervasive and unpleasant odor upon service.
author: Quinn S.

description: Last night before our gig at Annie's Social Club, I was dying for a burger.  I absolutely need nourishment before gigs because I need energy to destroy your ear drums and make you succumb to Hellhunter's unfiltered heaviness!    So walking around the neighborhood, I decided to stop in The Chieftain.  It was a wise decision because the 1/2 lb lamb burger was fantastic.  The steak fries were also kick ass!  I stuck around a little longer to watch the 49ers and Raiders games simultaneously.  I just wish I had more time because the place had a cool vibe and I wanted to drink more.
author: Larry A.

description: Great bartenders, good fries, good casual crowd.  Fun place for trivia on Tuesday.   Also, for being in what can be a somewhat shady neighborhood (at least at night) it is very clean and hobo free.
author: Marina F.

description:
Best pour in the city.

The Good:  The Guinness and the food is awesome as well.

The Bad:  The location isn't great, so I don't stop by as often as I'd like.  The service is sometimes a bit slow.  I'm happy to settle in slowly with my pint and wait for my food, so no big deal.

The Ugly:  None.
author: Scott L.

description: While I've dropped by The Chieftain on more than a few occasions--including after midnight on NYE two years ago--I always thought of it as a decent bar in SoMa, but nothing really more than that. A few months ago I had friends leaving the Bay Area and wanted to hold a last get together while doing something more entertaining than just drinking. We set up camp at trivia night at The Chieftain that Tuesday. We all had a blast. So when I realized that my birthday was going to be on a Tuesday, I again turned to trivia night at The Chieftain. Giving them only a few hours heads-up, Pete and his staff were very helpful in making sure we were able to get a large space in this rather condensed drinking establishment. I had a happy birthday.
author: Lori G.

description: I am a fan now. I have lived in SF for about 12 years now and can tell you that I have driven past Chieftain many times a week and never imagined going in. All I can say is do not judge a book by its cover. Not that its in a creepy alley or transits lounging outside but its one of those places that never grabs your attention. Maybe cause they do not care if they grab your attention. I was there last night for one of my buddies birthday. The place has a lot of history and one can feel it in the air. It was opened in 1934 after the prohibition repeal. I assume since it is an Irish pub they have many of the traditional Irish lagers. They also have a full bar so one can order anything one pleases. We started with a few pints of Stella and some Czechvar Pilsners. We closed the night with a few Irish Car Bombs....dont know why I had these. They always make me feel like a college kid. I had the Fish and Chips....it was OK. I had some of my buddies Chieftain Shepherd's Pie and it was one of the most delicious plates I have ever had. It was a Baked Ground Lamb with Peas, Carrots and Onions with a Mashed Potato Crust. Served with Guinness Gravy and  House-Made Brown Bread. Man ohh man....talk about your 3,000 calorie plate...yummy!!!! The party I was with also raved about the Grilled Shrimp & Baby Spinach Salad. They have traditional Irish LIVE music on the weekends and some weekdays. I recommend this place to anyone that wants to feel like you are in Ireland without having to leave the comforts of home. Now I have to drink some more :)
author: Edson C.

description: I live above the chieftain and my liver pays for it.  You wouldn't think that pub food could be so good... but it is.   I reccomend the fish and chips, or the lamb burger (as long as you like bleu cheese).  You really can't go wrong eating here so do yourself a favor and stop in for a bite n' a pint.
author: Ben P.

description: I've eaten here twice and both times were stellar. The curry veggie wrap is sooooooo good! The fries are also sooooooo yummy! I would highly suggest ordering some food with your drinks.
author: Elizabeth J.

description:
the tables smell of wood soaked with layers and layers of spilt beer and splattered grease.  

if they could talk, they'd probably ask for a deep scrubbing. 

but they can't, so i'll do the talking for them, and i say the smell is a sign that many people have had fun here.  i included.
author: Andrew P.

description: I came into the city to get my car worked on and found this pub down the street. It was a fairly good sized pub. I took other yelpers advice and ordered the fish n chips and they were really good. It was also refreshing to be waited by real Irish staff! You just can't go wrong with $5 pints of smithwicks and four flat screens!
author: CJ Y.

description: I got completely savaged here for some work thing. There was good beer and lots of it. The bartender was decent enough, but I guess that's due in no small part to us being in a group throwing money around on a business tab.  They make a good irish car bomb here, I'll tell ya that.  This place seems pretty geared toward convention traffic & clientele, which we were so it fit the bill fine.  There were some hipsters there who clearly thought they were too cool for the scene yet still remained for some reason. That's ok, I enjoyed f_king with them.
author: Steve R.

description: We just saw and Irish band play at the Chieftain, and you just can't not be happy listening to an Irish jig.  They have a great selection of beers, and the food wasn't bad either.  A great place to stop if you need to escape the madness of downtown.
author: Jeffrey F.

description: I don't know if I was still traumatized by the five huge piles of vomit I saw before heading to this bar, but there was a very foul stench going off .It was a mixture of pee,vinegar, and foot fungus rank. I get bummed off stuff like that so an otherwise pretty nice bar gets two stars.the bartender was really nice though
author: Lauren V.

description: We all know there aren't Irish pubs outside of Ireland, because the Irish are what make the pub what it is.  Still, this is a great place to duck into on a weekday at 10:30am and stay until 3pm.  Tell work your going to an "appointment".  Watch sports, drink Bass, eat burgers with an egg on top, and relax.  Never been here at night.  I like weekdays when its not busy.  Wait staff are all very cool.  A great dark bar to get lost in with good food.  I know its just "pretend" pub atmosphere, but who cares?  I'll be back again and again.
author: NoCal S.

description:
I LOVE the Chieftain. 

This place is perfect if you are catching a flick at the Mall or the Metreon and want to grab a beer and some bites. The on tap beer selection is great and the menu is delicious. 

If you are in the mood for good ol' pub food like fish and chips or shepherds pie, this is the place to go. 

Also the waitresses are extremely nice and the general bar crowd is friendly and unpretentious.
author: A K.

description: Standard Irish pub serving $5 Guinness pints.  Not too crowded (at least when I was there) and the kitchen closes around 11, so make sure you get your food on beforehand!
author: Mark D.

description: This is my favorite pub in the city.  They pour "perfect pints" almost all the bartenders have been awesome(though I have seen one jackass).  The food is pretty damn good and, most importantly, the atmosphere is really great.
author: Vince G.

description: Loud live music, booth-style wooden seats, good ole fashioned Irish accents from both the inebriated and the inebriated-on-life. Stop reading and go there now, laddie!
author: Maxx L.

description: I actually come here for lunch.  Ive had their burger and fries, which is really good, very juicy.  the fries although are the steak fries which i usually dont like, were very crispy.  and i have also have had their cheesy fries... which is also very very good.  cause how can you go wrong... its cheese and fries..... fat, salt and carbs...
author: Janet S.

description:
looks really scary and creepy from the outside.. you almost get that feeling when you're inside as well. if you're into pub food the turkey and avocado sandwich is good.. and always go with the hefeweizen. seriously. 

not bad, not great.. but maybe its new management but going here a week ago we had to wait about 30 minutes to get our bill and get out.. after we asked for it twice.  it's a good after work,dark and chill out spot.  Still a good place to go when you're craving some greasy fish and chips and a huge cold beer to down it with while watching some rugby. ;)
author: Diana R.

description:
somehow i let a beautiful stranger talk me into stopping here for a late night repose. 

i'd been before and had a decent meal during daylight hours, but a late night irish pub isn't my kind of thing unless there are a few grandparents standing on tables singing their heart out to a decrepit squeeze box and squeaky fiddle. 

nonetheless, i was more than pleasantly surprised to find a totally awesome bartender who poured the best guinness i've had this side of galway. she accepted no compromise and delivered the beers only when ready to be consumed, never before. three of them, actually. or at least i think it was three. i only remember three before i'm not sure how i ended up where i did and why, but that's no fault of the chieftain. too bad the place is surrounded by the busy and dirty streets of soma instead of a pleasant village with green grass more worthy of a drunken slumber.

if you want a good guinness, there's a bartender here who can set you right. fabulous service. and if you want to be cornered and mauled by a martini-wielding cigarette-smoking tall norwegian/polish model who thinks she can convince you that the swedish chef sounds sexy...this also could your kind of place. life in the big city, i guess. close to downtown, and the convention area so it makes sense when loud groups of business men stumble in around closing time -- not really the sort of "neighborly" traffic to speak of that you would usually find at a "pub".
author: Mulberry S.

description: Melanie and I were staying at the Intercontinental for New Years and decided to go across the street for a quick bite.  The waitress was very friendly and the atmosphere was the typical great Irish pub decor.  We ordered the lentil soup and a Chieftain burger.  Amazing!  The burger was hand made and cooked to our medium style request.  The fries were Texas style and were not salted which made the dinner very enjoyable.  We wanted to come back the next day but they hadn't opened yet so we will have to plan another day.
author: Michael V.

description: Went on a Sunday morning, it's just down the street from the Intercontinental.  There were several tables open, we grabbed one and waited for service.  It was a pretty long wait for everything - menus, drinks, food, tab...despite the place being two-thirds empty.  They have a weekend brunch menu, with several appealing sounding choices.  The teens had buttermilk pancakes and I had the Scotch eggs.  Thumbs up, all the way around, on the food.  If we had known that they had free wi-fi, we would have brought the laptop and the wait probably wouldn't have seemed so long.  I'd try it again and hope for better service.
author: We G.

description: So after a fun night of drunken bowling and other shananagins, my group and I came here for one last beer. Easy to order, found a place to sit, AND THEN the world's most amazing pizza magically appeared. It was probably so amazing because we were so drunk, and it probably didn't appear by accident as one of the guys ended up finding a pizza receipt crammed in his pocket the next morning - but at the time... MAGIC I tell you. So I have nothing bad to say about this bar at this time.
author: Sarah P.

description: I am a sucker for a dive bar, and The Cheiftain is right at the top of my list.  Perhaps, I have mostly gotten lucky, but every time I have been to the Chief, it hasn't been too crowded and the staff was helpful.  One time, we even came in with about 10 people, moved around a bunch of tables and then only had one drink.  No one cared.  Low key, awesome.
author: Amanda P.

description: I liked the vibe of this place.  I walked in here around 10:30 PM and immediately found a good and comfortable booth for about ten of our friends.  I thought that the beer was cheap and the aura was comfortable.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Great burgers.
Good vibe.
Mediocre fish-n-chips.
Hit or miss service.
author: WP D.

description: So I was rushing to a Yelp Elite party nearby and had some extra time to kill so a friend and I went to the Chieftain for a quick bite. We asked the waitress it's not going to take a long time right? She said no it shouldn't since it's slow right now. We order a hawaiian pizza and a vegetarian pizza. Waiting, waiting, waiting. Holy crap half an hour later Finally I see pizza coming out! What? The pizza was eh, it had fresh ingredients on it which I liked BUT it's not your traditional pizza. Uhh it had some weird sauce and cheddar cheese. It tasted more like cheese bread than a pizza, no bueno. This is the 1st time I actually like the crust better than the middle part because the cheese was overwhelming. This is abnormal for me to say since my slogan is, "If there's cheese, then I'm pleased!" Well not so pleased this time. I like the atmosphere and the other food looked good, maybe I will come back for irish food and beer!
author: Karen T.

description: If you want to get beat up at the end of the night  by an out of control bartender then this is the place for you!!!  This bartender was crazy!!  Spilling drinks on the customers to make them leave, then beating them up to make sure that they leave is the way that they treat their customers.  I would never visit this place again, and I was thinking about contacting the owners and asking why they would employ such an employee if they want to keep customers coming back.  Then when we were leaving after our horrendous experience the crazy bartender was pouncing on another customer!  Really great customer service.  This is not a place that you should ever visit!!  DO NOT GO HERE EVER!!!!!!
author: Stewart B.

description:
this place has good guinness. 

i would stop there, but i want to say something about the bad reviews.  it's a pub - i've never been greeted by a hostess in a real pub and led to a table as if it were applebees.  the service at the chieftain is great.  they're lovely people.  and, believe it or not, the food is decent.
author: Ian O.

description: I'm currently couch surfing  above the Chieftain and thus have been visiting it fairly frequently.  Each time has been more than a pleasure since the bartender is super cool and always gives me a good deal on drinks.  They also have some pretty good appetizers and from what I understand good food but I haven't tried any entrees yet.  I highly recommend it as a place to eat, drink and be merry.
author: Derek D.

description: This place can either be really great or really bad.  For me, it's bad when it's totally crammed full of people watching some sporting event and acting like big loud tools.  In those cases I get way claustrophobic and have to leave, else I'll shoot my face off.  BUT when it's a quiet Sunday afternoon or something, it's pretty awesome, because they have really good food.  Their wings are GREAT.  And you can do take-out, which is also pretty awesome.
author: Sarah R.

description: Badass menu for lunch. If you're into Irish food and you don't mind the walk into SOMA, well worth it on a lunch break.
author: D M.

description: This is a nice change of pace for lunch during the weekday.  Really good fish 'n chips are served here.  If you work nearby, they'll give you a discount.
author: chewy c.

description: This is a great, unknown, out-of-the-way, close-to-it-all irish pub!  They open early for rugby (really... who wants to watch a sport at 9am?  People do!) and stay later for the trivia crowd on tuesday nights.  Good times, decent pint prices and VERY tasty irish pub food.  Great chips too... that's FRIES to you americanos.
author: Plaid B.

description: Not a bad spot for irish food - tasty, but the portions are small if you are a large hungry man.
author: Richie S.

description:
Nothing really special to report about this place.  I live a few blocks away and make it over here a couple of times per year.  The food is so-so, service is ok and prices are fair.  And you can't really screw up a barcardi and diet coke!

Cool neighborhood however.
author: James B.

description: Love this place! The food is really good and you wouldnt expect it by seeing what it looks from the outside. The burgers are always good and the large cut fries are amazing. I would skip the mall food and come here if you want some good food.
author: Melissa M.

description: This place is close to my work so it's nice to go for an after-work beer. I really didn't pay a ton of attention until World Cup, since I'm a fan, always on the lookout for a good place to watch some of the games. We went to watch the Argentina/Mexico game, got a good seat, the place filled up really quickly with rabid soccer fans of all heritages, and then was transformed into 2 hours of jolly chaos. Hats off the the waitstaff for navigating the crowds, and cheers to the cooks for managing to keep quality food coming out of the kitchen. This place has the best fricking lamb burger I've ever had, yuuuummmm.
author: Renee A.

description:
Every time my boyfriend and I drive past The Chieftain, we salute and  yell "ChiefTAAAAAIIIIIIINNN!"  He enjoys the Budvar (aka Czechvar), I enjoy whatever's on special.  Tonight I had a bloody mary that was actually really good and it was only $4.

I wouldn't have guessed this, but the smoked turkey & avocado sandwich was actually better than the cheeseburger.  And I feel like the sandwich is a good compromise because you get your fried quotient in the steak fries that come with the sandwich, but the sandwich isn't fried so at least it's sorta healthy?  The sandwich was on great thick wheat bread and the pear chutney spread was very nice with the turkey and cheddar.  The cheeseburger was sorta flat and boring and just not that impressive.  Oh well.  

Boo for having the Rutgers/Stanford women's college bball game on the projection screen and the Chargers/Colts game on a tiny old TV in the corner.  Huh?
author: Michelle K.

description:
Ive been having lunch here on n off for a while and certainly miss the days when Elaine was behind the bar.  She was awesome and those who sent her out in style a few years back all seem to have moved on to other pubs...

The current staff is a bit new a seem to struggle with consistency so we'll have to see if they can bring this pub back to its former glory...
author: That G.

description:
Yeah, well, if you like psuedo Irish pubs and eclectic pub food, this is as good a place as any in the City.  Eric, the day manager / chef, greets all lunch customers when not directing the cooking.  All the wait staff say "hi" like they mean it, and after a couple of visits know who you are, and shortly thereafter ask if you are having "your usual."  Nothing better reccommends a saloon (sorry, pub).

The food is not cusine, but is interesting, with sometimes outstanding specials, and is hearty.

Unusual for commercial San Francisco (as opposed to neighborhood places), you'll even sometimes get a drink comped.

Casual, nice staff, sometimes interesting guests, and reasonable.  What's not to like?
author: Tony F.

description: Nice dark atmosphere, great pub food.
author: Zak J.

description: For the amount of times I have been to this place I cannot believe I have yet to review it. I have even foolishly spent a St. Patricks day here (when I was younger and not as wise, of course). Every time I come here I have a good time. Even the last time when I was hiding in the corner nearly falling asleep in my water. Yes, that's right, water.....no it was not an impostor, it was really me! I figured if a red bull and coffee couldn't wake me up perhaps I shouldn't drink alcohol. Don't judge!! Anyhow, this place is, in very simple terms, warm and comfortable, if maybe in a slightly generic way. No pretension (though I could see this change with the rapid gentrification of SOMA), just a good place with good food, good drinks and good people. I only wish they did not write their specials on a chalkboard on the wall outside that some douchebag will deface to read boob balls by the end of the evening.
author: Drue C.

description: i used to live behind this bar (well not literally, but you get the idea) and we would come in here on occasion when we needed a break from the tempest bar.... nice irish pub. gets busy on the 'pub quiz' nights, but otherwise its quite laid back and the bartenders are nice. i've also eaten here a few times and the foods standard bar fare, but satisfying.
author: Michelle I.

description: i gotta say, not bad food for a pub. though not inexpensive, the quality of what you get is pretty high. randomly wandered in here with some co-workers on friday afternoon for lunch and was pleasantly surprised by the menu, with it's juicy lamb burgers and mahi taco specials. I've had the lamb burger twice now since, and both have been excellent, served on a cibatta-type roll with fries. the fries are nice and thick steak fries, no wimpy potatoes here. i've even been here for brunch now, too, and though my curry vegetable pie was just ok (needed to be spicier), it was hearty and did wonders for a hungover stomach. the traditional breakfast that my companions got looked pretty good, too. oh yeah, plus, they serve beer. happy hour starts at 4pm.
author: Tom H.

description: My friend and I tried the split-pea soup and the Guinness stew. Both were exceptionally salty and we immediately regretted ordering food. I think for a bar, they have a good food selection, perhaps we just weren't drunk (enough).
author: Matthew C.

description: This is a great place to enjoy a pint with well made pub food.  Recommend the  Lamb Burgers and Scotch Eggs.
author: MB H.

description:
the chieftan is the nearest possible place to my house (yep, we live down here) to grab some food/drink.  its proximity alone -- putting aside that it's so homey, has a terrific  beer selection, serves decent bar food, and is open whenever i want it to be -- gives me tremendous incentive to like the place.  and i do like it, very much.  there are a few of things that, if addressed, would make me (and possibly others out there) want to go there much  more often, though:  (1) i wish there was just one more salad option on the otherwise better-than-your-usual-bar menu -- i.e., "california"-style, more veggie-focused, with a light dressing, and lettuce that isn't iceberg.  (2) they need to do something about the fries -- they look terrific -- the plank-shaped, steak kind, well-browned and crispy (so far so good) -- but they have no flavor whatsoever.  none.  'cept maybe fryer grease flavor.  bleh.  but (3) it's not worth substituting the side salad for the fries, even though the upcharge is minimal, since it's just a bit of iceberg topped with a few carrot shreds and rings of raw onion (see #1).  

my husband loves his burger with a fried egg on it, and the smoked turkey/avocado sandwich is good.  one day i'll go waaaay off my diet and get the fish/chips (hopefully by then they'll have done something to improve the chips) or the cottage pie.  

service is typically friendly, although one evening earlier this week there was a new/different server (new to me, anyway) who was grouchy and unhelpful.
author: bug s.

description: a complete dive, but i love it. great great beer on tap, some good irish food and a nice dark irish atmosphere. a little cramped, but a great place to stop by for 1 or 7 beers.
author: David D.

description: i don't like sports bars. i'd rather watch my sports at home. when the chieftain is being a neighborhood pub instead of a sports bar it is pretty dern solid. in particular, their scotch selection is remarkable for an unassuming watering hole.
author: Clover Dan ..

description: i used to come here every tues night for trivia night, which is really fun.  if you place in the top 3, you get prizes or $ deducted off your bill!!  they have hoegaarden on tap here, which is a plus!!  my friend always got the shepperds pie when we came here, but i liked the chicken burger or the turkey/avocado sandwich.  their spinach salad is pretty good too!
author: Helen T.

description: Good, strong mixed drinks and generally friendly service, but I lost all respect for this place a few months back. I walked in, stood at the bar and was ignored for five minutes -- no, seriously, a good five minutes passed by -- while the young bartender guy, talking to the ONLY OTHER patron in the bar, rambled on and on about how 9/11 was an inside job and it was all Bush's fault. I suppose it was Bush's fault I left without buying a drink that day, too.
author: David M.

description: nice place ... the food, major whoops - brutal; straight from my comment card - salt is not a substitute for skill and cream is not a filler for soup!  if you are gonna charge prices and not pub prices then you better deliever or else!  i felt cheated!
author: tim y.

description: the garden burger i had was pretty good, but my chimay was expensive, compared to the irish bank (though i think i've seen chimay at this price elsewhere.)   i wish this place was a bit bigger, but i guess that can't be helped.  i'd like to go back to try more of the food one of these days.  it was a bit too sports-bar for my tastes, but seems like a good place for food/beer in that neighborhood.
author: Kate W.

description: My wife & I went to San Francisco, and as luck would have it, we stayed at the new Inter Continental San Francisco Hotel, because it's right across the street from Chieftain Irish Pub.  The service both on Friday night and Saturday during the day was excellent, the Shepherd's Pie was one of the best we've had, and their beer selection was amazing.  It's one of only a handful of places I know of that have Paulaner Hefeweizen on tap.  I highly recommend Chieftain Irish Pub!
author: Dave F.

description: $4 ice cold Bass on Tuesdays, friendly waitstaff and far better than average pub food.
author: jorge c.

description: Their Irish breakfast is amazing.  So's the cheiftain burger and the fish and chips... Great beer selection.  Wait staff recognizes you.  One complaint?  Sometimes service takes a while.  But I've never been forgotten about, it just gets crowded.
author: Maren G.

description: This little pub is a favorite of the Chronicle staff.  One of the only restaurants with decent buffalo wings in the city, and make sure to get the seafood chowder on Fridays - excellent!  Good beer selection and good specials each day.  My only warning - if there's a Rugby or Soccer game on, the place is mobbed by loud Europeans screaming at the game.  However, if you're looking for a hunky Irish or British man, then you may want to check it out on game days.
author: Lenore B.
